en: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:
hmr: Benjamin rama Anathotha um thiempuhai laia mi, Hilkia naupa Jeremia thuhai chu.

en: to whom the word of Jehovah came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
hmr: Ama kuoma chun Juda lal Amon naupa Josia hun lai, a rorêl a kum sâwm le pathum kum chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a,

en: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
hmr: Juda lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim hun lai, Juda lal Josia naupa Zedekia kum sâwm pakhat kum tâwp chen; Jerusalem sala ṭhuoihmanga a um a thla ngana chen chun a hung tlung zing a.

en: Now the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a:

en: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee, and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee; I have appointed thee a prophet unto the nations.
hmr: “Phîng sûnga ka siem hma che khawma ka hriet cheh a, Sula inthawka i hung suok hma khawma ka sukthieng ta cheh a: Hnamhai kuoma zâwlnei dingin ka lo thlang ta che a nih,” tiin.

en: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, I know not how to speak; for I am a child.
hmr: Chun, kei chun, “E, Lalpa PATHIEN, ngai ta, thu ka hril thei le; naupang el ka ni sih a,” ka tih a.

en: But Jehovah said unto me, Say not, I am a child; for to whomsoever I shall send thee thou shalt go, and whatsoever I shall command thee thou shalt speak.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun ka kuomah hieng hin a hril a: “Naupang el ka nih, ti naw rawh, Tu kuoma khawm ka tirna phawt che kuoma chun i fe ding a ni sih a; Thu ka pêk ang pei che chun thu hril bawk i tih.

en: Be not afraid because of them; for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Anni lei chun ṭi naw la, Nang chu sanhim ding chein i kuomah ka um sih a; LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Then Jehovah put forth his hand, and touched my mouth; and Jehovah said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth:
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun a kutin a hung ban a, ka bau chu a tâwk tah a; chun, LALPA chun ka kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, i baua chun ka thuhai chu ka sie tah,

en: see, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy and to overthrow, to build and to plant.
hmr: En ta, vawisûn hin, hnamhai chunga le ramhai chunga chun, Hrukbit ding le, sukchim ding le, Sukse ding le, Pei thla ding le, bâwl ding le Phun dingin ka sie ta che a nih,” a ta.

en: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond-tree.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a, “Jeremia, ieng am i hmuh a?” a mi tih a. Kei chun, “Almon thing hmawl ka hmu,” ka tih a.

en: Then said Jehovah unto me, Thou hast well seen: for I watch over my word to perform it.
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuomah, “I hmu ṭha ngawt el; ka thu chu sukpuitlinga um dingin ka tûng tlat a nih,” a ta.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a boiling caldron; and the face thereof is from the north.
hmr: Chun, a vawi hninaa chun LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a, “Ieng am i hmuh a?” tiin. Kei chun, “Sumbepui so lai ka hmuh a, chu hmai chu hmâr tienga inthawka hung ngha a nih,” ka tih a.

en: Then Jehovah said unto me, Out of the north evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Hmâr tienga inthawkin ram hluotu- hai po po chungah thil ṭha naw hung so suok a ta.

en: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith Jehovah; and they shall come, and they shall set every one his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against all the cities of Judah.
hmr: Ngai ta, hmâr tienga lalram sûngkuohai po po chu ka ko ding a ni si a, LALPA chun a tih; chun, hung an ta, mi tin chun Jerusalem dai kawt- khâr lûtnaa le a vêlsuokin kul bang- hai bula le, Juda khawpuihai po poa chun an lalṭhungpha chu hung innghat an tih.

en: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, and worshipped the works of their own hands.
hmr: Chun, an khawhlonahai thuah anni kalin ka rorêlnahai chu hrilsuok ka tih, kei mi mâksana, pathien danghai kuoma riminhnik rawh a, an kut sinthawhai ngei chu chibai an lo bûk ta leiin.

en: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at them, lest I dismay thee before them.
hmr: Chuleiin, nang chun i dier kei la, tho la, thu ka pêkhai po po che kha an kuomah hril rawh; annia chun beidawng naw la, chuong naw chun, an hmaa chun sukbeidawng rawi ka ti che.

en: For, behold, I have made thee this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and brazen walls, against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.
hmr: Ngai ta, vawisûn hin ram po po hmaah, Juda lalhai chunga le, chu- taka rorêltuhai chunga le, thiempu- hai chunga le, chu rama mipuihai po po chunga chun dârsen banghai, thîr sûtpuihai le khawpui kul neiah ka siem che hi.

en: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to deliver thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, do an ti cheh a; amiruokchu, hne naw ni hai che; nangma sanhim ding chein i kuom- ah ka um sih a, LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Hear ye the word which Jehovah speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
hmr: Aw Israel sûngkuo, LALPAIN i kuoma thu a hril chu lo ngai ta,

en: thus saith Jehovah, Learn not the way of the nations, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the nations are dismayed at them.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Hnamhai lampuihai chu inchûk naw la, chungtienga inchiknahaia chun lunginzîng el bawk naw rawh, hnam- hai chu chuonghaia chun an lungin- zîng hlak sih a.

en: For the customs of the peoples are vanity; for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman with the axe.
hmr: Hnamhai dânhai chu teplo mei mei an na; rama inthawkin thing an hang phûr thlûk a, themthiem mi chun a hreipuiin a chei a.

en: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
hmr: Chu chu tangkaruo le rângka- chakin an chei a; thîrkilnahaiin an sukdet a, tubauhai leh, chuongchun, ân hnîng thei nawh a;

en: They are like a palm-tree, of turned work, and speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good.
hmr: Leipuia vate ṭi milim ang an na, nisienlakhawm, an ṭawng nawh a; an fe thei naw leiin zâwn an ngai a. Anni chu ṭi naw la, thil suol khawm an thaw thei nawh a, annia chun thil ṭha thawna ding khawm a um bawk nawh.

en: There is none like unto thee, O Jehovah; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
hmr: Aw LALPA, nanga ang hi tu- khawm an um nawh, i ropuia, i hming chu thilthawtheinain a ropui bawk a.

en: Who should not fear thee, O King of the nations? for to thee doth it appertain; forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their royal estate, there is none like unto thee.
hmr: Aw hnamhai Laltak, tuin am ṭi nâwng an ti cheh a? Nang chun i phu hrim sih a, hnamhai laia mi var po po lai le, an lalram sûngahai chun, nang- a ang hrim tukhawm an um nawh.

en: But they are together brutish and foolish: the instruction of idols! it is but a stock.
hmr: Anni chu ngawngtak le invêt an na, milim inchûktirna chu thing bul el chu a nih.

en: There is silver beaten into plates, which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the artificer and of the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple for their clothing; they are all the work of skilful men.
hmr: Tangkaruo thlênghaia sut, Tar- sisa inthawka hung lâkhai le, Uphaza inthawka rângkachak, themthiem le rângkachak thîrsu kuthai sinthaw chu: a dum pâwl le a dum êm chu an thuom dingin, mi themthiemhai kutsuok vawng an nih.

en: But Jehovah is the true God; he is the living God, and an everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembleth, and the nations are not able to abide his indignation.
hmr: Amiruokchu, LALPA chau Pathien diktak chu a na, Pathien hring chu a na, chatuon lal a nih; a lunginsenna chun hnuoi chu ân thin a, a lungawi nawna chu hnamhai chun an tuor thei nawh.

en: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.
hmr: Hieng hin an kuoma chun hril i tih: hnuoi le vânhai siemtu ni lo pathienhai chu, chuonghai chu vân- khuphnuoia inthawk le leihnuoia inthawk chun bohmang an tih.

en: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and by his understanding hath he stretched out the heavens.
hmr: A thilthawtheina chun hnuoi chu a siem a, a varna chun khawvêl chu a lo tungding tah a, a hrietthiem- nahai chun vânhai khawm chu a lo keiphar tah a;

en: When he uttereth his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasuries.
hmr: a râwl a hung insuo pha chun vânhaia tuihai chu a hung phul a, leihnuoi tâwpnaa inthawk dâm chun tuihu chu ân kaitir a, ruo ta ding chun kâwlinlephai a siem a, a robâwmhaia inthawk chun thli chu a hung lâk suok a.

en: Every man is become brutish and is without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his graven image; for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
hmr: Mi tin el chu ngawngtak, hriet- na nei lo an na; rângkachak suttu tinhai khawm chu a milim kera siem lei chun sukzakin a um a; a milim sunghai chu khêlthu ngawt a na, an- nia chun inthuokna a um si nawh a.

en: They are vanity, a work of delusion: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
hmr: Thil teplo, sinthaw nuizatum an nih; hrem an ni pha chun bohmang an tih.

en: The portion of Jacob is not like these; for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance: Jehovah of hosts is his name.
hmr: Jakob chanvo chu hieng ang hi a ni ve nawh a; thil po pohai siemtu chu a na; Israel chu a rochan hnam a na; sipaihai LALPA chu a hming a nih.

en: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O thou that abidest in the siege.
hmr: Aw nang inhuola um, rama inthawk chun i thuomhnawhai chu la khâwm rawh.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Hieng ang huna hin ram hluotuhai chu the suok ka ta, an tuorna dingin anni chu sukrinum ka tih.

en: Woe is me because of my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is my grief, and I must bear it.
hmr: Ka natna lei chun ka chung a va rik de! ka hliemna chu a nasa hle a; nisienlakhawm, “Indiktakin hi hi ka natna chu a na, ka tuor ding hrim a nih,” ka tih a.

en: My tent is destroyed, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth from me, and they are not: there is none to spread my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
hmr: Ka puon in chu suksiet a ni tah a; ka hruihai po po khawm suktan an ni tah a; ka nauhai khawm chu keimaa inthawkin an fe hmang a, an um ta nawh a; ka puon in keiphar nâwk ding tukhawm an um ta nawh a, ka puonzârhai zâr ding leh.

en: For the shepherds are become brutish, and have not inquired of Jehovah: therefore they have not prospered, and all their flocks are scattered.
hmr: Berâmpuhai hlak chu an ngawng êm a, LALPA chu an râwn si nawh a; chuleiin, an hlawtling nawh a, an berâm ruolhai po po chu an indar zo a.

en: The voice of tidings, behold, it cometh, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah a desolation, a dwelling-place of jackals.
hmr: Thuthang râwl chu, ngai ta, a hung mêk a nih, Juda ram chu râusan le sihalhai chêngna hmuna siem dingin hmâr ram tienga inthawk buoina nasatak a hung mêk a nih.

en: O Jehovah, I know that the way of man is not in himself; it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
hmr: Aw LALPA, mihriem lampui chu amaa chun a um nawh ti ka hriet a; a kepênhai sukdik dingin mihriem- a chun infetirtu chu a um nawh.

en: O Jehovah, correct me, but in measure; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
hmr: Aw LALPA, mi sukdik la, ami- ruokchu, rorêlnain, i lunginsennain ni loin, chuong naw chun iengkhawm ni loin mi siem rawi i tih.

en: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name; for they have devoured Jacob, yea, they have devoured him and consumed him, and have laid waste his habitation.
hmr: Khawhri be mi, nang hre lohai chunga le, hnam nangma hming lam ngailohai chunga chun i ṭiumna chu bunthla la, Jakob chu an fâk zo sih a; anih, ama chu an fâk zo a, an kâng- hmang dêr a, a umna khawm chu an suksiet a.

en: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chun:

en: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
hmr: “Hi thuthlung thuhai hi lo ngai la, Juda rama mihai le Jerusalem hluotuhai kuoma chun hril rawh;

en: and say thou unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man that heareth not the words of this covenant,
hmr: chun, an kuoma chun hieng hin hril la; Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Hi thuthlung thuhai hre lo mi chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se:

en: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God;
hmr: Aigupta ram, thîr sutna pûm meia inthawka anni ka ṭhuoi suok laia, ‘Ka râwl ngai unla, thaw ro, chuongchun, ka mihai nîng in ta, kei khawm in Pathien nîng ka tih,’ tia in thlatuhai kuoma thu ka lo pêk tah thuhai chu.

en: that I may establish the oath which I sware unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day. Then answered I, and said, Amen, O Jehovah.
hmr: hi vawisûn nia anga hi, nenetui le khuoizua luong ram anni pe dinga ka lo tiem ta chu, in thlatuhai kuoma ka ṭawng inkhâmna chu ka sukpui- tling theina dingin,” tiin. Chun, kei chun “Amen, aw LALPA,” tiin ka dawn a.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah; Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai po po le, Juda khawpuiahai po po chun hienga hril hin va phuong rawh: Hieng thuthlung thuhai hi ngai unla, thaw ro.

en: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka anni ka hung ṭhuoi suok nia inthawk tah vawisûn ni chen khawm hin. “Ka râwl chu awi ro,” tia hrila, inhmataka thoa, anni chu inhriettirin, in thlatu- hai chu ṭhahnemngaitakin ka lo inhriettir tah a.

en: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the stubbornness of their evil heart: therefore I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an awi nawh a, an na khawm an sit bawk nawh a, amiruokchu, mi tin chu mâni lungril ngarna ang pei chun an fe lem a; chuleiin, an chunga chun hi thu- thlung thuhai po po hi ka hung intlungtir a, chuong chu thaw dingin thu ka pêk a, nisienlakhawm, an thaw nawh a,’ tiin.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Juda rama mihai laia le, Jerusalema chênghai laia chun phierrûkna hmuin a um a nih.

en: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words; and they are gone after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
hmr: An thlatuhai ka thu khawm ngai nuom lohai suolna tienga chun an kîr nâwk tah a nih; an rawngbâwl dingin an pathienhai hnung chu an zui a; an thlatuhai le ka lo siem tah ka thuthlung chu Israel sûngkuo le Juda sûngkuo hin an lo bawsiet ta a ni hi.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and they shall cry unto me, but I will not hearken unto them.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, an chungah thil ṭha naw, an pumpel thei dêr lo ding chu ka hung intlungtir ding a nih; ka kuomah hung khêk an ta, nisienla- khawm, anni chu lo ngai naw ning ah.

en: Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto which they offer incense: but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
hmr: Chun, Juda khawpuihai le, Jerusalem hluotuhai chu, riminhnik an inhlânna pathienhai kuoma chun fêng an ta, ko an tih; nisienlakhawm, chuonga an buoi lai huna chun anni chu sandam ngai hrim hrim naw ni hai.

en: For according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
hmr: Aw Juda, i khawpui ni zât ang pei el chun i pathienhai chu an um sih a; Jerusalem kawtthlêr zât zâtin inzâpuiumtakin mâichâmhai, Baal kuoma riminhnik rawna ding ngei chu, i lo siem ta bawk a.

en: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me because of their trouble.
hmr: Chuleiin, hi hnam ta ding hin hni naw la, an ta dingin hnina ama- nih, râwl amanih insuo bawk naw rawh, an buoinaa dinga ka kuoma an khêk pha khawm chun anni chu ka ngai naw ding a ni sih a.

en: What hath my beloved to do in my house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
hmr: Thil tirdakumtak chu thaw zing si chun, ka hmangaitak chun ka inah chan ieng am a nei ta leh? Intiem- kamna le saserhai chun in sietna ding ân pumpeltir thei ding am a nih? Chuong a ni chun in hlim thei ding am a nih?

en: Jehovah called thy name, A green olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
hmr: LALPA chun i hming a sak a, Oliv thing hring, ra ṭhatak le mawi a ti che a, buoina nasatak ri chun a chunga chun mei a sem a, a kauhai chu a tliek tah a.

en: For Jehovah of hosts, who planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense unto Baal.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, nangni phun- tu cheu chun Israel sûngkuo le Juda sûngkuoin Baal hmaa riminhnikhai inhlân a, mi suklungsen dinga anni ta dinga thilsuol an lo thaw ta leiin i chungah thil ṭha naw chu a hril lang tah a nih.

en: And Jehovah gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it: then thou showedst me their doings.
hmr: LALPA chun chu chu a mîn hriettir a, ka hriet ngei a; chun, nang chun an thilthawhai chu i mîn entir a.

en: But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, berâmte zai- nêm a thattu hmaa ṭhuoia um ang chu ka na, “Thing chu chutaka a ra le chun suksieng ei ta, ama chu mi hring rama inthawk chun sât thlâng ei ta, a hming chu hriet zing a ni nawna dingin,” tia, ka chunga thu phierrûk an phier khawm chu ka lo hriet nawh a.

en: But, O Jehovah of hosts, who judgest righteously, who triest the heart and the mind, I shall see thy vengeance on them; for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw sipaihai LALPA, indiktaka rorêltu, lungril le hrietnahai fietu, anni chunga i phubalâkna chu mîn hmutir rawh; nangma kuoma chu ka thu chun ka hung târlang sih a.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of Jehovah, that thou die not by our hand;
hmr: Chuleiin, i hringna lâk tumtu Anathoth mihai chungthua chun LALPA chun hieng hin a tih; anni chun, “Kan kuta i thi nawna dingin LALPA hming chun thu hril naw rawh,” an ta;

en: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;
hmr: chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: “Ngai ta, anni chu ka hrem ding a nih; tlangvâlhai chu kâwlhnâmah thîng an ta, an naupasalhai le an naunuhmeihai chu ṭâmin thîng an tih;

en: and there shall be no remnant unto them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
hmr: anni laia tukhawm hla um naw ni hai; Anathoth mihai chunga chun thil ṭha naw, anni hung hremna kum chu ka hung intlungtir ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: Righteous art thou, O Jehovah, when I contend with thee; yet would I reason the cause with thee: wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they at ease that deal very treacherously?
hmr: Aw LALPA, nang chu ka hung ngên lai che chun, i fel a, nangma le chun a san chu ei ngaituo tlâng a, mi rilo lampui chu ieng dinga a hlawtling hlak a, khawhlotaka thawtuhai po po chu nuomsaa um am an na?

en: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root; they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their heart.
hmr: Nang chun anni chu i phun tah a, anih, zung khawm an kei a; an hung inṭhang a, ra khawm an hung ra tah a; an baua chun nang chu i hla naw hleh a, an sûnga ruok chu i hla a nih.

en: But thou, O Jehovah, knowest me; thou seest me, and triest my heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw LALPA, nang chun i mi hriet a, i mi hmuh a, nanga tienga chun ka lungril chu i fieh a, sathattu ta dinga berâmhai ang chun kei suok la, thatna ding nia ang chun anni chu buotsai rawh.

en: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole country wither? for the wickedness of them that dwell therein, the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our latter end.
hmr: Ieng chen am ram chun sûnin, ram pumpui hlohnahai chu a vuoi ding a na? chutaka an rîtlona um zing lei chun, ramsahai le vatehai khawm chu an bohmang a, “Ei ni hnungtieng tâwpna chu hmu naw ni,” an ti leiin.

en: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and though in a land of peace thou art secure, yet how wilt thou do in the pride of the Jordan?
hmr: Kea lâwn mihai leh in tlân a, an suksâwl hle che chun, sakawrhai le chun iengtin am inel thei i ta? Muong- na rama hman i tlu chun, Jordan ramngawa chun iengtin am thâwng i ta?

en: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; even they have cried aloud after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
hmr: I unauhai le i pa sûngkuo ngei chun, i chungah khawhlotakin an lo thaw tah a; i hnunga chun an hung khêk rak rak a; anni chu ring naw rawh, i kuoma chun thu ṭhatakhai hril hai sien khawm.

en: I have forsaken my house, I have cast off my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
hmr: Ka in chu ka mâksan tah a, ka rohluona khawm chu ka pei thlâk a, ka thlain a hmangai dittak chu a hmêlmahai kuomah ka pêk tah a.

en: My heritage is become unto me as a lion in the forest: she hath uttered her voice against me; therefore I have hated her.
hmr: Ka rochan khawm chu ka ta ding chun ramhnuoia sakeibaknei ang a lo ni tah a; ka chunga chun a râwl chu a mîn suo khum a; chuleiin, ama chu ka theida a nih.

en: Is my heritage unto me as a speckled bird of prey? are the birds of prey against her round about? go ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, bring them to devour.
hmr: Ka rochan chu ka ta ding chun vate ṭiel sa fa mi ang a ni a ni ta maw? A sîr vêl tina chun vate sa fa mihai chu an um a ni maw? Nang va fe la, ramhnuoia ramsahai po po chu kei khâwm la, fa zo dingin hung ṭhuoi rawh.

en: Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
hmr: Berâmpu tamtakhai chun ka grêp huon chu an suksiet a, ka chan chu an ke hnuoiah an sirde a, ka chan inhawitak chu thlalêr ram râusanah an siem tah a.

en: They have made it a desolation; it mourneth unto me, being desolate; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.
hmr: Râusanah an siem tah a; râu- sana umin ka kuoma chun a ṭap a; mi tukhawma lungril a an sie naw leiin ram pumpui chu râusana siem a ni tah a.

en: Destroyers are come upon all the bare heights in the wilderness; for the sword of Jehovah devoureth from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh hath peace.
hmr: Thlalêra bâwlhmun tlângahai po po chun suksetuhai chu an hung a, ram pakhat tâwpa inthawka ram dang tâwp chen chun LALPA kâwl- hnâm chun a fâk zo a, tisa hrimin muongna an nei nawh.

en: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, and profit nothing: and ye shall be ashamed of your fruits, because of the fierce anger of Jehovah.
hmr: Bu an chîng a, hling an sîk a; anni chu an insukna a, nisienla- khawm, iengkhawm a hlawk nawh, LALPA lunginsenna ṭiumtak lei chun i rahai chu inzapui i tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah against all mine evil neighbors, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: Behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
hmr: Ka tuolbâwm rilohai po po, ka mi Israelhai hluo dinga ka ti lo tâwk- setu chunga chun LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, an rama inthawk chun anni chu hmalthlâng ka ta, anni laia inthawk chun Juda sûngkuo chu hmalthlâng ka tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them up, I will return and have compassion on them; and I will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
hmr: Anni ka hmalthlâk hnunga chun hung kîr nâwk ka ta, an chung- ah lunginsietna nei ka tih; chun, mi tin chu mâni rochan senga chun hung ṭhuoi nâwk ka ta, mi tin chu mâni ram senga chun.

en: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, As Jehovah liveth; even as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built up in the midst of my people.
hmr: Chun, Baal kuoma ṭawng in- khâm dinga ka mihai an inchûktir anga, “LALPA chu a hring zing angin,” tia, ka hminga ṭawng inkhâm dinga, ka mihai lampuihai chu taima- taka an inchûk chun, ka mihai laia chun anni khawm chu siempuitling nîng an tih.

en: But if they will not hear, then will I pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, an ngai naw chun, chu hnam chu hmalthlâng ka ta, hmalthlain suksieng ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah unto me, Go, and buy thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuomah hieng hin a tih: “Fe la, puon zai inhmi hrên i ta dingin inchaw la, i kâwngah hrên la, tuia chun sukhu naw rawh,” a ta.

en: So I bought a girdle according to the word of Jehovah, and put it upon my loins.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA thu ang chun hrên chu kân châwk a, ka kâwnga chun ka hrên tah a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying,
hmr: Chun, a vawi hninaah LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a;

en: Take the girdle that thou hast bought, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.
hmr: “I kâwnga um hrên închâwk kha la la, tho la, Euphrates vadunga chun fe la, chutaka chun lungpui kuoah va thup rawh,” tiin.

en: So I went, and hid it by the Euphrates, as Jehovah commanded me.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka feh a, Euphrates vadung sîra chun ka thup tah a, LALPAIN thu a mi pêk ang tak chun.

en: And it came to pass after many days, that Jehovah said unto me, Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take the girdle from thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.
hmr: Chun, ni tam tak hnunga chun LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Tho la, Euphrates vadunga khan va fe la, chutaka inthawk chun, thup dinga thu ka pêk che, kha hrên kha va la rawh,” a ta.

en: Then I went to the Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it; and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.
hmr: Euphrates vadunga chun ka va fe a, ka cho a, ka thupna hmuna in- thawk chun hrên chu ka lâk tah a; chun, ngai ta, hrên chu a lo inek tah a; iengakhawm ṭhangkai a ni ta nawh a.

en: Then the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuom- ah a hung tlung a, LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih:

en: Thus saith Jehovah, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
hmr: Hieng ang tak hin Juda chapona le, Jerusalem chapona nasatak chu suksieng ka tih.

en: This evil people, that refuse to hear my words, that walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and are gone after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is profitable for nothing.
hmr: Hi hnam suol ka thu ngai nuom loa, an lungril ngarna anga fea, an rawng bâwl dinga pathien danghai chu zuia, anni chibai bûktuhai hi hi hrên ienga khawma ṭhangkai ta lo ang hi nîng an tih.

en: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith Jehovah; that they may be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.
hmr: Hrên chu mi kâwnga a kawp angin, Juda sûngkuo po po le Israel sûngkuo po po chu keimaa kawp dingin ka lo thaw tah a, LALPA chun a tih: keia ta dinga mihai an nih a, hming an nih a, inpâkna an nih a, ropuina an ni theina dingin, nisien- lakhawm, an ngai si nawh a.

en: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?
hmr: Chuleiin, an kuoma chun hi thu hi hril i tih: LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Savunpeng tin chu uoina suksip nîng a ta, chun, i kuoma chun, “Savunpeng tin chu uoina suksip nîng a tih, ti hi kan hriet naw a ni maw?” tîng an ta.

en: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings that sit upon David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
hmr: Nang chun an kuoma chun, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, hi ram hluotuhai hi, lalhai David lalṭhungpha chunga ṭhunghai le, thiempuhai le, zâwlneihai le, Jerusa- lem hluotuhai po po chu inruinain ka suksip ding a nih.

en: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith Jehovah: I will not pity, nor spare, nor have compassion, that I should not destroy them.
hmr: Anni chu inbawtuotir ka ta, pahai le an naupasalhai ngei chu inbawtuong an tih, LALPA chun a tih; lunginsiet naw ning a, hla naw ning a, hmangaina khawm nei naw ning a, anni chu ka sukbohmang nawna dingin, iengkhawmin mi dâl naw ni.

en: Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud; for Jehovah hath spoken.
hmr: Ngai unla, in nahai daw ro; chapo naw ro, LALPA chun a hril ta sih a.

en: Give glory to Jehovah your God, before he cause darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains, and, while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross darkness.
hmr: Tlâng inthimhai chunga in kehai chu ân sui hmain le, inthim ân umtir hma hin LALPA in Pathien chu chawimawina pe ro; chun, a var in zawng lai chun, ama chun thina hlimah ân changtir a, inthim nasatak el chu a siem tah a.

en: But if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret for your pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because Jehovah’s flock is taken captive.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, in ngai naw chun, in chapona lei chun ka thla chu inrûkin ṭap a tih; LALPA berâm ruol chu sala man an ni tâk leiin ka mit chu rinum titakin ṭap a ta, mitthliin luong thlâng a tih.

en: Say thou unto the king and to the queen-mother, Humble yourselves, sit down; for your headtires are come down, even the crown of your glory.
hmr: Lal kuoma le a nu kuoma chun hril la: “Inngaitlâwm unla, ṭhung ro, in lukâwmhai chu a hung inhnuoi tah a, in ropuina lallukhum ngei chu.

en: The cities of the South are shut up, and there is none to open them: Judah is carried away captive, all of it; it is wholly carried away captive.
hmr: Sim ram khawpuihai chu khâr- in an um tah a, a hawng ding tu- khawm an um nawh; Juda chu a rêngin sala ṭhuoiin a um a: a rêng a ramin sala ṭhuoiin a um a nih,” tiin.

en: Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north: where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?
hmr: I mithai kha hang inlên la, hmâr tienga inthawka hunghai saw en ta, i berâm ruol, nanga kuoma pêka um, i berâm ruol mawitak el kha khâwlai am a um a?

en: What wilt thou say, when he shall set over thee as head those whom thou hast thyself taught to be friends to thee? shall not sorrows take hold of thee, as of a woman in travail?
hmr: Nangma kal zawngin anni chu ân chûktir a nih ti hrein, i ruolhai chu i chungah luah a sie pha chun ieng am hril tâng i ta? Nuhmei nauhase nat tuor angin nang chu lungngaina chun a man ding che a ni nâwm a nih?

en: And if thou say in thy heart, Wherefore are these things come upon me? for the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts uncovered, and thy heels suffer violence.
hmr: I lungril chun, “Hieng thilhai hi iengtiziea ka chunga hung tlung am a na?” i ti a ni thei a; i suolna tam êm lei chun i fênthuo chu hlîm a na, suol- luina i tuok a nih.

en: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.
hmr: Ethiopia mi chun a vun chu a thlengin, keitê khawma a zie chu a thleng thei am a nih? Thil ṭha naw thaw ngaia hmanghai hin thil ṭha chu in thaw ding am a nih?

en: Therefore will I scatter them, as the stubble that passeth away, by the wind of the wilderness.
hmr: Chuleiin, thlalêra thliin busi a lên hmang hlak angin anni chu sukdar ka tih.

en: This is thy lot, the portion measured unto thee from me, saith Jehovah; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.
hmr: Hi hi i chan tâwk, keima kuoma inthawka, i chan dinga ruot chu a nih; LALPA chun a tih; kei i mi theinghil tah a, thil dik lo chu i lo ring ta lei khan.

en: Therefore will I also uncover thy skirts upon thy face, and thy shame shall appear.
hmr: Chuleiin, kei khawma i fênthuo chu i hmai chunga chun hlîm ka ta, i înzapui chu inlang a tih.

en: I have seen thine abominations, even thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, on the hills in the field. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! thou wilt not be made clean; how long shall it yet be?
hmr: Ramhnuoi muol chunghaia i châkna hurna, i în hrâmnahai, i uire- nahai, i tirdakumnahai chu ka hmuh a. Aw Jerusalem, i chung a va rik de! sukthieng i ni âwm si nawh a, ieng chen am a la ni ding chu aw?

en: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought.
hmr: Khawinṭhâl chungthua Jere- mia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu:

en: Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish, they sit in black upon the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.
hmr: Juda chun a sûn a; chutaka a dai kawtkhârhai khawm chu an ṭâwp zo a, hnuoi chunga chun a duma inbelin ân ṭhung a; Jerusalem khêk ri chu chungtieng a feh a.

en: And their nobles send their little ones to the waters: they come to the cisterns, and find no water; they return with their vessels empty; they are put to shame and confounded, and cover their heads.
hmr: A miṭhahai chun an nauhai chu tui chawi dingin an tir a, khurahai chun an hung a, tui hlak an hmu nawh a; an tuitheihai chu a ruokin an kîr a, an inzakin an buoi a, an luhai chu an inkhum a.

en: Because of the ground which is cracked, for that no rain hath been in the land, the plowmen are put to shame, they cover their heads.
hmr: Rama chun ruotui a um si nawh a, leihnuoi beidawngumtak lei chun hnuoi inlettuhai chu an inzak a, an luhai an khum a.

en: Yea, the hind also in the field calveth, and forsaketh her young, because there is no grass.
hmr: Anih, sazukpui khawm rama chun ân teh a, hlohna a um naw leiin a tê chu a mâksan a.

en: And the wild asses stand on the bare heights, they pant for air like jackals; their eyes fail, because there is no herbage.
hmr: Ram sabengtunghai khawm chu tlâng sâng chungahai chun an ngîr a, sihalhai angin thli an dawng a, hlo pet ding a um naw leiin an mit ân thim a.

en: Though our iniquities testify against us, work thou for thy name’s sake, O Jehovah; for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.
hmr: Kan suolnahai chun keini a mi hêk khawma, Aw LALPA, i hming leiin nangin sin thaw la, kan hnung- tawlnahai chu a tam hle ta sih a; i chunga chun thil kan lo suksuol ta a nih.

en: O thou hope of Israel, the Saviour thereof in the time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a sojourner in the land, and as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?
hmr: Aw nang Israel beisei, buoina hun laia sandamtu, hi rama hin ieng dingin am mikhuol ang chau, zân khat riek dinga inzin mi puon in zartu ang el chu nîng i ta?

en: Why shouldest thou be as a man affrighted, as a mighty man that cannot save? Yet thou, O Jehovah, art in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; leave us not.
hmr: Ieng dingin am mi maktia um, mi thilthawtheitak sandam thei silo ang chu nîng i ta? Nang chu, Aw LALPA, keini lai hin i um a, i hming chawia ko kan na; keini mi mâksan naw rawh.

en: Thus saith Jehovah unto this people, Even so have they loved to wander; they have not refrained their feet: therefore Jehovah doth not accept them; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.
hmr: LALPA chun hi mihai chung- thua chun hieng hin a tih: Invâk invâk hi an nuom zâwngtak a lo ni tah a: an kehai khawm an thunun nawh a; chuleiin, LALPA chun anni chu a pawm nawh a; tuhin an suol- nahai chu hre zing a ta, an suolhai lei chun anni chu hrem a tih.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, Pray not for this people for their good.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuoma chun, “Hi hnam ta ding hin an ṭhatna dingin ṭawngṭaipêk naw rawh.

en: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt-offering and meal-offering, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.
hmr: Bu an nghei pha khawm, an khêkri chu ngai naw ning a; in- thâwina le pumrawhmang thilinhlân an inhlân pha khawm pawmpêk naw ningah; amiruokchu, anni chu kâwl- hnâm le, ṭâm le hripuiin sukbohmang lem ka tih” a ta.

en: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.
hmr: Chun, kei chun, “Aw LALPA Pathien, ngai ta, zâwlneihai chun an kuoma chun, ‘Kâwlhnâmhai chu hmu ngai naw ti niu a, ṭâm khawm nei ngai naw ti niu a, amiruokchu, hi hmuna hin thlamuongna diktak chu pêng ka ti cheu,’ an lo tipêk hlak a,” ka tih a;

en: Then Jehovah said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name; I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake I unto them: they prophesy unto you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their own heart.
hmr: chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah a hril a, “Zâwlneihai chun ka hmingin thukhêlhai an hril a; anni chu ka tir nawh a, thu khawm ka pêk nawh a, an kuoma khawm thu ka hril bawk nawh; in kuoma chun thil hmulâwk indik nawhai, khawhri zâwl thuhai, thil iengkhawm ni lo, an lungrila thukhêl chu an hril lem hlak a.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land: By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka hminga zâwlnei thuhriltuhai chungthua chun, LAL- PA chun hieng hin a tih: anni chu ka tir nawh a; amiruokchu, hi rama hin kâwlhnâm le ṭâm tla naw ni, tituhai, chuong zâwlneihai chu kâwlhnâm le ṭâmin sukbohmang nîng an tih.

en: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them—them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
hmr: Chun, chuong mipuihai an thuhrilnahai chu ṭâmna le kâwlhnâm leiin Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai chun pei suokin um an ta; anni phûmtu ding tukhawm nei naw ni hai, anni leh, an nuhmeihai le an naupasalhai, an naunuhmeihai leh; anni chunga chun an rîtlona chu ka bunthlâk ding a ni sih a.

en: And thou shalt say this word unto them, Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease; for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous wound.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun hieng thu hi hril rawh: Sûn le zâna khawm ka mithai chu mitthliin luong thla raw se; ma lo tawpin; ka chipui naunu inthieng chu hliemna nasatakin, pawpna nasataka suknawiin a um a.

en: If I go forth into the field, then, behold, the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then, behold, they that are sick with famine! for both the prophet and the priest go about in the land, and have no knowledge.
hmr: Ramhnuoiah ka va fe leh, kâwl- hnâma thihai hmu a na! khawpui sûng ka lût leh, ṭâmnaa na tuorhai hmu a na! zâwlneihai le thiempuhai chu ram sûnga chun an invâk vêl a, hrietna nei si loin,” tiin.

en: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul loathed Zion? why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!
hmr: Juda chu i hnâwl pumhlûm dêr am a nih? I thla chun Zion chu a tirdak am a nih? Iengdinga nangin i mi hrema, kan ta dinga sukdamna um lo am a na? Inremna kan enkai a, nisienlakhawm, thil ṭha hrim a hung tlung nawh a; sukdamna ding huna khawm chun lunginzîngna hmu a nih!

en: We acknowledge, O Jehovah, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against thee.
hmr: Aw LALPA, kan suolnahai ka hung inhriettir a, kan thlatuhai suolna leh; nangma chunga chun thil kan lo suksuol ta sih a.

en: Do not abhor us, for thy name’s sake; do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: remember, break not thy covenant with us.
hmr: Nangma hming leiin keini chu mi hmusit naw la, i ropuina lalṭhung- pha chu sukhmaimâwk naw rawh; keini le i thuthlung kha hre zing la, sukse naw rawh.

en: Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? art not thou he, O Jehovah our God? therefore we will wait for thee; for thou hast made all these things.
hmr: Khawhri be mihai teplohai lai chun ruo insûrtir thei hrim an um am? Annawleh, vânhai chun ruohai chu a pêk thei am a nih? Aw LALPA kan Pathien, nang chu ama chu i ni a ni naw maw? Chuleiin, nangma chu nghâk zing kan ti che, hieng thilhai po po hi i siem sih a.

en: Then said Jehovah unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuom- ah, “Mosie le Samuel chu ka hmaah ngîr ta hai sienla khawm, ka lungril chu hi hnam tienga hin ân hêm thei nawh; ka mithmua in- thawkin hnawt suok la, anni chu infe suoktir rawh.

en: And it shall come to pass, when they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith Jehovah: Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for captivity, to captivity.
hmr: Chun, i kuoma chun, ‘Khawtieng am kan fe ding a na?’ an ti pha chun anni chu hi hi hril i tih: ‘LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Thina ta dinghai chu thinaah, kâwlhnâm ta dinghai chu kâwlhnâmah; ṭâmna ta dinghai chu ṭâmnaah; sala intângna ta dinghai chu salah,’ tîng i tih.

en: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith Jehovah: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the birds of the heavens, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and to destroy.
hmr: Chun, an chunga tlung dingin thil chi li ruot ka ta; LALPA chun a tih: kâwlhnâm chu sukhlum dingin, uihai chu keinawitu dingin, chun, chunglêng vatehai le hnuoia ramsa- hai chu fa zotu ding le suksetu dingin.

en: And I will cause them to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, anni chu, Juda lal Hezekia naupa Manasse Jerusalema a thil- thawhai lei khan, hnuoi chunga lalram po pohai laia chun hmatieng hnungtienga hnawtlêng dingin inumtir ka tih.

en: For who will have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who will bemoan thee? or who will turn aside to ask of thy welfare?
hmr: Aw Jerusalem, tuin am i chungah lunginsietna nei a ta? Tuin am an sûn ding che a ni leh? Annawleh, i ham- ṭhatna ding thu hni dingin tu am hnungkîr an ta?

en: Thou hast rejected me, saith Jehovah, thou art gone backward: therefore have I stretched out my hand against thee, and destroyed thee; I am weary with repenting.
hmr: Nang chun i mi lo hnâwl ta a, LALPA chun a tih: hnungtieng i lo fe tah a; chuleiin, i chungah ka kut kân let a, ka suksiet che a nih; lunginsietna inlangtir hi ka nghawk ta a nih.

en: And I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land; I have bereaved them of children, I have destroyed my people; they returned not from their ways.
hmr: Chu ram dai kawtkhârahai chun anni chu hmaizâpin ka zâp a; an nauhai chu ka lâk hmangpêk tâwl a; ka mihai chu ka suksiet tah a; an lampuihaia inthawk chun an lamlêt chuong nawh.

en: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas; I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday: I have caused anguish and terrors to fall upon her suddenly.
hmr: Tuisuorieta phaiphin nêk hman- in an hmeithaihai chu ka sukpung lem a, sûn changlai chun nuhai le tlangvâlhai chunga chun suksetu ka hung intlungtir a, amânu chunga chun ṭitnahai le lunginzîngnahai kân tlâktir thut a.

en: She that hath borne seven languisheth; she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day; she hath been put to shame and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Nau pasari neitunu chu a chau tah a, a chau let dêr a; sûn a ni lai chun a nisa chu a tla tah a; ama chu ân zakin a hamhai a; chun, anni a la mahlahai chu an hmêlmahai kuomah kâwlhnâmah pêng ka tih,” LALPA chun a tih.

en: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not lent, neither have men lent to me; yet every one of them doth curse me.
hmr: Nu, ka chung a va rik de! hnuoi chung po poa insêl mi le inkhing mia i mi lo nei hi chu! a pung umin kân pûktir ngai nawh a, kei khawm tu- khawma a pung umin an mîn pûktir bawk nawh; amiruokchu, an rêng elin ṭawngsie an mi lân phur ta rawp hi.

en: Jehovah said, Verily I will strengthen thee for good; verily I will cause the enemy to make supplication unto thee in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Titakzetin, thil ṭhaa dingin sukdet ka ti cheh a; titak- zetin, tuor lai huna le thil ṭha naw hung tlung huna chun i hmêlmahai chun i kuoma hnina siem dingin inumtir ka tih,” a tih.

en: Can one break iron, even iron from the north, and brass?
hmr: Miin thîr, hmârtienga thîr le dârsen chu a sukthliek thei ding am a nih?

en: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give for a spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
hmr: I ramrihai po poa chun, i suolhai po poa ding chun, i thuomhnaw le i rohai chu man boa râllâk sum dingin pêng ka tih.

en: And I will make them to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not; for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
hmr: Chun, i hmêlmahai le ram i hriet ngai nawa chun infetir ka ti cheh a, ka lunginsen chun mei chu sêm a na, i chungah chawk kumkhuong a tih.

en: O Jehovah, thou knowest; remember me, and visit me, and avenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered reproach.
hmr: Aw LALPA, nang chun i hriet a; mi hre zing la, mi hung sir la, a mi hremtuhai chu phuba hung la rawh; i teireingaitheina chun mi la hmang naw la, nangma lei chun kâwkna ka tuor a ni ti hre rawh.

en: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy words were unto me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart: for I am called by thy name, O Jehovah, God of hosts.
hmr: I thuhai chu hmu suok a ni tah a; chuong chu ka fâk a; chuongchun, i thuhai chu ka lungrila hlimna le, ka ta dinga lâwmna a nih; Aw LALPA sipaihai Pathien, i hming chawia ko ka ni sih a.

en: I sat not in the assembly of them that make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand; for thou hast filled me with indignation.
hmr: Hlimna siema inkhâwmhai laia chun ka ṭhung nawh a, ka hlim bawk naw a; i kut lei chun makhât chauin ka ṭhung a; lunginzîngna nasatak chun i mi suksip ta sih a.

en: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou indeed be unto me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail?
hmr: Iengleiin am ka natna hi a re hlek nawh a, sukdam nuom dêr lo ang ela ka hliemna hi sukdam thei loa um am an nih a? Ka ta ding hin vadungte hlêmhmang, tuihai kang hlak ang chu in ni tak tak ding am a nih?

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, that thou mayest stand before me; and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: they shall return unto thee, but thou shalt not return unto them.
hmr: Chuleichun, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: I hung kîr chun, ka hmaa i ngîr theina dingin hung ṭhuoi nâwk ka ti che; mi suolhaia inthawka thil hluhai i lâk suok chun, ka bau ang nîng i ta; anni chu i kuomah hung kîr an ta, nang ruok chu an kuom tieng kîr naw ti nih.

en: And I will make thee unto this people a fortified brazen wall; and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, hi hnam ta ding hin dârsen bang kulah siem ka ti cheh a; nang chu hung do hlak an ti cheh a, nisienlakhawm, hne ngai naw ni hai che; sandam ding le sansuok ding chein i kuomah ka um zing sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
hmr: Mi rilohai kuta inthawk chun sansuok ka ti cheh a, thil ṭium kuta inthawk chun intlansuok bawk ka ti che.

en: The word of Jehovah came also unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a;

en: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters, in this place.
hmr: “Nuhmei nei naw ti nih a, hi hmuna hin naupasalhai, naunuhmei- hai khawm nei bawk naw ti nih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land:
hmr: Hi hmuna pieng naupasalhai chungthu dâm, naunuhmeihai chungthu dâm, hi ram anni chawitu an nu chungthu dâm, anni neitu an pa chungthu dâm chu LALPA chun hieng hin a lo hril ta sih a;

en: They shall die grievous deaths: they shall not be lamented, neither shall they be buried; they shall be as dung upon the face of the ground; and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their dead bodies shall be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.
hmr: Thina lungngaiumtakin thîng an ta, ṭa khawm ṭa ni naw ni hai a, phûm khawm phûm ni naw ni hai; leihnuoi chunga êkdûr ang chau nîng an ta, ṭâmna le kâwlhnâm chun anni chu fâkzoin um an tih; chun, an ruonghai chu chunglêng vatehai le hnuoi chunga ramsahai ta dinga bu nîng a tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament, neither bemoan them; for I have taken away my peace from this people, saith Jehovah, even lovingkindness and tender mercies.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Lusûn ina chun lût naw unla, ṭa dingin fe bawk naw unla, anni chu sûn bawk naw ro; hi hnama inthawk hin ka thlamuongna chu ka lâk hmang ta sih a, LALPA chun a tih, lunginsietna le zângaina innêmtak el chu.

en: Both great and small shall die in this land; they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them;
hmr: Hi rama hin a lien le a chîn khawm thîng an ta; phûmin um naw ni hai a, mihai khawma anni chu ṭa naw ni hai, anni le anni khawm in ât naw ni hai, an ta dingin an lu suk- kâwk bawk naw ni hai;

en: neither shall men break bread for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
hmr: mithihai leia anni thlamuon dingin, mihai chun sûnna dingin bei khawi naw ni hai a; an nuhai amanih, an pahai amanih dâwn dingin sûn- puina nohai chu pe bawk naw ni hai.

en: And thou shalt not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.
hmr: Anni le ṭhunga, faa, dâwn dingin ruoiṭhena inah i fe ding a ni nawh.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
hmr: Israel Pathien sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Ngai ta u, i nihaia hin, in mithmua inthawkin hlimna râwl ri dâm, lâwmna râwl ri dâm, mo neitu râwl ri dâm le monu râwl ri dâm chu hi hmuna inthawk hin ka suktâwp ding a nih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt show this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath Jehovah pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against Jehovah our God?
hmr: “Chun, hieng thuhai po po hi hieng mihai kuoma hin în entir pha chun i kuoma chun ‘Iengleiin am hieng thil ṭha naw nasatakhai hi kan chungah LALPA chun a hung sâk- suok am a na? Annawleh, ieng am a na kan khawhlona chu? LALPA kan Pathien chunga kan lo thaw tah, kan suolna chu ieng am a na?’ tîng an ta;

en: then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith Jehovah, and have walked after other gods, and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;
hmr: nang chun an kuomah, ‘In thla- tuhai chun an mi lo nghatsan tah a, LALPA chun a tih: Pathien danghai chu an zui a, a rawng an bâwl a, anni chu chibai an bûk a, kei chu an mi lo mâksan a, ka dân khawm an lo zâwm ta naw lei khan a nih,

en: and ye have done evil more than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so that ye hearken not unto me:
hmr: in thlatuhai nêk hman chun thil suol in thaw lem a, ngai ta u, mi tin el chu mâni lungril ngarna ang peia fein, keia thu chu in ngai ta nawh a;

en: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that ye have not known, neither ye nor your fathers; and there shall ye serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.
hmr: Chuleiin, hi rama inthawk hin nangni le in thlatuhai khawma an hriet ngailo rama chun ka hnawt suok ding cheu a nih; chutaka chun a sûn a zânin pathien danghai rawng bâwl in tih; ditsakna kân hmutir âwm si naw cheu a,’ a tih,” tiin.

en: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be said, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta, nihai a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih, “LALPA Aigupta rama inthawka Israel thla- hai hung ṭhuoi suoktu chu a hring zing angin,” ti ni ta naw nih a,

en: but, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries whither he had driven them. And I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.
hmr: amiruokchu, “LALPA hmâr tieng rama inthawk le, anni a hnawt hmangna ram po poa inthawka Israel thlahai hung ṭhuoi suoktu kha a hring zing leiin,” ti ni lem tâng a tih; an thlatuhai kuoma ka lo pêk tah, an rama ngei khan anni chu ka hung ṭhuoi nâwk ding a ni sih a.

en: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith Jehovah, and they shall fish them up; and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, nga man mi tamtak ko suok ka ta, anni chu nga manin man an ta; chu hnunga chun ramsuok- tuhai tamtak ko suok ka ta, tlâng tinhaia le, muol tinhaia le, lungpui kuo kârhaia chun anni chu pêl an tih.

en: For mine eyes are upon all their ways; they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity concealed from mine eyes.
hmr: An lampuihai po po chu ka mit chun a en zing a, ka hmaia inthawka thup an ni nawh a, ka mithmua inthawkin an suolnahai khawm chu thup a ni bawk nawh.

en: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable things, and have filled mine inheritance with their abominations.
hmr: Chun, a hmasatakin, an khaw- hlona le suolna chu a let hniin thung ka ta, ka ram chu an thil thienglo ruokhai chun an lo sukpawrche tah a, ka rochan khawm an tirdakumna chun an lo suksip ta leiin.

en: O Jehovah, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of affliction, unto thee shall the nations come from the ends of the earth, and shall say, Our fathers have inherited nought but lies, even vanity and things wherein there is no profit.
hmr: Aw LALPA, ka hrâtna le ka kulpui nghet le rinum nia ka himna; leihnuoi tâwphaia inthawk chun hnamhai chu i kuomah hung an ta, “Kan thlatuhai chun khêlhlip chau, teplo le, thil a hlâwkna um dêr lohai chau naw chu iengkhawm an lo rochung nawh a,” hung tîng an tih.

en: Shall a man make unto himself gods, which yet are no gods?
hmr: Mihriem chun ama ta dingin pathienhai ni si lo, pathienhai chu ân siempêk ding am a nih?

en: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta, hieng hi in- hriettir ka ta, vawi khat chu ka thilthawtheina le ka kut chu inhriet- tir ka tih; chun, ka hming chu Jehova a nih ti hre tâng an tih.

en: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the tablet of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;
hmr: Juda suolna chu thîr kawlawm le, lunghlu hmawr zuma ziek a nih; an lungril lungphêka chun a kera ker a na, in mâichâm kiahai le chun;

en: whilst their children remember their altars and their Asherim by the green trees upon the high hills.
hmr: an thlahai chun muol insânghai chunga thing hringhai kâwla an Asera le an mâichâmhai chu an hriet zing sûng phawt chun.

en: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures for a spoil, and thy high places, because of sin, throughout all thy borders.
hmr: Aw rama ka tlâng, i thuom- hnawhai le i rohai chu i bâwlhmunhai le, i ramri sûng po poa i suolna lei chun râllâk sumah ka pêk ding a nih.

en: And thou, even of thyself, shalt discontinue from thy heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger which shall burn for ever.
hmr: Nang khawm, nang ngei khawm, i rochan dinga, ka pêk chea chun um zing naw ti nih a, ram i hriet ngai loa chun i hmêlmahai rawng inbâwltir ka ti che a; ka lunginsennain mei, kumkhuoa chawk ding chu i lo sêm ta sih a.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Cursed is the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Mi mihriem ringa, mihriem bân hrâtna ringsana, a lungril khawm LALPAA inthawka hran ta chu a chung a rik!

en: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh, but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited.
hmr: Ama chu thlalêra hlobuk ang nîng a ta, thil ṭha hung tlung khawm chu a hmu âwm si nawh a; amiruok- chu, thlalêra chun hmun ṭâwl lai lai chu hluong a ta, hluo ngai lo, chilung ram chu.

en: Blessed is the man that trusteth in Jehovah, and whose trust Jehovah is.
hmr: Mi LALPA ringtu le LALPA beiseitu chu a hamṭha.

en: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, that spreadeth out its roots by the river, and shall not fear when heat cometh, but its leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.
hmr: Tuihai sîra thing phun, a zunghai khawm vadunga kai ang, lumna a hung tlung pha khawma ṭi lo, a hnahai hring zing lem, khaw inṭhâl kuma hai khawm pawisa lo, ra insuo zing hlak ang a nih.

en: The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it?
hmr: Thil po po nêkin lungril hi ân khêl a; a se bik rieu a; tuin am hre thei a ta?

en: I, Jehovah, search the mind, I try the heart, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his doings.
hmr: Kei LALPA hin lungril chu ka zawng suok hlak a, mi tin chu a thilthawhai ra ang pei le, a lampuihai ang peia pêk dingin an inthununna chu ka fie bawk a.

en: As the partridge that sitteth on eggs which she hath not laid, so is he that getteth riches, and not by right; in the midst of his days they shall leave him, and at his end he shall be a fool.
hmr: Indik loa hausaknahai neitu chu, varung ama awpkêu ni si lo te kei khâwmtu ang chu a nih; a dam sûng la la chun ama chu mâksan an ta, a tâwpa chun ama chu invêt nîng a tih.

en: A glorious throne, set on high from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
hmr: A tira inthawka lalṭhungpha ropui chungtienga inṭhuta um chu, chu chu ei hmun inthieng hmun chu a nih.

en: O Jehovah, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be put to shame. They that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken Jehovah, the fountain of living waters.
hmr: Aw LALPA, Israel beisei, nang- ma nghatsantuhai che chu inzak an tih; nangma mâksantuhai chu, LALPA, tuihring tuikhur chu an nghatsan tâk leiin hnuoia chun ziek nîng an tih.

en: Heal me, O Jehovah, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.
hmr: Aw LALPA, mi sukdam la, sukdamin um ka tih; mi sandam la, sandamin um ka tih; ka inpâkna chu nang i ni sih a.

en: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of Jehovah? let it come now.
hmr: Ngai ta, “LALPA thu chu khaw lai am a um a, tuhin hungtlung raw se,” an mi tih a.

en: As for me, I have not hastened from being a shepherd after thee; neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was before thy face.
hmr: Keia chungthua chun, nanga hnunga berâmpu ni chu ka tum ṭâl nawh a, ni chungpikum khawm chu ka châk bawk nawh a, i hriet a, ka hmûra inthawka suokhai chu i hmai- hmaa chun a um sih a.

en: Be not a terror unto me: thou art my refuge in the day of evil.
hmr: Ka ta dingin ṭium ni naw la, ni ṭha nawa chun kân bîk himna i nih.

en: Let them be put to shame that persecute me, but let not me be put to shame; let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed; bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.
hmr: Kei mi sukrinumtuhai chu in- zakhai sienla, kei ruok chu mîn zaktir naw rawh; anni chu inbeidawngtir la, kei ruok chu mi sukbeidawng naw rawh; an chunga chun ni ṭha naw chu hung intlungtir la, anni sietna thuo hniin sukse rawh.

en: Thus said Jehovah unto me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuoma chun hieng hin a hril a: “Fe la, chu hnam thlahai dai kawtkhâr, Juda lalhai an hung lûtna le an fe suokna le, Jerusalem dai kawtkhârahai po po chun va ngîr rawh;

en: and say unto them, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
hmr: chun, an kuoma chun hril la: Nangni Juda lalhai le, Juda po pohai le, Jerusalem hluotu hi dai kawt- khâra lût hlakhai po po, LALPA thu hi lo hre ta u:

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: In hringna thuah fîmkhur unla, châwlni chun phur phur naw unla, Jerusalem dai kawtkhâra chun hung la lût bawk naw ro;

en: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work: but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
hmr: châwlni chun in inhaia in- thawkin phur phur suok bawk naw unla, sin ieng ang khawm thaw bawk naw ro; amiruokchu, in thlatuhai thu ka pêk ta ang khan, châwlni chu inser ro;

en: But they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not receive instruction.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, an ngai nawh a, an na khawm an sit nawh a, an rîng an sukngar a, an hriet nawna ding le inchûktirna chu an pawm nawna dingin.

en: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith Jehovah, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but to hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;
hmr: Chun, ṭhahnemngaitaka ka thu in ngai chun, LALPA chun a tih, châwlnia hi khawpui dai kawtkhâr- haia phur hung la lût lo ding le, amiruokchu, châwlni chu insera, chu nia sin thaw lo dingin;

en: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain for ever.
hmr: hi dai kawtkhârhaia hin lalhai le rorêltuhai David lalṭhungphaa ṭhunghai chu sakawr tawlailîr le sakawr chunga chuongin, anni le an rorêltuhai le Juda mihai le Jerusalem hluotuhai chu la lût an tih; chun, hi khawpui hi kumkhuoin um zing bawk a tih.

en: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places round about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the lowland, and from the hill-country, and from the South, bringing burnt-offerings, and sacrifices, and meal-offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving, unto the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram khawpuihaia inthawk dâm, Jerusalem vêl khuo- haia inthawk dâm, Benjamin rama inthawk dâm, phai ram le tlâng rama inthawk dâm, Sim rama inthawk dâmin, LALPA ina lâwmthu hrilna inthâwinahai, berâm dâm, inthâwina hrim hrim dâm, bu thilinhlân dâm, pumrawhmang thilinhlân dâm chu hung chawiin hung an tih.

en: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
hmr: Amiruokchu, châwlni chu in- sera, châwlnia Jerusalem dâi kawt- khârhaia phur phura lût lo dinga ka thu in ngai naw chun, chutaka dâi kawtkhâra chun mei sêm ka ta, Jerusalem in ropuihai chu kâng- hmang a ta, sukmit ni ngai hrim hrim naw ni.

en: The word which came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: LALPA kuoma inthawka Jere- mia kuoma thu hung tlung chun,

en: Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.
hmr: “Tho la, bêl hemtu ina chun fe thla la, chutaka chun ka thu inngaitir ka ti che,” a ta.

en: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and, behold, he was making a work on the wheels.
hmr: Chuongchun, bêlhemtu ina chun ka fe thla a, bêlhemna khâwlah a sin chu a lo thaw a.

en: And when the vessel that he made of the clay was marred in the hand of the potter, he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.
hmr: Chun, pilpawka bêl a siem chu a him naw pha chun, bêlhemtu chun ṭha a ti ang peiin bel dangah a siem nâwk a.

en: Then the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith Jehovah. Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are ye in my hand, O house of Israel.
hmr: “Aw Israel sûngkuo, hi bêl hemtu ang hin i chunga hin ka thaw thei ni lo am a nih? LALPA chun a tih. Ngai ta, pilpawk chu bêl hemtu kuta a um angin, nang chu ka kuta um i nih, aw Israel sûngkuo.

en: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy it;
hmr: Ieng huna khawm hnam ama- nih, lalram chungthuah hmalthla ding le sukchim ding le sukse dinga ka hril a,

en: if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.
hmr: chu hnam, a chungthu ka hril chu an thil ṭha nawa inthawka an hung kîr chun, thil ṭha naw an chunga thaw dinga ka ngaituo chu la kir ka tih.

en: And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;
hmr: Chun, ieng huna khawm hnam amanih, lalram chungthuah siem ding le inngîr dinga ka hril a,

en: if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.
hmr: ka mithmua chun thil ṭha naw a thawa, ka râwl a ngai naw chun, anni sukṭhatna dinga ka ti thil ṭha chu la kîr ka tih.

en: Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and amend your ways and your doings.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin fe la, Jerusalem hluotuhai le Juda rama mihai kuoma chun thu hril la, ‘LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, in chungah thil ṭha naw ka riruong a, in chungah phierrûkna ka phierrûk a, tuhin mi tin mâni lampui rilo senga inthawk chun hung kîr raw se; chuongchun, in thilthawhai le in lampuihai chu siem ṭha ro,’ tiin.

en: But they say, It is in vain; for we will walk after our own devices, and we will do every one after the stubbornness of his evil heart.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, ‘Beiseina hrim a um nawh, mi tin mâni ngairuotna ang seng ei hraw ding a na, eini mi tin chun mâni lungril rilo ngar- zie ang peiin ei thaw el ding a nih,’ an ta.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Ask ye now among the nations, who hath heard such things; the virgin of Israel hath done a very horrible thing.
hmr: “Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih; Hnamhai laia chun indawn unla, hieng ang thilhai hi hre hlak an um am; Israel nunghâk inthieng chun thil râpthlâktak el chu a lo thaw tah a.

en: Shall the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field? or shall the cold waters that flow down from afar be dried up?
hmr: Lebanon vûr chun ramhnuoi lungpui chu a mâksan ding am a nih? Annawleh, tui dei ram hlataka inthawka hung luong thlahai chu a kang el ding am a nih?

en: For my people have forgotten me, they have burned incense to false gods; and they have been made to stumble in their ways, in the ancient paths, to walk in bypaths, in a way not cast up;
hmr: Ka mihai chun an mi thei- nghil a, teplo kuoma chun riminhnik chu an lo raw ta sih a; chun, anni chun an lampuihaia chun an insui thlûktir a, tienlaia lampuihai, lampui rûka fe dingin, tluongpui lam niloa chun;

en: to make their land an astonishment, and a perpetual hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished, and shake his head.
hmr: an ram chu makti dinga siem ding le, hahîpa siem dingin; mi tin chu fe khêl taphawt chun maktîng an ta, an lu thin an tih.

en: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will show them the back, and not the face, in the day of their calamity.
hmr: Sak thli ang elin anni chu an hmêlmahai kuomah sukdar vawng ka ta, an lungngai nia chun ka hmai ni loin ka hnungtieng inentir ka tih,” tiin.

en: Then said they, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Hung ro khai, Jeremia chunga hin thuphier- rûk phier ei tih; thiempua inthawkin dânin bo ni nei naw nih a, mi vara inthawkin thurâwn le, zâwlneia inthawka thu bo naw nih. Hung ta u, hril se bawr bawr ei ta, a thuhai chu a ieng ieng khawm chu awipêk nâwng ei tiu,” an ta.

en: Give heed to me, O Jehovah, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.
hmr: Aw LALPA, mi hung ngaisak la, keia mi kaltuhai râwl chu lo ngai ta.

en: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before thee to speak good for them, to turn away thy wrath from them.
hmr: Thil ṭha naw chu thil ṭhaa thung a ni ding am a nih? Ka thlarau ta dingin khur an cho ta sih a. An ta dinga thil ṭha hril dinga i hmaa, i lunginsenna annia inthawka suk- kieng dinga ka ngîr kha hre zing la.

en: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and give them over to the power of the sword; and let their wives become childless, and widows; and let their men be slain of death, and their young men smitten of the sword in battle.
hmr: Chuleiin, an thlahai chu ṭâm kuoma chun pe la, anni chu kâwl- hnâm thilthawtheina kuoma chun pe rawh; chuongchun, an nuhmeihai chu nau bo le, hmeithaihai innitir la, an pasalhai chu thinaa sukhlum ni hai sienla, chun, an tlangvâlhai chu indonaa kâwlhnâma that ni raw hai se.

en: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them; for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.
hmr: An chunga sipai ruol i hung ṭhuoi thut pha chun, an inhaia in- thawk chun ṭap hriet ni raw se, kei mi manna dingin khur an cho a, ka kehai ta ding chun châng an kam sih a.

en: Yet, Jehovah, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me; forgive not their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from thy sight; but let them be overthrown before thee; deal thou with them in the time of thine anger.
hmr: Amiruokchu, LALPA, mi thatna dinga ka chunga an thu inrâwnna po po kha i hriet a, an suolna chu ngai- dam naw la, i mithmua inthawk chun an suol chu sukhmangpêk bawk naw rawh, amiruokchu, nangma hmaa chun pei thlûkin um hai sienla, anni chu i lunginsen lai chun sawisa rawh.

en: Thus said Jehovah, Go, and buy a potter’s earthen bottle, and take of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, “Fe la, bêl hemtu pil bêl inchaw la, chun, mipuihai laia upahai le, thiempuhai laia upahai ṭhuoi la.

en: and go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words that I shall tell thee;
hmr: Hinnom naupa phairuom, Harsith dâi kawtkhâr lûtna bula uma chun fe unla, chutaka chun thu ka hril che chu hril suok rawh.

en: and say, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.
hmr: Hieng hin ti la. Nangni Juda ram lalhai le, Jerusalem hluotuhai, LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u; sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, hi hmuna hin thil ṭha naw kân tlungtir ding a nih; a hre taphawt chu an nahai chu khel a tih.

en: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, that they knew not, they and their fathers and the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
hmr: Kei an mi lo nghatsan tah a, hi hmun khawm hi an lo sukhran tah a, an hriet lo pathienhai kuoma chun a sûnga hin riminhnik chu, anni le an thlatuhai le Juda ram lalhai ngei khawma an lo raw tâk leiin; hi hi hmun hi mi thiem thisen chun an lo suksip tah a;

en: and have built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons in the fire for burnt-offerings unto Baal; which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:
hmr: Baal bâwlhmunhai chu an bâwl a, Baal kuoma pumrawhmang thilin- hlân dinga an naupasalhai râwna dingin; chu chu thu ka pêk hlek nawh a, hril khawm ka hril nawh a, ka lungrila khawm a hung lût ngai nawh;

en: therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that this place shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter.
hmr: chuleiin, ngai ta u, a nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Hi hi phairuom hi Topheth ama- nih, Hinnom naupa Phairuom ama- nih ti ni ta naw nih a. Inthatna Ruom ti ni lem tâng a tih.

en: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies will I give to be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.
hmr: Chun, hi hmuna hin Juda ram le Jerusalem thurawt chu inthlâwntir ka ta; an hringna zawngtuhai le, an hmêlmahai hmaa chun kâwlhnâmah intlûktir ka tih; chun, an ruonghai chu chunglêng vatehai le, hnuoia ramsahai ta dingin bu dingin pêng ka tih.

en: And I will make this city an astonishment, and a hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss because of all the plagues thereof.
hmr: Hi khawpui hi maktia le thuok- dawngumah siem ka ta; mi tin a fe khêltuhai taphawt chun mak tîng an ta, an thuok dawng a tih, chu chu hmun po po a se ta lei chun.

en: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters; and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend, in the siege and in the distress, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their life, shall distress them.
hmr: Chun, an naupasalhai le an nau- nuhmeihai sahai chu infâktir ka ta; mi tin chun, inhuolnaa le chârchil- naah, an hmêlmahai le an hringna zawngtuhaiin an chârchilnaa chun, mâni ruolhai sa chu fa tâwl an tih.

en: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,
hmr: Chun, nangma hung zuitu mi- hai mithmua chun bêl chu sukkhawi i ta,

en: and shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a potter’s vessel, that cannot be made whole again; and they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place to bury.
