hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun sûtpuihai chungthua le, châwtawl lien chung- thua le, ân ṭhutna chungthua le, khawpuia bûr le bêl mâksana la umhai chungthua chun, hieng hin a tih:

en: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took not, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
hmr: chuong Babulon lal Nebukad- nezzarin Juda lal Jehoiakim naupa Jekonia chu sala Jerusalema in- thawka Babulona Jerusalem le Juda rama mi ṭhahai po po chu sala a ṭhuoi laia a lâk sa ve nawhai chung- thu chu;

en: yea, thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that are left in the house of Jehovah, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem:
hmr: anih, sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: LALPA ina bûr le bêl mâksana la umhai chungthua, Juda ram lal ina le Jerusalema mihai le chun sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih:

en: They shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be, until the day that I visit them, saith Jehovah; then will I bring them up, and restore them to this place.
hmr: Babulona chun phur hmang nîng an ta, chutaka chun um an tih, anni ka va sir ni chen chun, LALPA chun a tih: chun, hung la nâwk tâwl ka ta, hi hmuna hin sie nâwk ka tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of Jehovah, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Zedekia rorêl ṭantir, a kum lina, a thla ngana, chu kum ma chun zâwlnei Azzur naupa Hanania, Gibeon mi chun, mipuihai po po le thiempuhai hmaihmaah, LALPA ina chun ka kuomah hieng hin thu a hril a,

en: Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
hmr: “Israel Pathien sipaihai LALPA chun hienghin a tih: Babulon lal rîngkawl chu ka sukthliek tah a.

en: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of Jehovah’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried to Babylon:
hmr: Kum hni pumhlûm sûngin LALPA ina bûr le bêlhai po po Babulon lal Nebukadnezzarin hi hmuna inthawka a lâk a, Babulona a phurhai kha hi hmuna hin hung la kîr nâwk vawng ka ta;

en: and I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went to Babylon, saith Jehovah; for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
hmr: hi hmuna hin Juda ram lal Jehoiakim naupa Jekonia le Juda sal intânghai po po Babulona fe tahai chu hung ṭhuoi kîr nâwk ka ta; LALPA chun a tih; Babulon lal rîngkawl chu ka sukthliek ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai, mipui po po LALPA ina ngîrhai kuoma chun zâwlnei Jeremia chun zâwlnei Hanania kuomah,

en: even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: Jehovah do so; Jehovah perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of Jehovah’s house, and all them of the captivity, from Babylon unto this place.
hmr: zâwlnei Jeremia ngei chun a hril a, “Amen: LALPA chun chuong chun thaw raw se; Babulona inthawka hi hmuna, sala lo intânghai po po le, LALPA ina bûr le bêlhai chu hung la kîr dingin, i thuhril chu LALPA chun thaw raw se.

en: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mipui po po na hrieta le nangma na hriet ngeia hi thu ka hril hi tuhin lo ngai ta;

en: The prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.
hmr: Zâwlnei keia hma le nangma hmaa, kha hmaa lo um tahai khan ram tamtak chunga le, lalram ropui- takhai chunga le, indo thu dâm, thil ṭha naw thu dâm, hripui thu dâm an lo hril hlak a.

en: The prophet that prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that Jehovah hath truly sent him.
hmr: Zâwlnei thlamuongna thu hriltu chu, chu zâwlnei thuhril chu a hung tlung pha chun, chu zâwlnei chu LALPA chun ama chu a tir taktak a nih ti hriet a nih,” tiin.

en: Then Hananiah the prophet took the bar from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and brake it.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Hanania chun zâwlnei Jeremia rînga rîngkawl chu a lâk a, a sukthliek tah a.

en: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon within two full years from off the neck of all the nations. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
hmr: Chun, Hanania chun mipuihai po po hmaihmaa chun thu a hril tah a, “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Hnam po pohai rînga inthawkin kum hni pumhlûm sûngin Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar rîngkawl chu hieng ang ngei hin ka sukthliek ding a nih, a tih,” a ta, zâwlnei Jeremia ruok chu a fe hmang tah a.

en: Then the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Hananiain zâwl- nei Jeremia rînga inthawka rîngkawl a sukthliek hnung chun Jeremia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu hieng ang hin a hung tlung a,

en: Go, and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Thou hast broken the bars of wood; but thou hast made in their stead bars of iron.
hmr: “Fe la, Hanania chu hieng ang hin va hril rawh: LALPA chun hieng- hin a tih: Thinga siem rîngkawlhai chu i sukthliek a; amiruokchu, an aia chun thîrin rîngkawl i siem ding a nih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.
hmr: Israel Pathien, sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar rawng chu an bâwl theina dingin hieng hnam po pohai rînga hin thîr rîngkawl chu kân kawl- tir tah a nih; ama rawng chu bâwl an ta, ramhnuoia ram sahai chenin ama chu ka pêk tah a nih,” tiin.

en: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah: Jehovah hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Jeremia chun zâwlnei Hanania kuoma chun, “Hanania, tuhin lo ngai ta, LALPA chun nang a tir naw cheh a, nisien- lakhawm, hi mipui hi khêlthu chu în ringtir a ni hi.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will send thee away from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast spoken rebellion against Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, leihnuoi chunga in- thawk hin ka tir hmang ding che a nih; LALPA kala khêlthu i hril leiin, tu kum hin i thi ding a nih,” tiin.

en: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
hmr: Chuongchun, zâwlnei Hanania chu chu kum ma thla sarinaa chun a thi tah a.

en: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem unto the residue of the elders of the captivity, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people, whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon,
hmr: Tuhin, sal intâng upa la um- sunhai le, thiempuhai le, zâwl- neihai le, mipui po po Jerusalema inthawka Babulona Nebukadnezzar- in sala a ṭhuoihai kuoma zâwlnei Jeremia lekhathawn thuhai chu hienghai hi an nih:

en: (after that Jeconiah the king, and the queen-mother, and the eunuchs, and the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen, and the smiths, were departed from Jerusalem),
hmr: (lal Jekonia le lalnu nu le, mi tillâkhai le, Juda ram le Jerusalema lalhai le, mi themthiemhai le, thîrsu- hai leh Jerusalem an suoksan hnung chun a nih).

en: by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, (whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent unto Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon), saying,
hmr: Saphan naupa Elasa le, Hilkia naupa Gemaria (Babulon lal Nebu- kadnezzar kuoma Juda ram lal Zedekian Babulona a tirhai) kuta chun thawn a nih

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, unto all the captivity, whom I have caused to be carried away captive from Jerusalem unto Babylon:
hmr: Jerusalema inthawka Babulona sala intâng dinga kân ṭhuoihmang- tirhai po po kuoma chun, sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng- hin a tih:

en: Build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them.
hmr: Inhai bâwl unla, a sûngahai chun chêng unla, huonhai chu siem unla, an rahai chu fa bawk ro;

en: Take ye wives, and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters: and multiply ye there, and be not diminished.
hmr: nuhmeihai nei unla, naupasal- hai, naunuhmeihai nei unla: in naupasalhai nuhmei inneitir unla, in naunuhmeihai khawm pasal inneitir bawk unla, naupasalhai le naunu- hmeihai an nei theina dingin; chu- taka chun hung pung pei unla, kiem tieng pan ta naw ro.

en: And seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray unto Jehovah for it; for in the peace thereof shall ye have peace.
hmr: Chun, sala intâng dinga kân ṭhuoihmangtirna cheu khawpuia inremna chu zawng unla, chu chu LALPA kuoma chun hni ro; chutaka inremna lei chun muongna in nei ding a ni sih a.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Let not your prophets that are in the midst of you, and your diviners, deceive you; neither hearken ye to your dreams which ye cause to be dreamed.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Nangni laia in zâwlnei umhai le, in khawhri zâwl- haiin hlêm naw raw se cheu, chun, in manghai in imang khawm chu ring bawk naw unla.

en: For they prophesy falsely unto you in my name: I have not sent them, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Keia hmingin khêlin in kuomah thu an hril hlak sih a; anni chu ka tir an ni nawh, LALPA chun a tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, After seventy years are accomplished for Babylon, I will visit you, and perform my good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a; Babulona intâng kum sâwmsari a tling hnunga chun, hung sir ka ti cheu a, hi hmuna inkîrtir ding cheuin in kuoma chun ka thu tiem chu hlen ka tih.

en: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith Jehovah, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you hope in your latter end.
hmr: Nangni tieng panga ka ngaituo, thil ngaituohai chu ka hriet sih a, LALPA chun a tih, in tâwpna tienga beiseina siempêk ding cheuin thil ṭha naw ni loin, thlamuongna lungril a ni lem.

en: And ye shall call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.
hmr: Chun, kei chu mi hung ko in ta, fêng in ta, ka kuoma chun ṭawngṭai in ta, chun, kei khawma lo ngai ka ti cheu.

en: And ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me with all your heart.
hmr: Mi zawng in ta, in lungril po poa in mi zawng pha chun mi hmûng in tih.

en: And I will be found of you, saith Jehovah, and I will turn again your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places whither I have driven you, saith Jehovah; and I will bring you again unto the place whence I caused you to be carried away captive.
hmr: Nangni ihmuin um ka ta, LALPA chun a tih: chuongchun, in sal intângna chu inlet ka ta, ka hnawt hmangna cheu hmun po poa inthawk le, hnam po pohaia inthawk chun ṭhuoi khâwm ka ti cheu a, LALPA chun a tih; chun, sala intâng dinga ṭhuoi hmanga kân umtirna cheu hmuna bawk khan hung ṭhuoi kîr nâwk ka ti cheu.

en: Because ye have said, Jehovah hath raised us up prophets in Babylon;
hmr: “LALPA chun Babulona khawm chun zâwlneihai a hung siem tah a,” in ti leiin,

en: thus saith Jehovah concerning the king that sitteth upon the throne of David, and concerning all the people that dwell in this city, your brethren that are not gone forth with you into captivity;
hmr: David lalṭhungphaa ṭhung lal chungthua le, chu khawpuia mipui chêng po pohai, in unauhai nangni le sala intâng dinga fe ve nawhai chung- thua chun LALPAIN hieng hin a tih:

en: thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Behold, I will send upon them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.
hmr: sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, an chunga chun kâwlhnâm dâm, ṭâm dâm, hripui dâm tir ka ta, anni chu theichang hrût, an siet êm leia fâk thei lohai anga chun siem ka tih.

en: And I will pursue after them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth, to be an execration, and an astonishment, and a hissing, and a reproach, among all the nations whither I have driven them;
hmr: Chun, anni chu kâwlhnâm le ṭâm le hriin hnawt ka ta, anni ka tir hmangna tieng hnamhai po po laia chun thusekawk ding le, inchekna ding le, makti ding le, mi ṭawng- dâwng dingin hnuoia lalram po po laia hnungtieng hmatienga nawr- lênga um dingin pe suok ka tih;

en: because they have not hearkened to my words, saith Jehovah, wherewith I sent unto them my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but ye would not hear, saith Jehovah.
hmr: anni chun ka thu an ngai naw leiin, LALPA chun a tih; inhmataka thoa anni tirin, ka siehlaw zâwlnei- hai chu an kuomah ka tir a; nisien- lakhawm, anni chu in lo ngai si nawh, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Hear ye therefore the word of Jehovah, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
hmr: Chuleichun, nangni sala intâng, Jerusalema inthawka Babulona ka tir po pohai, LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie unto you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall slay them before your eyes;
hmr: Ka hminga in kuoma thukhêl hriltu Maaseia naupa Zedekia chung thua le, Kolaia naupa Ahab chung- thua chun Israel Pathien, sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, anni chu Babulon lal Nebukad- nezzar kuta chun pe suok ka ta, ama chun in mithmuah anni chu that a tih;

en: and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captives of Judah that are in Babylon, saying, Jehovah make thee like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;
hmr: Babulona Juda sal intânghai po po chun, “Zedekia le Ahab, Babulon lalin a rawhai ang chun LALPA chun siem raw se che,” tiin, anni chung- thua chun ṭawngse inphurna takah hmang an tih:

en: because they have wrought folly in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken words in my name falsely, which I commanded them not; and I am he that knoweth, and am witness, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Israel rama chun invêtthlâk- takin thil an thawh a, an tuolbâwm- hai nuhmei le chun an uireh a, ka hming sâlin ka thupêk loa khêl thu an hril leiin; chun, kei chu a hretu, a hrietpuitu chu ka nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite thou shalt speak, saying,
hmr: Chun, Nehelam mi Semaia chungthua chun hieng ang hin thu hril i tih:

en: Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Because thou hast sent letters in thine own name unto all the people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Jerusalema mi- pui um po pohai, thiempu Masseia naupa Zephania kuoma leh, thiem- puhai po po kuoma chun hieng anga nangma hminga lekha i thawn leiin:

en: Jehovah hath made thee priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in the house of Jehovah, for every man that is mad, and maketh himself a prophet, that thou shouldest put him in the stocks and in shackles.
hmr: “Thiempu Jehoiada aia chun LALPA chun thiempuah a siem ta cheh a, chuongchun, LALPA ina chun hotu nîng i ta, chun, mi tukhawm ân vêt a, ama le ama zâwlneia ân siem chun, ama chu intângna ina siein, kawl inbuntir i tih.

en: Now therefore, why hast thou not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who maketh himself a prophet to you,
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin ieng dinga Ana- thotha mi Jeremia in kuoma zâwlnei inti hi i kâwk naw am a na?

en: forasmuch as he hath sent unto us in Babylon, saying, The captivity is long: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them?
hmr: ama chun, ‘Sal intâng sûng ding hi a sâwt a, inhai bâwl unla, a sûnga- hai chun chêng unla, huonhai siem unla, a rahai chu fa ro,’ tiin Babulon- ah thu a mi thawn si a” tiin.

en: And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophet.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Zephania chun zâwlnei Jeremia na hrieta chun hi lekhathawn hi a tiem tah a.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a:

en: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith Jehovah concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because that Shemaiah hath prophesied unto you, and I sent him not, and he hath caused you to trust in a lie;
hmr: “Sal intânghai po po kuoma chun mi tir la. Nehelam mi Semaia chungthua chun LALPA chun hieng- hin a tih: Semaia chu ka tir loin, in kuoma chun thu hrilin, thukhêl chu a hung inawitir cheu leiin,

en: therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and his seed; he shall not have a man to dwell among this people, neither shall he behold the good that I will do unto my people, saith Jehovah, because he hath spoken rebellion against Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Nehelam mi Semaia le a thlahai chu hrem ka ta; hi hnam laia chêng ding hi mi nei naw nih a, ka mihai laia thil ṭha ka thaw khawm chu hmu bawk naw ni, LALPA chun a tih: LALPA chunga helna thu a lo hril ta leiin,” tiin.

en: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, will he return unto her again? will not that land be greatly polluted? But thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: “Miin a nuhmei a mâk a, ama chu a mâksan a, pasal dang ta a hung ni tah a, amapa chu amanu kuoma chun a lût nâwk ding am a nih? Chuong a ni chun chu ram chu nasa- taka sukpawrche a ni naw ding maw? Nang khawm chu, ngaizâwng tam- takhai le chun nawchizawr angin i lo khawsa tah a, anachu, ka kuoma bawk i hung kîr nâwk ding? LALPA chun a tih.

en: Lift up thine eyes unto the bare heights, and see; where hast thou not been lain with? By the ways hast thou sat for them, as an Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
hmr: Bâwlhmun tienghai khi i mithai khan hang thlîr la, en ta; an zâlpui nawna che khaw lai am a um a? Thlalêra Arabia mi ang elin, lampui sîra chun an ta dingin i ṭhung a; i rîtlona le i hurna chun ram chu i sukpawrche ta a nih.

en: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; yet thou hadst a harlot’s forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.
hmr: Chuleiin, raw sûrhai chu chel- tâng an na, ruo nuhnung tieng chu a um ta naw a nih; amiruokchu, mi hur chal chu i nei a, inzak i tum dêr si nawh a.

en: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My Father, thou art the guide of my youth?
hmr: Tuta inthawk hin, ‘Ka pa, nang chu ka tleirâwlna ṭhuoitu i nih,’ tiin ka kuomah i khêk naw dîm a nih?

en: Will he retain his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and hast done evil things, and hast had thy way.
hmr: A lunginsenna chu a kawl zing dîm a nih? A tâwp chenin a kawl dîm a nih? Ngai ta, thil ṭha naw chu i hrilin i thaw tah a, i suol thei dân tâwpin i lo suol tah,” tiin.

en: Moreover Jehovah said unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun lal Josia hun lai chun ka kuomah LALPA chun a hril a, “Israel hnungtawlin a lo thaw ta hi i hmu am? Tlâng insâng tinahai hang fein le, thing hring tin hnuoia chun; chuongahai chun nawchizawr angin a lo khawsa tah a.

en: And I said after she had done all these things, She will return unto me; but she returned not: and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
hmr: Hieng thilhai po po hi a thaw zo hnung chun ka kuomah hung kîr i tih, ka tih a, nisienlakhawm, a hung kîr si nawh a, a zuorpuinu rilotak Juda khawm chun ama chu a hmuh a.

en: And I saw, when, for this very cause that backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a bill of divorcement, yet treacherous Judah her sister feared not; but she also went and played the harlot.
hmr: Israel hnungtawl chun uiretna thil a lo thaw ka hmu lei tak chun ama chu ka mâk a, inmâkna lekha ka pêk tah ti a hmu sa khawmin a zuor- puinu rilotak Juda chun ṭitna châng a hriet chuong nawh a, ama ngei khawm chu a fe a, nawchizawrah a khawsa ve tah a.

en: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that the land was polluted, and she committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
hmr: A hurna inruina lei chun ram chu sukpawrchein a um tah a; thingbul- hai le lunghai le chun a lo uire tah a.

en: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not returned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Hieng thil po pohai lei khawm hin a zuorpuinu hlêm hmang Juda chu a lungril po po leh a hung kîr naw ta rawp a, a la tehlêm lem a, LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, Backsliding Israel hath showed herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Juda rilotak nêk hin Israel hnung- tawl khawm hi fel lemin ân lang ie.

en: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith Jehovah; I will not look in anger upon you; for I am merciful, saith Jehovah, I will not keep anger for ever.
hmr: Fe la, hi thuhai hi hmâr tienga chun va phuong la, ‘Hung kîr rawh, nang Israel hnungtawl, LALPA chun a tih; i chunga chun lunginsenin en naw ning cheh a, zângai theitak ka ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih, lunginsenna chu kumkhuoin kawl zing naw ning.

en: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against Jehovah thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith Jehovah.
hmr: I suolna chu hre phawt phawt la, LALPA i Pathien chunga chun i lo bawsiet tah a, thing hring tin hnuoia chun hmêlmakhai kuomah i lo inphal tah a, ka râwl khawm chu i awi bawk ta nawh a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Return, O backsliding children, saith Jehovah; for I am a husband unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
hmr: Hung kîr ro, hnungtawl thlahai, LALPA chun a tih; in pasal ka ni sih a, chun, khawpuia pakhat le, pa- hnama pahni lâng ka ti cheu a, Ziona chun hung ṭhuoi ka ti cheu;

en: And I will give you shepherds according to my heart, who shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
hmr: chuongchun, ka lungril ang takin berâmpu ding pêng ka ti cheu a, ama chun hrietna le hrietthiemnain châwm a ti cheu.

en: And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith Jehovah, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of Jehovah; neither shall it come to mind; neither shall they remember it; neither shall they miss it; neither shall it be made any more.
hmr: Chun, chu rama chun in hung pung a, in hung tam pha chun; chuong niahai chun, LALPA chun a tih, “LALPA thuthlungna bâwm hi,” ti ta ngai naw ni hai. An lungrilah hung lût ta naw nih a, anni hlaka hre zing ta naw ni hai a; va sir bawk naw ni hai a, thawa thaw khawm um ta naw ni,’ ti ta ngai naw ni hai.

en: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of Jehovah; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of Jehovah, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the stubbornness of their evil heart.
hmr: Chu pha chun Jerusalem chu LALPA lalṭhungpha tiin inbûk an ta, hnam po pohai chu chutaka chun kei khâwm nîng an ta, LALPA hmingin Jerusalema chun, an lungril rilo ngarna ang chun fe khâwm nâwk ta ngai naw ni hai.

en: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance unto your fathers.
hmr: Chuong nihaia chun Juda sûng- kuo chu Israel sûngkuo le chun in- tlawn an ta, hmâr tieng rama in- thawk chun hung suok hmunkhat an ta, in thlatuhai kuoma rochan dinga ka pêk rama chun hung an tih.

en: But I said, How I will put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of the nations! and I said, Ye shall call me My Father, and shall not turn away from following me.
hmr: “Kei chun, ‘hnamhai laia chun sie cheuin, ram inhawitak chu pe cheuin, hnamhai sipai pâwlhai rochan ṭhataka chun sie cheu ka lo lungril hlak a; chun, nangin, Pa, mi hung tîng i ta, i mi zuinaa inthawk hin fe hmang ta naw ti ni’ ka lo ti hlak a.

en: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Anachu, nuhmeiin a pasal chu khawhlotaka a ṭhe angin, chuong ang tak chun ka chungah khawhlotakin i lo thaw ta tlat el a; Aw Israel sûng- kuo,” LALPA chun a tih.

en: A voice is heard upon the bare heights, the weeping and the supplications of the children of Israel; because they have perverted their way, they have forgotten Jehovah their God.
hmr: Bâwlhmun tlângahai chun râwl hriet a na; Israel thlahai ṭapna le hnina chu; chu chu lei chun an lampui chu an lo sukhran tah a, LALPA an Pathien chu an theinghil tah a nih.

en: Return, ye backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we are come unto thee; for thou art Jehovah our God.
hmr: “Hnungtawl thlahai, hung kîr ro; in hnungtawlnahai chu lo suk- dampêk ka ti cheu.” “Ngai ta, i kuoma chun kan hung ie, nang chu LALPA kan Pathien chu i ni sih a.

en: Truly in vain is the help that is looked for from the hills, the tumult on the mountains: truly in Jehovah our God is the salvation of Israel.
hmr: Indiktakin muolhaia ṭhang- puina beiseia umhai chu mipui inri mur murhai chu a thlâwn el a nih; indiktakin LALPA ei Pathiena chun Israelhai sandamna chu a um a nih.”

en: But the shameful thing hath devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ei naupang laia inthawkin, ei thlatuhai sin inrimna chu thil inzâpui umhai chun a lo fâk zo tah a, an bâwng ruolhai, an berâm ruolhai, an naupasalhai le an naunuhmeihai leh;

en: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against Jehovah our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day; and we have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah our God.
hmr: ei inzaknaa chun zâl ei ta, ei lungril ngaibuoina chun mîn khum raw se; LALPA ei Pathien chunga chun thil ei lo suksuol ta sih a; ei naupang laia inthawk tah vawisûn chen hin eini ni leh, ei thlatuhai ni leh; chuongchun, LALPA ei Pathien râwl chu ei lo awi ta naw a nih.

en: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: Jeremia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chun hieng hin a tih:

en: Thus speaketh Jehovah, the God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
hmr: “LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: I kuoma thu ka hrilhai po po chu lekhabuah ziek rawh.

en: For, lo, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will turn again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith Jehovah; and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
hmr: Ngai ta, nihai chu a hung tlung ta sih a, LALPA chun a tih; Ka mi Israelhai le Juda sal intângna chu inlêt nâwk tâng ka ta, LALPA chun a tih: an thlatuhai kuoma ram ka pêka chun hung inkîrtir nâwk ka ta, hluong an tih,” tiin.

en: And these are the words that Jehovah spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
hmr: Juda chungthua le Israel chung- thua LALPAIN thu a hrilhai chu hieng hi an nih,

en: For thus saith Jehovah: We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Thlamuongna ni loin, ṭitna le inthin râwl ka hriet a.

en: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child: wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
hmr: Tuhin indawn unla, en vêl ta u, pasal nauhasea na an um hlak am? Iem a tih a nuhmei nauhase nat tuor ang hrieu a, pasal tin chu a kuthai a kâwnga innghata, mi tin hmai chu dâng vawnga ka hmu hi?

en: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
hmr: Ahei, chu ni chu a ropui sih a, chu ang hrim chu a um nawh a, Jakob buoina hun ngei chu a ni el a nih; nisienlakhawm, chutaka inthawk chun sansuokin um a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith Jehovah of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds; and strangers shall no more make him their bondman;
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun hieng hi hung nîng a ta, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih: I rînga inthawk chun rîngkawl chu sukthliek ka ta, i hruihai chu suktan bawk ka tih; chuongchun, mi hmêlmakhai chun ama rawng chu bâwlpêk ta naw ni hai;

en: but they shall serve Jehovah their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
hmr: amiruokchu, LALPA an Pathien rawng le, an lal David an kuoma ka tungding ding chu a rawng bâwl lem tâng an tih.

en: Therefore fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
hmr: Chuleiin, Aw Jakob, ka siehlaw, ṭi naw rawh, LALPA chun a tih: Aw Israel, beidawng bawk naw rawh, ngai ta, ram hlataka inthawkin ka sandam ding che a ni sih a, i thlahai chu an sal intângna rama inthawkin sandam bawk ka tih; chuongchun, Jakob chu hung kîr a ta, nuomsa le to ṭawk ṭawkin um a tih, tukhawma sukṭi ta naw ni hai.

en: For I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to save thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have scattered thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise leave thee unpunished.
hmr: Nangma sandam ding chein i kuomah ka um sih a, LALPA chun a tih: nang ka sukdarna tieng chea hnamhai po po tâwpna letdêr chu siem ka ta, nang ruok chu suktâwp letdêr naw ning che; amiruokchu, rorêlnain sukdik lem ka ti cheh a, hrem loin ieng kawnga khawm mâk- san naw ning che.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, Thy hurt is incurable, and thy wound grievous.
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: I natna chu sukdam theilo a na, i hliemna chu a nasa êm êm a.

en: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.
hmr: Tuoma i um theina dingin tukhawma i chungthuah an ṭan naw cheh a, sukdamna damdawi i nei naw a nih.

en: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not: for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased.
hmr: Nangma hmangaituhai po po che hlaka an theinghil cheh a; an zawng ta naw cheh a: mi rilo hremna le hmêlma inhliemna chun kân hliem si cheh a, i suolnahai an pung pei lei chun i khawhlona chu a nasa hle sih a.

en: Why criest thou for thy hurt? thy pain is incurable: for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.
hmr: I natna lei chun ieng dinga khêk am i na? I natna chu sukdam theilo a nih, i suolnahai chu an hung pung pei leiin, i khawhlona chu a nasa hle sih a, hieng thilhai hi i chungah ka thaw a ni hi.

en: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that despoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
hmr: Chuong lei chun nangma fazotu po pohai chu fâkzoin um an ta; i hmêlmahai po po chu, anni mi tin el chu salah intâng an tih; chun, nang- ma suksetu che chu suksietin um a ta; râllâka latu che po po chu râllâkah pe bawk ka tih.

en: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith Jehovah; because they have called thee an outcast, saying, It is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
hmr: Hrisêlna pe nâwk ka ti che a, i hliemnahai chu sukdampêk ka ti che, LALPA chun a ti sih a; ‘Zion hi a nih, tukhawma an pawisak naw chu,’ tiin, nang chu hnam ṭawphnawk an inbûk che leiin.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will turn again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have compassion on his dwelling-places; and the city shall be builded upon its own hill, and the palace shall be inhabited after its own manner.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Jakob puon in sal intângna chu inlêt nâwk ka ta; a chêngna hmunhai chu lunginsiet ka tih: chun, a dêng pâwng chung ngeiahai chun khawpui chu bâwl nîng a ta, lal in ropui khawm chu chutaka a um dân pângngai ang bawkin um a tih.

en: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
hmr: Annia inthawk chun lâwmthu hrilnahai siem a ta, hlimna siem- tuhai râwl ri le chun: chun, anni chu sukpung ka ta, tlâwm naw ni hai: chun, anni chu chawimawi bawk ka ta; chîn naw ni hai.

en: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me; and I will punish all that oppress them.
hmr: An thlahai khawm chu kha hmaa ang bawk kha nîng an ta, an inkhâwmpui khawm ka hmaa chun indin nîng a ta, anni nêksâwrtu po pohai chu hrem pei ka tih.

en: And their prince shall be of themselves, and their ruler shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is he that hath had boldness to approach unto me? saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, an lal chu anni laia mi ngei nîng a ta, an rorêltu khawm chu anni laia inthawka hung suok ngei nîng a tih; chun, ama chu hung hnai dingin siem ka ta, ka kuom chu hung hnai a tih: Tu am a na, keima mi hung hnai dinga huoina nei chu? LALPA chun a ti sih a.

en: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka mihai nîng in ta, kei chu in Pathien nîng ka tih.

en: Behold, the tempest of Jehovah, even his wrath, is gone forth, a sweeping tempest: it shall burst upon the head of the wicked.
hmr: Ngai ta u, LALPA thlipui chu, a lunginsenna ngei chu, a fe suok a, mûtthieltu thlipui chu: mi rilo lu chunga chun hrâng a tih.

en: The fierce anger of Jehovah shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall understand it.
hmr: A thaw hmakhat chun LALPA lunginsenna chu hung kîr nâwk ta naw nih a; a lungrila a tum chu a thaw hmakhat chun: hi hnung tieng nihaia chun la hrieng in tih,” tiin.

en: At that time, saith Jehovah, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Chu pha chun Israel pahnam po pohai Pa- thien chu nîng ka ta, anni chu ka mihai nîng an tih,” a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, The people that were left of the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, “Mipui kâwlhnâma inthawka suok- hai chu thlalêra khan lunginsietna an hmu a; Israelin châwlna a zawng lai chun,

en: Jehovah appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
hmr: LALPA chu hlataka inthawkin a kuomah a hung inlâr a. Kumkhaw hmangaina chun ka hmangai che a, chuleiin, lunginsietna ngilneina chun ka hîp che a.

en: Again will I build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: again shalt thou be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
hmr: Bâwl nâwk ka ti cheh a, bâwlin um i tih, Aw Israel nunghâk inthieng. Khuong têhai leh inthuom nâwk i ta, hlimna siema lâmtuhai lai chun fe suok i tih.

en: Again shalt thou plant vineyards upon the mountains of Samaria; the planters shall plant, and shall enjoy the fruit thereof.
hmr: Samaria tlâng chungahai chun grêp huonhai chu siem nâwk i ta; a phuntuhai chun phun an ta, a ra chu chên an tih.

en: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the hills of Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto Jehovah our God.
hmr: Ephraim muolhaia vêngtuhai chun, ‘Tho unla, LALPA ei Pathien kuomah Ziona chun fêng ei tiu,’ tia an khêkna nihai chu a la hung tlung ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O Jehovah, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a; Jakob ta ding chun lâwmin hla sak unla, hnamhai lua um ta ding chun khêk bawk ro, phuong dar unla, inpâk unla, “Aw LALPA, Israel hla bîkhai, i mihai hi sandam rawh,” ti ro.

en: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall they return hither.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmârtieng rama inthawk chun anni chu hung ṭhuoi ka ta, chun, hnuoi hmun hlatakhaia in- thawk chun, anni le mitdel dâm, ke inbai dâm, nuhmei nau pawmlai dâm, nauhase nat tuor lai dâm chu hung ṭhuoi khâwm ka tih; chuong- chun, pâwl ropuitak chu hitieng hin hung kîr an tih.

en: They shall come with weeping; and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a straight way wherein they shall not stumble; for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my first-born.
hmr: Ṭap pumin hung an ta, thla- muongtakin anni chu ṭhuoi ka ta, tuihai vadungpuihai sîra chun, lam- pui tlûnah an insui nawna dinga chun anni chu infetir ka ta, Israel pa chu ka na, Ephraim chu ka nau lutîrtak a ni sih a.

en: Hear the word of Jehovah, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off; and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.
hmr: Aw nangni hnamhai, LALPA thu chu ngai unla, thlierkâr hlataka- hai chun phuong ro; chun, “Israel sukdartu ngei chun, ama chu kei khâwm nâwk a ta, berâmpuin a berâm ruol a kawl ang chun ama chu kawl a tih,” tiin hril ro.

en: For Jehovah hath ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
hmr: LALPA chun Jakob chu ama nêka hrât lem kuta inthawk chun ân tlansuokin a sansuok ta sih a.

en: And they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow unto the goodness of Jehovah, to the grain, and to the new wine, and to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.
hmr: Chun, hung an ta, Zion tlâng insângna laiahai chun hla hung sak an ta; LALPA ṭhatnaa chun bua leh, uoina leh, hrieka leh, berâm le bâwng ruol têhaiah lâwm an tih; an thla chu tuihnâwngtak huon ang nîng a ta, lungngai nâwk ta hrim hrim naw ni hai.

en: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
hmr: Chun, nunghâk inthienghai chu, tlangvâlhai le, upahai le chun lâmnaa chun hlim an ta; an lusûnna chu hlimnaah kân changtir ding a ni sih a; chun, anni chu thlamuon ka ta, an lungngainaa inthawk chun suk- hlim tâng ka tih.

en: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Thiempuhai thlarau chu thâuin sukkhawp ka ta, ka mihai chu ka ṭhatnain tlai an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children; she refuseth to be comforted for her children, because they are not.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Rama khuoah khêkri an hriet a, ṭap dâm, mithi ngaia khêk rawng rawng dâm, Rakil chun a nauhai a ṭah a, an um ta naw leiin thlamuon thei a ni nawh.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears; for thy work shall be rewarded, saith Jehovah; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: I râwl chu ṭapnaa inthawk le, i mithai chu mitthlihaia inthawkin insûm rawh; i sinthaw chu lâwmman pêk a ni ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih; chun, anni chu hmêlma rama in- thawk chun hung kîr nâwk an tih.

en: And there is hope for thy latter end, saith Jehovah; and thy children shall come again to their own border.
hmr: I hihnung tâwpna tienga ding chun beiseina a um a nih, LALPA chun a tih: i thlahai chu an ramri sûnga ngei chun hung nâwk an tih.

en: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus, Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a calf unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art Jehovah my God.
hmr: Ephraim chu hieng ang lusûn hin ka hriet ngei a nih: “Bâwngtê rîngkawl la bât ṭhang lo angin nangin i mi thununa, thununin ka um a; nangin mîn hertir la, chuongchun, inher ka tih: nang chu LALPA ka Pathien i ni sih a,” tiin.

en: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
hmr: Matheiloin, chu hnunga chun kân let a, kei khawm ka lamlêt tah a; chun, chu hnunga chun inchûktirin ka uma, ka êlpui chu ka ben a; kân zak a, anih, ka tleirâwl lai hmingsietna chu ka phur leiin, ka hamhai nghe nghe a.

en: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a darling child? for as often as I speak against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my heart yearneth for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Ephraim hi ka naupa dittak am a nih? Ama hi naupang tiawi am a nih? Ama ka thunun pha, ama chu ka hriet zing tlat el hi? Chuleiin, ka lungril chun ama ka lainat a; matheiloin, ama chunga chun zâ- ngaina nei ngei ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Set thee up waymarks, make thee guide-posts; set thy heart toward the highway, even the way by which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.
hmr: Lampui inchiknahai siem la, zui ding hmawlphunhai siem rawh, tlânglam tiengah, i fena lampui chu ngaituo la, kîr nâwk rawh. Aw nu- nghâk inthieng Israel, hieng i khaw- puihai tienga hin kîr nâwk rawh.

en: How long wilt thou go hither and thither, O thou backsliding daughter? for Jehovah hath created a new thing in the earth: A woman shall encompass a man.
hmr: Aw nang naunu hnungtawl, ieng chen am hitieng sawtieng i fe lawn ding a na? Hnuoia chun LALPA chun thil thar a siemsuok a, “Nuhmeiin pasal a hum ta lem,” ti hi.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Yet again shall they use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity: Jehovah bless thee, O habitation of righteousness, O mountain of holiness.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: An sal intângna ka hung lâk kîr nâwk pha chun Juda rama le chutaka khawpuihaia chun hi ṭawngbau hi la hmang nâwk an tih: “Aw indikna chêngna, LALPA chun mal sâwm raw se che,” ti dâm le, “Aw inthiengna tlâng,” ti dâm hi.

en: And Judah and all the cities thereof shall dwell therein together, the husbandmen, and they that go about with flocks.
hmr: Chun, Juda le chutaka khaw- puihai po po chu um hmunkhat tâng an ta; loneituhai le, berâm ruol le invâk vêlhai khawm chu.

en: For I have satiated the weary soul, and every sorrowful soul have I replenished.
hmr: Mi chauhai chu ka suktlai a, mi lungngai tinhai khawm chu ka sukhar bawk a.

en: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.
hmr: Hi lei hin ka tho a, ka en a, ka imu chu inhnik ka ti êm êm a.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih: Juda sûng- kuo le Israel sûngkuo chu ramsa chi le mihriem chiin tûng ka ta.

en: And it shall come to pass that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, anni chu hmalthla ding le, sukchim ding le, peithla ding le, sukse ding le, sukrinum dinga ka enkai zing ang khan, chuong ang bawk chun, anni chu bâwl ding le phun dingin enkai zing ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, “Thlatu- hai chu grêp thûr an fâk leiin, an thlahai hahai chu a ṭim,” ti ta ngai naw ni hai.

en: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi tin chu mâni suolnaa ngei chun thîng a ta, mi tin grêp thûr fatu chu, ama hahai ngei chu ṭim a tih.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih, Juda sûng- kuo le Israel sûngkuo le chun thuthlung thar siem ka ta;

en: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was a husband unto them, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka hung ṭhuoi suok dinga kuta anni ka chel nia an thlatuhai kuoma thuthlung ka siem ang dungzui kha ni loin, an ta dingin pasal ka ni dea chu, chu ka thuthlung chu an bawsiet a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith Jehovah: I will put my law in their inward parts, and in their heart will I write it; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
hmr: Amiruokchu, chuong nihai hnunga Israel sûngkuo le thuthlung ka siem ding chu hi hi nîng a tih, LALPA chun a tih: an sûngrilahai chun ka dân chu sieng ka ta, an lungrilahai chun ziek bawk ka tih; chun, an Pathien nîng ka ta, anni chu ka mihai nîng an tih,

en: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know Jehovah; for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith Jehovah: for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin will I remember no more.
hmr: chun, mi tinin mâni tuol- bâwmhai chu inchûktir ta naw ni hai a, mâni unauhai seng leh; “LALPA chu hre ro,” tiin inchûktir ta naw ni hai, anni a chîn taka inthawka a lien tak chenin kei an mi hriet vawng ta ding a nih, LALPA chun a tih: an bawsietnahai chu ngaidam ka ta, an suolna khawm hre zing ta naw ning.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, who giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, who stirreth up the sea, so that the waves thereof roar; Jehovah of hosts is his name:
hmr: Sûna nisa chu var dinga pea, zâna arasihai le thla var dinga ruotna petu, tuisuoriet chu chawkthoa, tuifâwnhai inrûmtirtu LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ama chu sipaihai LALPA chu a hming a na;

en: If these ordinances depart from before me, saith Jehovah, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.
hmr: Hieng thil ruothai hi ka hmaa inthawka an lo fe hmang chun, Israel khawm chu kumkhuoa dingin ka hmaa chun hnam an ni chu bo ve bawk a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Chunga vân khi inkhi thei a na, hnuoia leihnuoi lungphûm chu zawng suok thei a ni chun, thil an lo thaw tahai po po lei khan Israel chi chu pei hmang vêng ka tih: LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that the city shall be built to Jehovah from the tower of Hananel unto the gate of the corner.
hmr: Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih: Hananel in insânga inthawka a kia dai kawtkhâr chenin, LALPA ta dingin khawpui chu bâwl nîng a tih.

en: And the measuring line shall go out further straight onward unto the hill Gareb, and shall turn about unto Goah.
hmr: Chun, ân khina hmawl chu Gareb tlâng chenin fe tluon suok a ta, Goaa chun va kâwi a tih.

en: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto Jehovah; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.
hmr: Chun, mithi ruong phairuom pumpui le, vut phairuom le Kidron vadungtê chen, saktienga sakawr dai kawtkhâr chen ram po po kha, LALPA chanpuol nîng a tih, sukdar ni naw nih a, kumkhuoin pei thlâk khawm ni bawk naw nih.

en: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
hmr: Juda ram lal Zedekia inlal kum sâwmnaa LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chu; chu kum chu Nebukad- nezzar inlal kum sâwmpariet kum a nih.

en: Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem; and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu huna chun Babulon lal sipaihai chun Jerusalem chu an inhuol a; chun, zâwlnei Jeremia khawm chu Juda ram lal ina vêngtu kulbînga chun khârkhumin a um a.

en: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;
hmr: Juda ram lal Zedekia chun ama chu a khum a, “Ieng dinga hienga thu hi i hril am a na?, ‘LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, hi khawpui hi Babulon lal kuta chun pêng ka ta, ama chun lâng a tih.

en: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes;
hmr: Juda ram lal Zedekia khawm chu Kaldaihai kuta inthawk chun suok- thleng naw nih a; amiruokchu, Babulon lal kuta chun matheiloin pêk ni lem a tih, ama chu bau le bau inphâkin bieng a ta, a mithai chun ama mithai chu hmu bawk a tih;

en: and he shall bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith Jehovah: though ye fight with the Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper?
hmr: chun, Zedekia chu Babulona chun ṭhuoi a ta, ka va sir hmakhat chun chutaka chun um zing a ta, LALPA chun a tih: Kaldaihai chu do unla khawm, hlawtling naw ti niu,’ i tih a,” a ta.

en: And Jeremiah said, The word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Jeremia chun a hril a, “LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a, hieng hin a hril,

en: Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is thine to buy it.
hmr: Ngai ta, i pami Sallum naupa Hanamel chu i kuomah hung a ta, ‘Anathotha um ka lo inchaw rawh, inchaw dinga intlansuokna thuneina chu nangma ta a ni sih a,’ tîng a ta.

en: So Hanamel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of Jehovah, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is thine, and the redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka pami naupa Hanamel chu vêngtu kulbînga chun LALPA thu ang pei chun ka kuomah a hung a, ka kuoma chun, ‘Ka ngên che, ka lo Anathotha um, Benjamin rama um chu inchaw rawh; rohluona thuneina chu nangma ta a ni sih a, intlansuokna khawm chu nangma ta bawk a na, i ta dingin inchaw el rawh,’ a hung tih a.

en: And I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel mine uncle’s son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.
hmr: Chun, kei chun chu chu LALPA thu a nih ti ka hriet a. Chun, ka pami naupa Hanamel lo Anathotha um chu kân châwk tah a; tangka shekel sâwm- pasari chu ama ka bûkpêk tah a.

en: And I subscribed the deed, and sealed it, and called witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances.
hmr: Chun, thuziek chu suoi ka thawh a, ka nam tah a, chun, hriet- puitu ka ko a, ama chu bûkna chun tangka chu ka bûkpêk tah a.

en: So I took the deed of the purchase, both that which was sealed, according to the law and custom, and that which was open:
hmr: Chun, dân ang le hmangchâng ang peiin, inchâwkna thuziek chu ka lâk a, chu chu hawng a na;

en: and I delivered the deed of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel mine uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the guard.
hmr: vêngtu kulbînga Juda ṭhanghai po po hmaa chun, inchâwkna thu- zieka hrietpuitu mithmua chun, ka pami naupa Hanamel hmaihmaah, inchâwkna thuziek chu Maaseia naupa, Neria naupa Baruk kuoma chun ka pêk tah a.

en: And I charged Baruch before them, saying,
hmr: An hmaa chun Baruk chu thu ka pêk tah a,

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Take these deeds, this deed of the purchase which is sealed, and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel; that they may continue many days.
hmr: ‘Sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Hieng thuziek- hai, inchâwkna thuziek, chara um le hawngsaa um hi la la, pil bêlah va sie rawh; ni sâwttak el an um theina dingin.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Houses and fields and vineyards shall yet again be bought in this land.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Inhai, lohai, grêp huonhai chu hi rama hin in- châwk la ni nâwk an tih a ti sih a,’” tiin.

en: Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed unto Jehovah, saying,
hmr: “Chun, Neria naupa Baruk kuoma inchâwkna thuziek chu ka pêk hnung chun LALPA kuoma chun ka ṭawngṭai tah a.

en: Ah Lord Jehovah! behold, thou hast made the heavens and the earth by thy great power and by thine outstretched arm; there is nothing too hard for thee,
hmr: ‘Aw LALPA Pathien; i bân phar le i thilthawtheina ropuitak chun vân le hnuoi chu i siem a; nanga ta ding chun iengkhawm intak taluo a um nawh a;

en: who showest lovingkindness unto thousands, and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them; the great, the mighty God, Jehovah of hosts is his name;
hmr: nang chun sâng kuoma zâ- ngaina inentira, pahai suolna chu an nauhai ângsûnga thungna petu, Pathien thilthawthei, ropui le, sipai- hai LALPA chu a hming a nih;

en: great in counsel, and mighty in work; whose eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men, to give every one according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings;
hmr: rorêlnaa ropui le, sinthawa thil- thawthei tak, mihriem nauhai um- dân po po hmu zing hlak; mi tin chu ama um dân le a thilthawhai ang peia pe dingin;

en: who didst set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even unto this day, both in Israel and among other men; and madest thee a name, as at this day;
hmr: ama chun vawisûn ni chen hin Aigupta rama chun inchiknahai le thilmakhai chu a thawh a, Israel rama le mi danghai kuoma khawm; vawisûn nia ang hin ama chun hming a siempêk cheh a.

en: and didst bring forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terror;
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawkin i mi Israelhai chu inchiknahai dâm, thil- makhai dâm, kut hrât dâm le, bân phar dâm le ṭium nasatak leh i hung ṭhuoi suok a;

en: and gavest them this land, which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;
hmr: hi ram nênetui le khuoizua luong ram, an thlatuhai kuoma pêk dinga i lo tiem ta ram hi an kuoma chun i pêk tah a;

en: and they came in, and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice, neither walked in thy law; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them.
hmr: chuongchun, an hung lût a, an nei a, nisienlakhawm, i râwl chu an awi nawh a, i dân khawm chu an zâwm bawk nawh a; anni chun thaw dinga thu i pêkhai a iengkhawm chu an thaw nawh a; chuleiin, thil ṭha naw tinrêng chu an chunga chun în tlungtir a,

en: Behold, the mounds, they are come unto the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans that fight against it, because of the sword, and of the famine, and of the pestilence; and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and, behold, thou seest it.
hmr: en ta u, khawpui lâkna dingin hnuoi dêng pâwnghai an hung um ta hi, nangin hung tlung dinga i hril angin, hripui le, ṭâm le kâwlhnâm leiin, a hung dotu Kaldaihai kuta chun khawpui chu pêk a ni tah a; en ta, i hmu zing hi.

en: And thou hast said unto me, O Lord Jehovah, Buy thee the field for money, and call witnesses; whereas the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
hmr: Ka kuoma chun Aw LALPA Pathien, “Lo chu tangkain inchaw la, hrepuituhai ko la,” i ta, nisienla- khawm, khawpui chu Kaldaihai kuta pêk a ni ta sih a,’” tiin.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Jeremia kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Behold, I am Jehovah, the God of all flesh: is there anything too hard for me?
hmr: “Ngai ta, mi tinrêng Pathien, LALPA chu ka nih, keia ta dingin thil intak taluo a um am a nih?

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, hi khawpui hi Kaldaihai kuta le Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar kuta chun pêng ka ta, ama chun lâng a tih;

en: and the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set this city on fire, and burn it, with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink-offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.
hmr: chun, hi khaw hung dotu Kaldaihai chu hung an ta, hi khuo hi meiin hung râwng an ta, a inhai a chunga Baal kuoma riminhnik an râwna le, kei mi suklungsenna dinga pathien danghai kuoma dâwn mi thilinhlânhai an lo bunthlâkna inhai le chun kâng a tih.

en: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only that which was evil in my sight from their youth; for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, saith Jehovah.
hmr: An naupang laia inthawk tah Juda thlahai le Israel thlahai hin ka mithmuah thil suol chu an lo thaw hlak sih a; Israel thlahai chun an kut sinthawhai chun an mi lo suklungsen sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: For this city hath been to me a provocation of mine anger and of my wrath from the day that they built it even unto this day; that I should remove it from before my face,
hmr: Hi khawpui hi an bâwl ṭan nia inthawk vawisûn ni chen hin, keia ta ding chun ka ṭiumna le ka lungin- senna chawkthona chau a nih; chuongchun, ka hmaihmaa inthawk- in ka sawn hmang ding a nih;

en: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Juda thlahai le Israel thlahai suolna po po, mi suklungsenna ding ela, anni le an lalhai le an rorêltuhai le, an thiempuhai le, an zâwlneihai le, Juda rama mihai le Jerusalem hluotuhaiin an lo thaw tahai lei chun.

en: And they have turned unto me the back, and not the face: and though I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not hearkened to receive instruction.
hmr: Chun, kei chu hmatieng ni loin, hnungtieng an mînnghat a, inhma- taka thoa anni inchûktirin, anni chu ka lo inchûktira chu, inchûktirna chu hre dingin an ngai si nawh a.

en: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
hmr: Amiruokchu, an tirdakumna chu ka hming chawia sak in chu sukpawrche dingin an sieh a.

en: And they built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire unto Molech; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.
hmr: Hinnom phairuoma um Baal bâwlhmunhai chu Molek kuoma an naupasalhai le an naunuhmeihai meia infethlengtirna dingin an bâwl a, Juda chu suol inthawtir dingin, hi tirdakumna dâm hi thâwng an tih ti ka lungrila khawm a lût ngainawh.

en: And now therefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, concerning this city, whereof ye say, It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence:
hmr: “Chuleiin, tuhin, hi khawpui, ‘Hripui le, ṭâm le, kâwlhnâmah Babulon lal kuta pêk a ni tah,’ i ti chungthua hin Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih:

en: Behold, I will gather them out of all the countries, whither I have driven them in mine anger, and in my wrath, and in great indignation; and I will bring them again unto this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ka lunginsenna le ka ṭiumna le, ka lunginthaka anni ka hnawt hmangna ram po poa inthawk chun anni chu kei khâwm ka ta; hi hmuna hin hung ṭhuoi nâwk ka ta, himtakin inchêngtir ka tih;

en: And they shall be my people, and I will be their God:
hmr: anni chu ka mihai nîng an ta, kei khawm an Pathien nîng ka tih;

en: and I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear me for ever, for the good of them, and of their children after them:
hmr: kumkhuoa an mi ṭi theina dingin anni chu lungril pakhat le lampui pakhat chau pêng ka tih; anni le an hnunga an thlahai ṭhatna dingin.

en: and I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from following them, to do them good; and I will put my fear in their hearts, that they may not depart from me.
hmr: Anni chu sukṭha dingin, annia inthawka kân her hmang nawna dingin, anni le chun kumkhaw thu- thlung siem ka ta; chun, an lungrila chun keia ṭina sieng ka ta, keimaa inthawk chun fe hmang ta naw ni hai.

en: Yea, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.
hmr: Anih, anni chu sukṭha dingin an chungah hlim tâng ka ta, hi rama hin ka lungril po po le, ka lungvar po poin thudikah anni chu phun ka tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah: Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people, so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Hi hnam chunga hieng thil ṭha naw nasatakhai po po kân tlungtir ang bawk hin, an chunga hin thil ṭha an kuoma ka tiem tahai po po chu hung intlungtir vêng ka tih.

en: And fields shall be bought in this land, whereof ye say, It is desolate, without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
hmr: Chun, ‘Ramsahai le mihriem boin, râusan a ni tah a; Kaldaihai kuta pêk a ni tah,’ in ti, hi rama hin lohai chu inchâwk nîng a ta.

en: Men shall buy fields for money, and subscribe the deeds, and seal them, and call witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, and in the cities of the hill-country, and in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South: for I will cause their captivity to return, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Mihaiin lohai chu tangka sumin inchâwng an ta, thuziek chu ziek det an ta, châr an tih, hrietpuituhai ko an ta, Benjamin rama dâm, Jerusalem vêla hmunahai dâm, tlângram khaw- puiahai dâm, phairuoma khawpuia- hai dâm, Sima khawpuiahai dâm chun: an sal intângnaa inthawkin kân kîrtir ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih” tiin.

en: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah the second time, while he was yet shut up in the court of the guard, saying,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm vêngtu kulbînga khârkhum a ni sûng chun a vawi hninaah Jeremia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a:

en: Thus saith Jehovah that doeth it, Jehovah that formeth it to establish it; Jehovah is his name:
hmr: “LALPA a thawtu, indin dinga LALPA a siemtu chun hieng hin a tih: LALPA ti chu a hming a nih:

en: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and will show thee great things, and difficult, which thou knowest not.
hmr: Kei mi hung ko la, lo dawn ka ti cheh a, thil ropui le inthup i hriet naw hai chu inentir ka ti che.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are broken down to make a defence against the mounds and against the sword;
hmr: Hi khawpui inhai chungthua le Juda ram lalhai in kâwlhnâm le hnuoi dêng pâwng lama inthawka dangna siemna dinga sukchima um- hai chungthua chun Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih:

en: while men come to fight with the Chaldeans, and to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have slain in mine anger and in my wrath, and for all whose wickedness I have hid my face from this city:
hmr: Kaldaihai chu do dingin an hung a, ka lunginthaknaa le ka lungin- sennaa ka that ding mi ruonghaia suksip dingin, an suolnahai po po leiin hi khawpuia inthawk ka hmai ka thup ta si a.

en: Behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them; and I will reveal unto them abundance of peace and truth.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hrisêlna le sukdamna intlungtir ka ta, anni chu sukdam ka tih; chun, an kuoma chun thudik le thlamuongna tamtak chu suklang bawk ka tih.

en: And I will cause the captivity of Judah and the captivity of Israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.
hmr: Juda sal intângna le Israel sal intângna chu inlamlêttir ka ta, a tîra ang khan anni chu rem ka tih.

en: And I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, whereby they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, whereby they have sinned against me, and whereby they have transgressed against me.
hmr: An suolna po po, ka chunga an lo suksuolnahaia inthawk khan anni chu sukthieng ka ta, an bawsietnahai po po chu ngaidam ka ta, ka chunga an lo suksuolnahai le, ka chunga an lo bawsietnahai chu.

en: And this city shall be to me for a name of joy, for a praise and for a glory, before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do unto them, and shall fear and tremble for all the good and for all the peace that I procure unto it.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chunga hnam po pohai, an chunga thil ṭha ka thaw po po hretuhai le, thil ṭha po po le thlamuongna po po a ta dinga kân neitir hretuhai ṭiin inthin an tih; ka ta dingin hi khawpui hi hlimna hming le, inpâkna ding le ropuina ding hung nîng a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Yet again there shall be heard in this place, whereof ye say, It is waste, without man and without beast, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without beast,
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Sa le mihriem khawm um loin a sie a,’ in ti, hi hmuna le, Juda ram khawpui- haia le, hluotu um loa, ran khawm um loa râusan Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai chun hieng hi hriet la nîng a tih:

en: the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of them that say, Give thanks to Jehovah of hosts, for Jehovah is good, for his lovingkindness endureth for ever; and of them that bring sacrifices of thanksgiving into the house of Jehovah. For I will cause the captivity of the land to return as at the first, saith Jehovah.
hmr: hlimna râwl dâm, lâwmna râwl dâm, moneitu râwl dâm, mo le, ‘Sipaihai LALPA kuoma chun lâwmthu hril ro, LALPA chu a ṭha sih a; a zainêmna chu kumkhuoin um zing a tih,’ tituhai râwl le, LALPA ina lâwmthu hrilna inthâwinahai hung chawituhai râwl ri chu. Hi ram sal intângna hi a tîr ang khan ka lamlêt ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Yet again shall there be in this place, which is waste, without man and without beast, and in all the cities thereof, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Chu nawa khawm, hi hmuna hin, mihriem le sa khawm um loa se ta le chutaka khawpuihaia po po chun, berâmpuhai an ran ruol chu inbawktirin la um an tih.

en: In the cities of the hill-country, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South, and in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, shall the flocks again pass under the hands of him that numbereth them, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Tlângrama khawpuiahai le, phairuoma khawpuiahai le, Sima khawpuiahai le, Benjamin rama khawpuiahai le, Jerusalem vêl hmun- ahai le, Juda khawpuiahai chun berâm ruolhai chu anni tiemtu kut hnuoiah la tla nâwk an tih, LALPA chun a tih:

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will perform that good word which I have spoken concerning the house of Israel and concerning the house of Judah.
hmr: “Ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih: Juda sûng- kuo chungthua le, Israel sûngkuo chungthua thil ṭha ka hril kha ka thaw ding a nih.

en: In those days, and at that time, will I cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up unto David; and he shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
hmr: Chuong nihaia le, chu huna chun, David kuoma chun felna Kau hung indâwntir ka ta, rama chun rorêlna le felna chu tir suok a tih.

en: In those days shall Judah be saved, and Jerusalem shall dwell safely; and this is the name whereby she shall be called: Jehovah our righteousness.
hmr: Chuong nihaia chun Juda chu sandam ni tâng a ta, Jerusalem khawm chu himtakin chêng tâng a tih: chun, ‘LALPA chu ei felna a nih,’ ti hi koa a umna ding hming chu ni ta bawk a tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah: David shall never want a man to sit upon the throne of the house of Israel;
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Israel sûngkuo lalṭhungpha chung- a ṭhung ding, David chun mi tlasam ngai naw ni;

en: neither shall the priests the Levites want a man before me to offer burnt-offerings, and to burn meal-offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.
hmr: thiempu Levi mihai chun ka hmaa pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai, bu thilinhlânhai, châmchia inthâwi- na inhlân dingin mi tlasam bawk naw ni hai,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Jeremia kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Thus saith Jehovah: If ye can break my covenant of the day, and my covenant of the night, so that there shall not be day and night in their season;
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: sûn le zân an huntaka um lo dinga ka sûn thuthlung le ka zân thuthlung hi in suksiet thei a ni chun,

en: then may also my covenant be broken with David my servant, that he shall not have a son to reign upon his throne; and with the Levites the priests, my ministers.
hmr: chuong ang bawk chun a lalṭhungphaa ṭhung ding naupasal nei lo dingin ka siehlaw David le ka thuthlung khawm hi suksiet thei nîng a tih; ka rawngbâwltuhai, thiem- puhai le Levi mihai le thuthlunghai khawm chu.

en: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured; so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites that minister unto me.
hmr: Vâna umhai chu tiem sêng an ni nawh a, tuisuoriet phaiphin chu inkhi ruol a ni naw ang bawkin; ka siehlaw David chithla chu sukpung ka ta, keia ta dinga rawngbâwltu Levi mihai le chun” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came to Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a,

en: Considerest thou not what this people have spoken, saying, The two families which Jehovah did choose, he hath cast them off? thus do they despise my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.
hmr: “Hi mi, Hnam pahni LALPA thlanghai chu, anni chu a pei thlâk tah, tituhai chu ngaituo naw rawh; chuongchun, anni hmaa hnam hrim an ni ta nawna dingin, anni chun ka mihai chu an hmusit a nih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: If my covenant of day and night stand not, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Zân le sûn dinga ka thuthlung hi a um zing nawha, hnuoi le vâna thil ruota umhai chu ka sukdet naw chun,

en: then will I also cast away the seed of Jacob, and of David my servant, so that I will not take of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to return, and will have mercy on them.
hmr: Abraham hai, Isak hai, Jakob hai thlahai chunga rorêltuhai ding ka lâk nawna dingin, ka siehlaw David le Jakob thla chu peihâwn vêng ka tih; an sal intângna chu kân kîrtir ding a na, an chunga chun zângaina ka nei ding a ni sih a” tiin.

en: The word which came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his dominion, and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem, and against all the cities thereof, saying:
hmr: Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar le a sipaihai po po le, a ram sûnga hnuoi chunga lalram po pohai le mi po poin Jerusalem le a khawpuihai po po an do laia LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chu:

en: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Go, and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire:
hmr: LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Fe la, Juda lal Zedekia kuoma chun thu hril la, ama chu hieng hin hril rawh: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, hi khawpui hi Babulon lal kutah ka pêk ding a na, ama chun meiin râwng a ta;

en: and thou shalt not escape out of his hand, but shalt surely be taken, and delivered into his hand; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and thou shalt go to Babylon.
hmr: nang khawm a kuta inthawk chun suok naw ti nih a, ṭhuoi ni ngei ngei i ta, a kuta pêk i ni ding a nih: Babulon lal mithai chu nanga mithai ngei chun hmûng a ta, ama chun bau inphâkin i kuomah thu hril a tih; chun, nang chu Babulonah fe bawk i tih.

en: Yet hear the word of Jehovah, O Zedekiah king of Judah: thus saith Jehovah concerning thee, Thou shalt not die by the sword;
hmr: Amiruokchu, Juda lal Aw Zede- kia, LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta; i chungthua chun LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Kâwlhnâm chun thi naw ti nih a;

en: thou shalt die in peace; and with the burnings of thy fathers, the former kings that were before thee, so shall they make a burning for thee; and they shall lament thee, saying, Ah Lord! for I have spoken the word, saith Jehovah.
hmr: thlamuongtakin thîng i tih; thlatuhai, i hmaa lal hmasa lo um tahai riminhnik an rawpêk ang khan, nangma ta ding khawma riminhnik râwng an ta, “Aw lalpa!” tiin ṭâng an ti che; hi thu hi ka lo hril ta si a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Then Jeremiah the prophet spake all these words unto Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Juda ram lal Zedekia kuoma chun hieng thuhai hi Jerusalema chun a hril a;

en: when the king of Babylon’s army was fighting against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.
hmr: chuong lai chun Babulon lal sipaihai chun Jerusalem dâm, Juda rama khawpui mâksana la umhai po po dâm, Lakis le Azeka dâm chu an hung rûn mêk a; hieng khawpuihai chau hi Juda rama chun khawpui kul neia um sun chu an ta sih a.

en: The word that came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people that were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty unto them;
hmr: Lal Zedekiain Jerusalema mipui- hai po po kuoma, an kuoma zalênna thu phuong dinga thuthlung a siem hnunga Jeremia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu:

en: that every man should let his man-servant, and every man his maid-servant, that is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free; that none should make bondmen of them, to wit, of a Jew his brother.
hmr: “Mi tin chun a siehlawpa ama- nih, a siehlawnu amanih, Hebraipa amanih, Hebrainu amanih a ni chun, zalênin insuoktir a ta; a unau Juda chanpui rawngbâwlpêkin tukhawm a um ding a ni nawh”, tiin;

en: And all the princes and all the people obeyed, that had entered into the covenant, that every one should let his man-servant, and every one his maid-servant, go free, that none should make bondmen of them any more; they obeyed, and let them go:
hmr: chun, mipui po po le rorêltuhai po po chun an remtih a; thuthlung chu an awi tah a, chuongchun, mi tin chun mâni siehlawpa amanih, mi tin chun mâni siehlawnu amani chu zalênin insuoktir a ta, tukhawma ama rawng chu bâwlpêk ni ta naw ni; chu chu an awi a, an infetir tâwl tah a:

en: but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, chu hnunga chun an lamlêt a, siehlawpahai le siehlawnuhai chu zalêna an lo insuoktir tahai chu kîr dingin an ti nâwk a, siehlawpahai ding le sie- hlawnuhai ni dingin thununna hnuoiah an lâk lût nâwk tah a;

en: Therefore the word of Jehovah came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: chuleiin, LALPA thu chu LALPA kuoma inthawk chun Jeremia kuoma chun a hung tlung a;

en: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,
hmr: “LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Intângna ina in- thawk, Aigupta rama inthawka anni ka ṭhuoi suok lai chun in thlatuhai kuoma chun hienga hril hin thuthlung ka lo siem tah a:

en: At the end of seven years ye shall let go every man his brother that is a Hebrew, that hath been sold unto thee, and hath served thee six years, thou shalt let him go free from thee: but your fathers hearkened not unto me, neither inclined their ear.
hmr: ‘Mi tinin a unaupa Hebrai mi nia, ama kuoma zawra lo um amanih, ama chu kum ruk sûng rawng lo bâwlpêk ta chu, kum sari tâwpa chun infetir in ta, nangmaa inthawk chun a thlâwnin în fetir ding a nih,’ tiin, nisienlakhawm, in thlatuhai chun an mi ngai nawh a, an na khawm an sit nawh.

en: And ye were now turned, and had done that which is right in mine eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and ye had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
hmr: Chun, tu el khawm in hung lamlêt a, mi tinin mâni tuolbâwm ta dinga zalênna phuongin, ka mit- hmuah thilindik chu in thaw tah a; chun, ka hming chawia ko ina chun ka hmaah thuthlung khawm chu in lo siem ta bawk a.
