en: but ye turned and profaned my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom ye had let go free at their pleasure, to return; and ye brought them into subjection, to be unto you for servants and for handmaids.
hmr: Amiruokchu, in inher a, ka hming chu in sukpawrche tah a; mi tin chun a siehlawpa le a siehlawnu, an nuom anga zalêna in infetir tahai chu in inkîrtir nâwk tah a; thununna hnuoia chun in lâklût nâwk a, in ta dinga siehlawpahai le siehlawnuhai ni dingin.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Ye have not hearkened unto me, to proclaim liberty, every man to his brother, and every man to his neighbor: behold, I proclaim unto you a liberty, saith Jehovah, to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Mi tinin mâni unaupa chunga le, mi tinin mâni tuolbâwm chunga zalênna phuong dingin ka thu in ngai naw a nih; ngai ta u, kâwlhnâm kuoma le, ṭâm kuoma le hripui kuoma chun in ta dingin zalênna chu ka phuong a nih, LALPA chun a tih: chuongchun, leihnuoia lalram po pohai laia hnungtieng hmatienga hnawt lêng dingin ka siem ding cheu a nih.

en: And I will give the men that have transgressed my covenant, that have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me, when they cut the calf in twain and passed between the parts thereof;
hmr: Chun, ka thuthlung bawsetu mihai, bâwngtê chu tum hnia chana a kâra fethleng ka hmaa an thuthlung thuhai thaw si lohai chu pêng ka ta;

en: the princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, that passed between the parts of the calf;
hmr: Juda ram lalhai, Jerusalema rorêltuhai, mi tillâkhai, thiempuhai le, rama mi po po chu bâwngtê tum hni inkâra lût thleng tahai chu;

en: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life; and their dead bodies shall be for food unto the birds of the heavens, and to the beasts of the earth.
hmr: anni khawm chu an hringna zawngtuhai le, an hmêlmahai kuta chun pêng ka tih; chuongchun, an taksa thihai khawm chu hnuoia ramsahai le chunglêng vatehai ta dinga bu nîng a tih.

en: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, that are gone away from you.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Zedekia le a rorêltuhai khawm chu an hmêlmahai kuta le, an hringna zawngtuhai kuta le, nangnia inthawka hang fe, Babulon lal sipaihai kuta chun pêng ka tih.

en: Behold, I will command, saith Jehovah, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thu pêng ka ta, hi khawpuia hin hung inkîrtir ka tih; LALPA chun a tih: chun, do an ta, lâng an ta, meiin râwng an tih; chuongchun, Juda khawpuihai chu hluotu um loa râusanah siem ka tih,” tiin.

en: The word which came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
hmr: Juda ram lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim hun laia LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chun hieng hin a tih:

en: Go unto the house of the Rechabites, and speak unto them, and bring them into the house of Jehovah, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.
hmr: “Rekab mihai ina chun va fe la, an kuomah thu va hril la, LALPA ina pindan pakhata hin anni chu hung ṭhuoi la, an kuomah uoin dâwn ding pe rawh,” tiin.

en: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, and his brethren, and all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites;
hmr: Chun, Habazzinia naupa, Jeremia naupa Jaazania le a unau- hai le a naupasalhai po po le, Rekab sûngkuohai po po chu ka ṭhuoi a;

en: and I brought them into the house of Jehovah, into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was by the chamber of the princes, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the threshold.
hmr: Pathien mi Igdalia naupa Hanan naupasalhai pindan, kawtkhâr vêng- tu Sallum naupa Maaseia pindan chunga um, rorêltuhai pindan sîra um LALPA ina chun anni chu ka hung ṭhuoi a;

en: And I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites bowls full of wine, and cups; and I said unto them, Drink ye wine.
hmr: chun, Rekab sûngkaw naupa- salhai hmaa chun maihûn uoina sip le nohai ka sieh a, an kuoma chun, “Uoin hi dâwn ro,” ka tih a.

en: But they said, We will drink no wine; for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, Ye shall drink no wine, neither ye, nor your sons, for ever:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun an dawn a, “Uoin chu dâwn naw ning ungah; kan thlatu Rekab unaupa Jonadab chun hieng hin thu a mi pêk sih a: ‘Kumkhuoin nangniin amanih, in naupasalhai khawmin amanih uoin hi dâwn ngai naw ti niu a;

en: neither shall ye build house, nor sow seed, nor plant vineyard, nor have any; but all your days ye shall dwell in tents; that ye may live many days in the land wherein ye sojourn.
hmr: in khawm bâwl ngai naw ti niu a, thlai chi khawm thlâk nâwng in ta, grêp huon khawm chîngin amanih, nei khawm nei bawk naw ti niu; nisienlakhawm, in nihai po po chu puon inah chêng in ta, in inpêmna rama chun ni tamtak in um theina dingin,’ tiin.

en: And we have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, or our daughters;
hmr: Chuongchun, kan thlatu Rekab naupa Jonadab râwl chu, kan dam sûng po poa, keini le kan nuhmeihai le kan naupasalhai le, kan naunu- hmeihai le, uoin dâwn lo dinga a mi tiem chu kan awi a;

en: nor to build houses for us to dwell in; neither have we vineyard, nor field, nor seed:
hmr: kan chêngna dinga inhai bâwl lo bawk ding dâmin, thlai chi dâm, lohai dâm, grêp huonhai dâm khawm kan nei bawk nawh a;

en: but we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed, and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
hmr: puon inahai chun kan chêng a, kan thlatu Jonadabin thu a mi pêk ang taphawt chun kan zâwm a nih.

en: But it came to pass, when Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, that we said, Come, and let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans, and for fear of the army of the Syrians; so we dwell at Jerusalem.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chu hi rama hin a hung lai khan, ‘Thaw ro, Kaldai sipaihai ṭi lei le, Suria sipaihai ṭi leiin, Jerusalemah hang fêng ei tiu,’ kan tih a; chuongchun, Jerusalema chun kan hang chêng tah a,” tiin.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Jeremia kuoma chun a hung tlung tah a:

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Go, and say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, Will ye not receive instruction to hearken to my words? saith Jehovah.
hmr: “Sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Fe la, Juda ram mihai le Jerusalem hluotuhai kuoma chun hi hi va hril rawh: ‘Ka thuhai chu ngai dingin, inchûktirna chu in pawm naw ding am a nih?’ LALPA chun a tih.

en: The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, that he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; and unto this day they drink none, for they obey their father’s commandment. But I have spoken unto you, rising up early and speaking; and ye have not hearkened unto me.
hmr: Uoin dâwn lo dinga thu a naupasalhai a ipêk, Rekab naupa Jonadab thuhai chu thawin a um a, vawisûn ni chen hin an dâwn nawh a, an thlatu thupêk chu an pawm leiin: amiruokchu, zîngkâra thoa thuhrilin, in kuoma chun thu ka hrila chu in ngai si nawh a.

en: I have sent also unto you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Return ye now every man from his evil way, and amend your doings, and go not after other gods to serve them, and ye shall dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers: but ye have not inclined your ear, nor hearkened unto me.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâra thoa anni hung tirin, ‘Mi tin chu mâni lampui suola inthawk chun hung kîr unla, in thil- thawhai chu siemṭha unla, pathien danghai chu an rawng bâwl dingin zui bawk naw ro, chuongchun, nangni le in thlatuhai kuoma ram ka ipêk cheua hin chêng in tih,’ tiin, ka siehlaw zâwlneihai po po chu in kuomah ka hung tir a; nisienla- khawm, in na khawm in sit nawh a, ngai khawm in mi ngai naw kha.

en: Forasmuch as the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people hath not hearkened unto me;
hmr: Rekab naupa Jonadab naupa- salhaiin an pain thu a pêk an thaw vei leh, hi mihai hlak hin an mi ngai si nawh a;

en: therefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will bring upon Judah and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them; because I have spoken unto them, but they have not heard; and I have called unto them, but they have not answered.
hmr: chuleiin, LALPA, Sipaihai Pathien, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Juda ram chunga le Jerusalem hluotuhai po po chunga chun, an chunga thil ṭha naw tlung ding ka hril ta kha ka hung intlungtir ding a nih; an kuomah thu ka hril a, an ngai naw leiin, anni chu ka ko a, an mi dawn naw leiin,” tiin.

en: And Jeremiah said unto the house of the Rechabites, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Because ye have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts, and done according unto all that he commanded you;
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Rekab sûngkuohai kuoma chun a hril a, “Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: In thlatu Jona- dab thupêk chu in awi a, a dânhai po po chu in pawm a, a thupêk ang tak cheua in thaw leiin;

en: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not want a man to stand before me for ever.
hmr: sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Rekab naupa Jonadab hin kumkhuoin ka hmaa ngîr ding mi tlasam ngai naw ni,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, that this word came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: Juda ram lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim inlal kum linaa chun hi thu hi LALPA kuoma in- thawk chun Jeremia kuomah a hung tlung tah a:

en: Take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the words that I have spoken unto thee against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the days of Josiah, even unto this day.
hmr: “Lekhabu zuol la la, chutaka chun Israel ram chungthu le, Juda ram chungthu le, hnam po pohai chungthu, Josia hun laia inthawka i kuoma thu ka hril nia inthawka vawisûn ni chena mi hi, thu ka hrilhai po po chu ziek rawh.

en: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I purpose to do unto them; that they may return every man from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.
hmr: An chunga thil ṭha naw thaw ka tum chu Juda sûngkuohai chun an hrietin, an suolna chu ka ngaidam theina dingin mi tin chu mâni um dân suola inthawk chun an hung kîr rawi mawh,” tiin.

en: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of Jehovah, which he had spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Neria naupa Baruk chu a ko a; Baruk chun LALPAIN a kuoma thu a hrilhai po po chu lekhabu zuola chun Jeremia baua inthawk chun a ziek tah a.

en: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of Jehovah:
hmr: Jeremia chun Baruk chu thu a pêk a, “Kei chu khum ka na, LALPA ina chun ka fe thei nawh a;

en: therefore go thou, and read in the roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the words of Jehovah in the ears of the people in Jehovah’s house upon the fast-day; and also thou shalt read them in the ears of all Judah that come out of their cities.
hmr: chuleiin, nang va fe la, lekhabu zuola ka baua inthawka LALPA thuhai i ziekhai kha bunghei niin LALPA inah mipui na hrieta chun va tiem rawh; chun, Juda mi an khawpuihaia inthawka hung suokhai po po na hrieta chun tiem bawk rawh.

en: It may be they will present their supplication before Jehovah, and will return every one from his evil way; for great is the anger and the wrath that Jehovah hath pronounced against this people.
hmr: An hnina chu LALPA hmaa pein, mi tin chu mâni um dân suola inthawk chun an hung kîr rawi mawh: hi mihai chunga lunginsenna le ṭitumna LALPAIN a hril chu a nasa hle sih a,” tiin.

en: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the words of Jehovah in Jehovah’s house.
hmr: Chun, Neria naupa Baruk chun, LALPA ina chun LALPA thuhai chu lekhabua chun tiemin zâwlnei Jeremia thupêk po po angtak chun a thaw tah a.

en: Now it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, that all the people in Jerusalem, and all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim inlal kum ngana, thla kuonaa chun Jerusalema mi po pohai, Juda ram khawpuihaia inthawka Jerusalema mipui hung po pohai chun LALPA hmaa bunghei chu an phuong tah a.

en: Then read Baruch in the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of Jehovah, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the new gate of Jehovah’s house, in the ears of all the people.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po na hrieta chun, LALPA in dai kawtkhâr thar lûtnaa, huong sûng tuollai chung- hnung lema um, lekhaziektu Saphan naupa Gemaria pindanah, LALPA ina chun Baruk chun Jeremia thuhai chu a tiem tah a.

en: And when Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the words of Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, Saphan naupa, Gemaria naupa Mikaia chun lekhabua LALPA thu po pohai chu a hriet chun,

en: he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber: and, lo, all the princes were sitting there, to wit, Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
hmr: lekhaziektuhai pindanah lal ina chun a zu fe thla tah a; chun, ngai ta, chutaka chun lalhai po po, lekhaziek- tu Elisama, Semaia naupa Delaia, Akbor naupa Elnathan, Saphan naupa Gemaria, Hanania naupa Zedekia le lalhai po po chu an ṭhung a.

en: Then Micaiah declared unto them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun mipui na hrieta Barukin lekhabu chu a tiem laia a lo hriet thuhai po po chu anni kuoma chun a hrilfie tah a.

en: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, unto Baruch, saying, Take in thy hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
hmr: Chuleiin, lalhai po po chun Kusi naupa Selemia, chu naupa Nethania naupa Jehudi chu Baruk kâwlah an tir a, “Mipuihai na hrieta lekha zuol i tiemna kha la la, hung chawi la, hung rawh,” tiin. Chuongchun, Neria naupa Baruk chun Lekhabu zuol chu a kutin a lâk a, an kuoma chun a hung tah a.

en: And they said unto him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Tuhin ṭhung la, kan na hrieta hin tiem ta,” an tih a. Chuongchun, Baruk chun an na hrieta chun a tiem tah a.

en: Now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one toward another, and said unto Baruch, We will surely tell the king of all these words.
hmr: Chun, chuong thuhai po po chu an hriet chun, anni le anni chu an inṭi tuo seng tah a, chuongchun, Baruk kuoma chun, “Hieng thuhai po po hi lal chu hril ngei ngei kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And they asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?
hmr: Chun, Baruk kuoma chun, “A baua inthawk chun hieng thuhai po po hi ieng tiziea ziek am i na, mi hril rawh,” tiin an indawn a.

en: Then Baruch answered them, He pronounced all these words unto me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.
hmr: Baruk chun anni chu a dawn a, “A bauin hieng thuhai po po hi ka kuomah a hung hril a, kei chun lekha- bua chun lekhatuiin ka lo ziek el a nih,” tiin.

en: Then said the princes unto Baruch, Go, hide thee, thou and Jeremiah; and let no man know where ye are.
hmr: Chuongchun, lalhai chun Baruk kuoma chun, “Fe la, Jeremia le nang chu inbihmang ro, khaw lai am in um ti tukhawm inhriettir naw ro,” an tih a.

en: And they went in to the king into the court; but they had laid up the roll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe; and they told all the words in the ears of the king.
hmr: Chun, anni chu huong sûng tuollaia chun lal kuomah an va feh a; amiruokchu, lekhabu zuol chu lekha- ziektu Elisama pindana khan an mâksan a; chuongchun, lal na hrieta chun thuhai po po chu an hril tah a.

en: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the roll; and he took it out of the chamber of Elishama the scribe. And Jehudi read it in the ears of the king, and in the ears of all the princes that stood beside the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Jehudi chu lekhabu zuol chu hung la dingin a tir a; ama chun lekhaziektu Elisama pindana inthawk chun a lâk suok a. Jehudi chun lal na hrieta le, a sîra ngîrhai lalhai po po na hrieta chun a tiem tah a.

en: Now the king was sitting in the winter-house in the ninth month: and there was a fire in the brazier burning before him.
hmr: Thla kuona a na, lal chu thlasik ina chun a ṭhung a, a hmaa chun meithuk a um a. Chun, mei inti hi a um a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, that the king cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.
hmr: Chun, Jehudi chun phêk thum amanih, phêk li amanih a tiem phing chun lal chun chemtê hin a ât thlâk a, meithuka meiin lekhabu zuol chu a kâng zo vawng chenin, meithuka meia chun a pei lût pei tah a.

en: And they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the king, nor any of his servants that heard all these words.
hmr: Anni chu an ṭi nawh a, an silfênhai khawm an keithlêr bawk nawh a, hieng thuhai hretu lal le a siehlawhai hrim hrim khawm chun.

en: Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the roll; but he would not hear them.
hmr: Chu naw khawm Elnathan le Delaia le Gemaria chun lal kuoma chun lekhabu zuol chu raw lo dingin hnina an siem a, nisienlakhawm, anni chu a ngai nawh a.

en: And the king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but Jehovah hid them.
hmr: Chun, lal chun lal naupa Jerahmeel le, Azriel naupa Seraia le, Abdeel naupa Selemia chu lekhaziek- tu Baruk le zâwlnei Jeremia chu man dingin thu a pêk a; nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun anni chu a thup a.

en: Then the word of Jehovah came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia baua inthawka Barukin thu a ziekhai le, lekhabu zuol chu lal chun a raw zo vawng chun Jeremia kuomah LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a:

en: Take thee again another roll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah hath burned.
hmr: “Lekhabu zuol dang la nâwk la, Juda ram lal Jehoiakimin a raw tah, lekhabu zuol hmasaa um thu hma- sahai po po kha ziek rawh.

en: And concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah thou shalt say, Thus saith Jehovah: Thou hast burned this roll, saying, Why hast thou written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from thence man and beast?
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Jehoiakim chungthua chun hieng ang hin hril i tih; ‘LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Babulon lal chu hung a ta, hi ram hi hung sukse ngei a ta, chutaka in- thawk chun ramsa le mihriem khawm sukchavai a tih, tia, ieng- dinga hitaka hi ziek am in nih a?’ tiin, hi lekhabu zuol hi i raw ta chu a na.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: He shall have none to sit upon the throne of David; and his dead body shall be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
hmr: Chuleiin, Juda ram lal Jehoia- kim chungthua chun LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: David lalṭhungpha chunga ṭhung ding tukhawm nei naw nih a; chun, a taksa thi chu sûnah lumah, zânah zildeiah peihâwn nîng a tih.

en: And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they hearkened not.
hmr: Chun, ama le a thla le sie- hlawhai chu an suolna leiin hrem ka ta, chun, an chunga le, Jerusalem hluotuhai chunga le, Juda rama mihai chunga chun, an chunga tlung dinga ka hril, thil ṭha nawhai po po kha intlungtir ka tih; nisienla- khawm, an la ngai naw rawp a,” tiin.

en: Then took Jeremiah another roll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and there were added besides unto them many like words.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun lekhabu zuol dang chu a lâk a, Neria naupa Baruk, lekhaziektu kuoma chun a pêk tah a; ama chun Juda ram lal Jehoiakimin a lo raw tah lekhabua thuhai po po chu Jeremia baua inthawk chun a ziek tah a; chu naw khawm chu thu angkhat tamtakhai chu an kuoma belsain a um a.

en: And Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned as king, instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
hmr: Chun, Jehoiakim naupa Konia aia Babulon lal Nebukadnez- zarin Juda ram lala a lo siem Josia naupa Zedekia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of Jehovah, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, amain amanih, a siehlawhaiin amanih, chu rama mipuihai chun amani khawm, zâwl- nei Jeremia hmanga a hril LALPA thuhai chu an ngai nawh a.

en: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto Jehovah our God for us.
hmr: Chun, lal Zedekia chun Selemaia naupa Jehukal le, thiempu Maaseia naupa Zephania chu zâwlnei Jeremia kuomah, “Tuhin keini ta dingin, LALPA kan Pathien kuoma chun ṭawngṭai rawh”, ti dingin a tir tah a.

en: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people; for they had not put him into prison.
hmr: Chuonglai chun Jeremia chu lung ina an sie ta naw leiin, mipuihai lai chun a lûtin a suok hlak a.

en: And Pharaoh’s army was come forth out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans that were besieging Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they brake up from Jerusalem.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawk chun Pharao sipaihai chu an hung a; chun, Jerusalem inhuoltu Kaldaihai chun anni chanchin chu an lo hriet phing chun, Jerusalema inthawk chun an indar tah a.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA thu chu zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma chun a hung tlung a;

en: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah, that sent you unto me to inquire of me: Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.
hmr: “LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ka kuoma thu indawn dinga nang ka kuoma tirtu che, Juda ram lal kuoma chun hieng hin hril rawh: Ngai ta, Pharao sipaihai nang- ma ṭhangpui dinga hunghai chu, an ramah Aiguptaa bawk chun kîr nâwk an tih.

en: And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city; and they shall take it, and burn it with fire.
hmr: Chuongchun, Kaldaihai hung nâwk an ta, hi khawpui hi hung do an ta, lâng an ta, meiin râwng an tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Deceive not yourselves, saying, The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us; for they shall not depart.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Kaldaihai chun mi mâksan ta ngei an tih,’ tiin nang le nang inhlêm naw rawh; an fe hmang âwm si nawh a.

en: For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded men among them, yet would they rise up every man in his tent, and burn this city with fire.
hmr: Nangma hung dotu che Kaldai sipaihai po po khawm chu lo that ta la khawm, anni laia chun mi hliemhai chau chu la umin, chuong khawm chun, mi tin chu mâni puon inhaia chun tho an ta, hi khawpui hi meiin râwng an tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass that, when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
hmr: Chun, Pharao sipaihai ṭi leia Kaldai sipaihai chu Jerusalema in- thawka an indar hnung chun,

en: then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to receive his portion there, in the midst of the people.
hmr: Jeremia chu Benjamin ramah va fea, chu hnam laia a chanvo chu la dingin, Jerusalema inthawk chun a suok tah a.

en: And when he was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he laid hold on Jeremiah the prophet, saying, Thou art falling away to the Chaldeans.
hmr: Ama chu Benjamin dai kawt- khâra a um lai chun, vêngtu sipai hotu chutaka chun a lo um a, a hming chu Hanania naupa Selemia naupa Irija a nih; ama chun, “Kaldaihai kuomah în pe a nih,” tiin zâwlnei Jeremia chu a man tah a.

en: Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I am not falling away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him; so Irijah laid hold on Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.
hmr: Jeremia chun, “Thukhêl a nih; Kaldaihai kuomah kân pêk nawh,” a ta; nisienlakhawm, ama chun a ngai nawh a; chuongchun, Irija chun Jeremia chu a man a, rorêltuhai kuoma chun a hung ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.
hmr: Chun, rorêltuhai chu Jeremia chunga chun an lunginsen a, ama chu an hrem a, lekhaziektu Jonathan ina chun lung inah an khum tah a; chu chu lung inah an siem ta sih a.

en: When Jeremiah was come into the dungeon-house, and into the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days;
hmr: Jeremia chu khur thima le kul- bîngahai chun a hung chun, chutaka chun Jeremia chu ni tamtak a um a;

en: then Zedekiah the king sent, and fetched him: and the king asked him secretly in his house, and said, Is there any word from Jehovah? And Jeremiah said, There is. He said also, Thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.
hmr: chun, lal Zedekia chun mi a tir a, a hung ṭhuoi a, a ina chun lal chun a rûkin ân dawn a, a kuomah, “LAL- PA kuoma inthawkin thu a um?” a tih a. Chun, Jeremia chun “A um”, a tih a. “Babulon lal kutah pêkin i um ding a nih,” a ti bawk a.

en: Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah, Wherein have I sinned against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison?
hmr: Chu nawa khawm lal Zedekia kuomah Jeremia chun, “Nanga chunga amanih, i siehlawhai chunga amanih, hi hnam chunga hin amanih khaw lai am ka suksuola lung ina i mi khum a na?

en: Where now are your prophets that prophesied unto you, saying, The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land?
hmr: I zâwlneihai, ‘Babulon lal chun hi ram amanih, nang amani khawm hung do naw ni,’ tituhai kha khaw lai am an um a?

en: And now hear, I pray thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be presented before thee, that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.
hmr: Chun, tuhin lo hre ta, aw ka pu lal, ka hni che, ka hnina hi, ka ngên che, i hmaa hin pawm ni raw se: lekhaziektu Jonathan ina khan mîn kîr tir nâwk ta naw rawh, chuong naw chun thi rawi ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then Zedekiah the king commanded, and they committed Jeremiah into the court of the guard; and they gave him daily a loaf of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.
hmr: Chun, lal Zedekia chun thu a pêk a; Jeremia chu vêngtuhai kula chun an sieh a, khawpui sûnga bei po po chu hmang vawng a ni chenin bei siemtuhai kawtthlêra inthawkin ni tin bei an pêk a. Chuongchun, Jere- mia chu vêngtuhai kula chun a um zing tah a.

en: And Shephatiah the son of Mattan, and Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, and Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchijah, heard the words that Jeremiah spake unto all the people, saying,
hmr: Chun, Mattan naupa Sephatia le, Pas-hur naupa Gedalia le, Selemia naupa Jukal le, Malkija naupa Pas-hur chun mipuihai po po kuoma Jeremiain hienga a hril hi an lo hriet a,

en: Thus saith Jehovah, He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; but he that goeth forth to the Chaldeans shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey, and he shall live.
hmr: “Lalpa chun hieng hin a tih: Khawpui sûnga umhai chu kâwl- hnâm le ṭâm le, hripuiin thîng an ta; Kaldaihai kuoma va fe chu hring an tih; a hringna chu insanhim a ta, hring a tih,

en: Thus saith Jehovah, This city shall surely be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Hi khawpui hi Babulon lal sipaihai kuta pêk ngei ding a na, ama chun lâng a tih,” tiin.

en: Then the princes said unto the king, Let this man, we pray thee, be put to death; forasmuch as he weakeneth the hands of the men of war that remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, in speaking such words unto them: for this man seeketh not the welfare of this people, but the hurt.
hmr: Chun, rorêltuhai chun lal kuoma chun, “Kan hni che hi, hi mipa hi sukhlum ni ngei raw se; chuong thuhai chu an kuoma hrilin, mipui po pohai kuthai, hi khawpuia indomi umhai kuthai chu a sukzuoi a nih; hi mipa hin hi hnam ṭhatna ding hi a zawng nawh a, sietna ding a zawng lem a nih”, an ta.

en: And Zedekiah the king said, Behold, he is in your hand; for the king is not he that can do anything against you.
hmr: Chun, lal Zedekia chun, “Ngai ta u, in kuta um a nih annâwm,; lal chu nangni kal zâwnga thil thaw thei mi ding a ni si nawh a,” a ta.

en: Then took they Jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of Malchijah the king’s son, that was in the court of the guard: and they let down Jeremiah with cords. And in the dungeon there was no water, but mire; and Jeremiah sank in the mire.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeremia chu an man a, lal naupa Malkija khurthim, vêngtuhai kul sûnga uma chun an sie lût tah a; chuongchun, Jeremia chu khuopnahai le chun an infe thlâktir tah a. Chun, chu khurthim sûnga chun chirhak ti chau naw chu tui khawm a um nawh a, chuongchun, Jeremia chu chirhaka chun ân chie tah a.

en: Now when Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king’s house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon (the king then sitting in the gate of Benjamin),
hmr: Chun, Ethiopia mi, Ebed-melek, mi tillâk, lal ina um chun Jeremia chu khurthim sûnga chun an sie ti a hriet chun chu lai chun lal chu Benjamin dai kawtkhâra khan a ṭhung a.

en: Ebed-melech went forth out of the king’s house, and spake to the king, saying,
hmr: Ebed-melek chu lal ina inthawk chun a suok a, lal kuoma chun thu a hang hril tah a:

en: My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon; and he is like to die in the place where he is, because of the famine; for there is no more bread in the city.
hmr: “Ka lalpa, lal, hieng mihai hin zâwlnei Jeremia chunga an thil- thawhai po poa hin thil ṭha naw an thaw a nih, ama chu khurthima chun an peilût a; chutaka chun ama chu phîngṭâma thi el âwm a nih; khawpui sûnga hin bei dang hrim a um ta naw leiin,” a ta.

en: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Take from hence thirty men with thee, and take up Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon, before he die.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Ethiopia mi Ebed-melek chu thu a pêk a, “Hitaka inthawkin mi pathum ṭhuoi la, zâwl- nei Jeremia chu a thi hmain khur- thima inthawk chu va la suok ro,” a ta.

en: So Ebed-melech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took thence rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ebed-melek chun mihai chu a ṭhuoi a, lal ina ro ina chun a va feh a, chutaka inthawk chun sahmul puon ṭawphai le, savun puon hluihai chu a lâk a, hruiin Jeremia kuomah khurthim a chun ân khaithlâktir tah a.

en: And Ebed-melech the Ethiopian said unto Jeremiah, Put now these rags and worn-out garments under thine armholes under the cords. And Jeremiah did so.
hmr: Chun, Ethiopia mi Ebed-melek chun Jeremia kuoma chun, “Tuhin hieng sahmul puon ṭawphai le, savun puon hluihai hi i zakhnuoiah hrui- hruolahai hnuoia khan sil rawh,” a ta. Jeremia chun chuong ang tak chun a thawh a.

en: So they drew up Jeremiah with the cords, and took him up out of the dungeon: and Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeremia chu hrui- hruol chun an khai a, khurthima inthawk chun an lâk suok tah a; chun, Jeremia chu vêngtuhai kul- bînga chun a um zing a.

en: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took Jeremiah the prophet unto him into the third entry that is in the house of Jehovah: and the king said unto Jeremiah, I will ask thee a thing; hide nothing from me.
hmr: Chun, lal Zedekia chun mi a tir a, LALPA ina um lûtna pathumnaa khan a kuomah zâwlnei Jeremia chu a ṭhuoi tah a; chun, lal chun Jeremia kuoma chun, “Thil pakhat indawn ka ti cheh a, ka kuomah iengkhawm ip naw rawh,” a ta.

en: Then Jeremiah said unto Zedekiah, If I declare it unto thee, wilt thou not surely put me to death? and if I give thee counsel, thou wilt not hearken unto me.
hmr: Jeremia chun Zedekia kuoma chun, “Ka hrilfie chun i mi that ngei naw ding am a nih? thurâwn pe lang che khawm nang chun mi ngai bawk naw ti ni,” a ta.

en: So Zedekiah the king sware secretly unto Jeremiah, saying, As Jehovah liveth, that made us this soul, I will not put thee to death, neither will I give thee into the hand of these men that seek thy life.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Zedekia chun inrûkin Jeremia kuoma chun ân tiemkam tah a, “LALPA ei hring- nahai siemtu chu a hring zing angin, sukhlum naw ning cheh a, hieng i hringna zawngtuhai kuoma hin pe bawk naw ning che,” a ta.

en: Then said Jeremiah unto Zedekiah, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: If thou wilt go forth unto the king of Babylon’s princes, then thy soul shall live, and this city shall not be burned with fire; and thou shalt live, and thy house.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Zedekia kuoma chun, “Sipaihai Pathien, Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih; Babulon lal rorêltuhai kuomah în pêk chun, i hringna chu hlain um a ta, hi khawpui khawm hi meiin kâng naw ni; nang chu hring i ta, i sûnghai leh;

en: But if thou wilt not go forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, then shall this city be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they shall burn it with fire, and thou shalt not escape out of their hand.
hmr: amiruokchu, Babulon lal rorêl- tuhai kuomah în pêk naw chun hi khawpui hi Kaldaihai kuta chun pêk nîng a ta, meiin râwng an ta, an kuta inthawk chun nang khawm suok- thleng naw ti ni,” a ta.

en: And Zedekiah the king said unto Jeremiah, I am afraid of the Jews that are fallen away to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.
hmr: Chun, lal Zedekia chun, Jeremia kuoma chun “Juda mihai Kaldaihai tienga va kawp tahai kha ka ṭi a nih; an kuta khan mi pe hlau an ta, mi nuisan rawi an tih,” a ta.

en: But Jeremiah said, They shall not deliver thee. Obey, I beseech thee, the voice of Jehovah, in that which I speak unto thee: so it shall be well with thee, and thy soul shall live.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jeremia chun, “Nang chu pe suok naw ni hai che. LALPA râwl i kuoma thu ka hrilna hi awi el rawh, ka ngên che hi, chuong- chun, i ta dingin ṭhâng a ta, i hringna khawm hlain um a tih.

en: But if thou refuse to go forth, this is the word that Jehovah hath showed me:
hmr: Amiruokchu, vân pêk chu i nuom naw chun, hi hi a nih LALPAIN thu a mîn entir chu.

en: Behold, all the women that are left in the king of Judah’s house shall be brought forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women shall say, Thy familiar friends have set thee on, and have prevailed over thee: now that thy feet are sunk in the mire, they are turned away back.
hmr: Ngai ta, Juda ram lal ina nu- hmei mâksana umhai po po kha Babulon lal rorêltuhai kuoma hung ṭhuoi suok nîng an ta; chuong nuhmeihai chun, ‘I ruol hmêlhriet- takhai chun an hlêm cheh a, an hne ta che a ni hi; tuhin i kehai chu chirhaka chun a tluma, an hnungkîr nâwk a ni ta hi,’ tîng an ta.

en: And they shall bring out all thy wives and thy children to the Chaldeans; and thou shalt not escape out of their hand, but shalt be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon: and thou shalt cause this city to be burned with fire.
hmr: Chun, i nauhai le i nuhmeihai po po chu Kaldaihai kuoma chun hung la suok an ta, nang khawm an kuta inthawk chun suokthleng naw ti ni: amiruokchu, Babulona lal kuta man nîng i ta; hi khawpui hi meia raw dingin siem i tih,” a ta.

en: Then said Zedekiah unto Jeremiah, Let no man know of these words, and thou shalt not die.
hmr: Chun, Zedekia chun Jeremia kuomah, “Hieng thuhai hi tukhawm inhriettir naw la, thi naw ti ni.

en: But if the princes hear that I have talked with thee, and they come unto thee, and say unto thee, Declare unto us now what thou hast said unto the king; hide it not from us, and we will not put thee to death; also what the king said unto thee:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, rorêltuhai chun kân biekpui che ti an hrieta, i kuomah an hunga, i kuomah, ‘Lal kuoma i thu hril kha mi hrilfie rawh, kan kuomah ip naw la, sukhlum naw ning ung che; chun, ieng am lal chun i kuomah a hril a an ti chun,’

en: then thou shalt say unto them, I presented my supplication before the king, that he would not cause me to return to Jonathan’s house, to die there.
hmr: an kuoma chun, ‘Jonathan ina thi el dinga min kîrtir nâwk lo dingin, lal chu ka hnina ka pêk a nih’, tîng i ta,” tiin.

en: Then came all the princes unto Jeremiah, and asked him; and he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they left off speaking with him; for the matter was not perceived.
hmr: Chuongchun, rorêltuhai po po chu Jeremia kuoma chun an hung a, an indwn ta ngei a, ama chun lalin thu a pêk ang tak pei chun a hril tah a. Chuongchun, ama le inbiek chu an mah a, a thu tak chu hril a ni si nawh a.

en: So Jeremiah abode in the court of the guard until the day that Jerusalem was taken. And it came to pass when Jerusalem was taken
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeremia chu vêng- tuhai kulbînga chun Jerusalem chu lâka a um ni chen chun a um tah a.

en: (in the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and besieged it;
hmr: Juda ram lal Zedekia inlal kum kuona, thla sâwmnaa chun Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chu a sipaihai po po leh Jerusalemah a hung a, a hung rûn tah a;

en: in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city),
hmr: chun, Zedekia inlal kum sâwm- pakhatna, thla lina, chu thla ni kuo ni chun chu khawpuia chun suksietna chu a um tah a.

en: that all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, to wit, Nergal-sharezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim, Rab-saris, Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, with all the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.
hmr: Jerusalem lâk a ni ni chun, Babulon lal rorêltuhai po po chu an hung lût a, dai kawtkhâr lailung, Nergal-sarezera dâm, Samgar-neboa dâm, Sarsekima dâm, Rabsarisa dâm, Rabmaga dâm, Babulon lal rorêltu dang po pohai le chun an ṭhung tâwl a.

en: And it came to pass that, when Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, then they fled, and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the king’s garden, through the gate betwixt the two walls; and he went out toward the Arabah.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Zedekia le indo mihai po po chun chu chu an hmu chun an tlânseh a, kul pahni inkâra dai kawtkhârah, lal huon lampuia chun a zân a zân chun an tlânsuok tah a; chuongchun, ama chu Araba lampuia khan a feh a.

en: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment upon him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Kaldai sipaihai chun anni chu an hnawt a, Zedekia chu Jeriko phairuoma chun an hnawt phâk a, chun, ama chu an man chun, Hamath rama Riblaa Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a, ama chun a chungah ro a rêlthlûk a.

en: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes: also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.
hmr: Riblaa chun a mithmu ngeiah Nebukadnezzar chun Zedekia naupa- salhai chu a that a; chun, Babulon lal chun Juda mi ṭhahai po po khawm chu a that bawk a.

en: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun, Zedekia mithai chu a kheldawk a, thîrkawl ân buntir a, Babulona ṭhuoi ding- in.

en: And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house, and the houses of the people, with fire, and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Kaldaihai chun lal in le mihai inhai chu meiin an rawh a, Jerusalem kulbanghai chu an sukchim tah a.

en: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the residue of the people that remained in the city, the deserters also that fell away to him, and the residue of the people that remained.
hmr: Chun, Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotu chun khawpuia mi la um sunhai le, tlân hmangtuhai le, ama kuoma hung lûthai le, mipui a la mahla la um sunhai po chu Babulon tieng chun salah a ṭhuoi tah a.

en: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, that had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotu chun mi rimsihai iengkhawm nei lohai chu Juda rama chun a mâksan a, grêp huonhai le lohai anni chu a pêk nghâl tâwl bawk a.

en: Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying,
hmr: Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chun Jeremia chu Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotu, kuoma chun enkawl dingin a pêk a,

en: Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
hmr: “Ṭhuoi la, ama hi ṭhatakin enkawl la, sukpawi naw rawh; ami- ruokchu, i kuoma a hril ang ang chun thawpêk lem rawh,” a ta.

en: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushazban, Rab-saris, and Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon;
hmr: Chuongchun, Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotu le Nebusazban, Rabsaris, Nergal-sarezer, Rabmag le Babulon lal rorêltuhai po po chun,

en: they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should carry him home. So he dwelt among the people.
hmr: mi an tir a, Jeremia chu vêng- tuhai kulbînga inthawk chun an ṭhuoi suok a, Saphan naupa Ahikam, chu naupa Gedalia kuoma chun an pêk a, in tienga ṭhuoi dingin; chuong- chun, mipuihai laia chun a um ve tah a.

en: Now the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the guard, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Jeremia kuomah a hung tlung a, vêngtuhai kulbînga khum a ni lai khan,

en: Go, and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished before thee in that day.
hmr: “Fe la, Ethiopia mi Ebed-melek kuoma khan hieng hin va hril rawh, Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, thil ṭha tiengah ni lovin, thil ṭha naw tiengah hi khawpui chunga hin ka thuhai chu ka hung intlungtir ding a nih; chun, chu nia chun nanga hmaa chun suk- kim nîng an tih.

en: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith Jehovah; and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nang chu, chu ni chun sansuok ka ti cheh a, mi iṭihai kuta chun pêk ni naw ti ni, LALPA chun a tih.

en: For I will surely save thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee; because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Sandam ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, kâwlhnâmah i tlu naw ding a ni sih a; amiruokchu, i hringna chu nangma ta dinga sanhim nîng a tih; i ringna chu keimaa hin i sie leiin, LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith Jehovah, if thou wilt return unto me, and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight; then shalt thou not be removed;
hmr: “Aw Israel, i hung kîr chun, LALPA Pathien chun a tih: ka kuomah i hung kîr ding a nih; i tirdakumnahai chu ka mithmua inthawka i sie hmang chun nang chu sukchângin um naw ti nih;

en: and thou shalt swear, As Jehovah liveth, in truth, in justice, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
hmr: chuongchun, nang chun, ‘LALPA chu a hring zing angin, thudikah, rorêlnaah, felnaah, hnamhai chu amaa chun engthâwl an ta, amaa chun chawimawiin um an tih,’ tiin ṭawng inkhâm i ta.”

en: For thus saith Jehovah to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.
hmr: Jerusalema le Juda rama mihai kuoma chun, LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: In hnuoi inlet lo chu suknawi unla, hling lai chun chi thlâk naw ro.

en: Circumcise yourselves to Jehovah, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
hmr: LALPA kuoma chun ser intan unla, in lungril ser chu tan ro, nangni Jerusalema mihai le, Juda rama mi- hai; chuong naw chun ka lunginsenna chu mei angin fe suok a ta, i thilthaw- hai rîtlona lei chun; tukhawm iṭhel ruol loin kâng a tih.

en: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry aloud and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.
hmr: Juda rama chun hrilfie unla, Jerusalema chun phuong ro, “Rama chun tawtawrâwt chu mût unla, khêk inring unla, hieng hin ti ro: Hung inkhâwm tâwl unla, khawpui kul- neiahai chun fêng ei tiu,” tiin.

en: Set up a standard toward Zion: flee for safety, stay not; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.
hmr: Zion tienga chun puonzâr chu khai unla, himna dingin tlânhmang unla, muong naw ro; hmar tienga inthawkin thil ṭha naw sietna nasa- tak chu ka hung intlungtir ding a ni sih a.

en: A lion is gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations; he is on his way, he is gone forth from his place, to make thy land desolate, that thy cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.
hmr: Sakeibaknei chu a chîmbuka in- thawk chun a hung suok tah a, hnam- hai sukbohmangtu ding chu; a lam- puia chun a thang mêk a, a hmuna inthawk chun a suok tah a, i ram chu râusana siem ding le, i khawpuihai khawm hluotuhai um loa sukse dingin.

en: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Jehovah is not turned back from us.
hmr: Hi hi lei hin saiip puon dierkei unla, sûn unla, ṭap inrûm ro; LALPA lunginsenna ṭium chu einia inthawk- in a hnungkîr si nawh a.

en: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith Jehovah, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
hmr: Chuong nia chun LALPA chun a tih: Lal lungril chu bohmang a ta, rorêltuhai le thiempuhai lungril chun maktîng a tih; zâwlneihai khawma maktîng an tih.

en: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the life.
hmr: Chun, kei chun, “E, Lalpa PATHIEN! Hi hnam le Jerusalem hi i lo hlêm let dêr a ni hi, ‘Muongna nei in tih,’ tiin i lo hril a, kâwlhnâm hlak chun hringna ngei a sun ta lem si hi,” ka tih a.

en: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A hot wind from the bare heights in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow, nor to cleanse;
hmr: Chu huna chun chu hnam le Jerusalem kuoma chun, “Thlalêra bâwlhmunhaia inthawkin ka mihai naunuhai tienga chun thli lum tak, mûtdeina ding ni si lo, sukfai ding khawm ni lo;

en: a full wind from these shall come for me: now will I also utter judgments against them.
hmr: thli hrâttak hienga inthawk hin ka kuomah hung a tih; tuta an chungthu rêla hriltu khawm hi kei ka nih,” ti nîng a tih.

en: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as the whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are ruined.
hmr: Ngai ta, ama chu sûmhai angin a tungin hung a ta, a sakawr tawlai- lîrhai chu thlivir ang nîng an tih, a sakawrhai khawm chu mupuihai nêkin an hrât lem a nih. Ei chung a va rik de! suksietin ei um sih a.

en: O Jerusalem, wash thy heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thine evil thoughts lodge within thee?
hmr: Aw Jerusalem, sandama i um theina dingin i khawhlonaa inthawk chun i lungril chu sâwpfai rawh. I ngaituona rilohai hi ieng chen am i lungrila chun a châm ding a na?

en: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth evil from the hills of Ephraim.
hmr: Dana inthawk chun râwl chun a hung hrilfieh a, Ephraim muolhaia inthawk chun thil suol a hung phuongdar a;

en: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
hmr: hnamhai kuoma chun hrilna nei rawh; ngai ta, Jerusalem chunga chun phuong la, vêngtuhai chu ram hlataka inthawkin an hung a, Juda khawpuihai chu demin an râwlhai an insuo a nih.

en: As keepers of a field are they against her round about, because she hath been rebellious against me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Lo vêngtuhai ang elin, a vêlin an umnghah a; keia chungah a lo hel ta leiin, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness; for it is bitter, for it reacheth unto thy heart.
hmr: I thilthawhai le i lampui chun hieng thilhai hi ân neitir che a ni hi; hi hi i khawhlona chu a nih: khâk khawm a kha sih a; i lung chen a tlung ta sih a.

en: My anguish, my anguish! I am pained at my very heart; my heart is disquieted in me; I cannot hold my peace; because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
hmr: Ka phîng, ka phîng! ka lungah a na; ka lung chu a to ṭawk ṭawk naw tawp a; ka to ṭawk ṭawk thei nawh; indona inṭhi lâwkna tawtawrâwt ri chu, aw ka thla, i lo hriet ta leiin.

en: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is laid waste: suddenly are my tents destroyed, and my curtains in a moment.
hmr: Bohmangna chungah bohmang- na a tlung a; ram pumpui chu suksiet a ni ta sih a, chawmkhat kârin ka puon inhai chu suksiet an na, mit- khap kâr loin ka puonzârhai khawm chu.

en: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?
hmr: Ieng chen am puonzâr chu ka hmuin, tawtawrâwt ri chu ka hriet zing ding a na?

en: For my people are foolish, they know me not; they are sottish children, and they have no understanding; they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
hmr: “Ka mihai an invêt a, an mi hriet si nawh a; naupang invêttak ang, hrietthiemna hrim khawm an nei naw, thil ṭha naw thaw dingin an var a, thil ṭha thaw ding ruok chun hrietna an nei nawh.”

en: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was waste and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.
hmr: Leihnuoi chu ka en leh, ngai ta, a ruok le a sie a na; vânhai khawm chun varna an nei nawh a.

en: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved to and fro.
hmr: Tlânghai chu ka en leh, ngai ta, an inthin a, muolhai po po khawm chu hnungtieng hmatieng an in- sâwi a.

en: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.
hmr: Ka hei en a, chun, ngai ta, mihriem hrim hrim an um nawh a, chunglêng vatehai khawm chu an tlân hmang tah a.

en: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of Jehovah, and before his fierce anger.
hmr: Ka hei en a, ngai ta, ram rahlâwktakhai khawm chu thlalêr a lo ni tah a, chutaka khawpuihai po po chu LALPA hmaihmaa le, a lungin- senna ṭiumtak hmaa chun a lo chim tâwl tah a.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a, “Ram pumpui chu râusan nîng a ta, a tâwp ruok chu intlungtir naw ning.

en: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black; because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and I have not repented, neither will I turn back from it.
hmr: Hi hi lei hin leihnuoi chun sûn a ta, chun, chunga vânhai inthim a tih; ka hril ta leiin, ka tum tlat tah a; kân sîr bawk nawh a; chutaka inthawk lamlêt bawk naw ning.”

en: Every city fleeth for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they go into the thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city is forsaken, and not a man dwelleth therein.
hmr: Khawpui sûng po po chu sakawr chung chuong mihai le, thal kâp mihai ria chun an tlânseh a; chîm- bukahai chun an feh a, râwlkhoahai chun an lâwn a; khawpui tinhai chu mâksanin a um a, mi hrim an chêng ta nawh a.

en: And thou, when thou art made desolate, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with scarlet, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou enlargest thine eyes with paint, in vain dost thou make thyself fair; thy lovers despise thee, they seek thy life.
hmr: Chun, nang suksieta um, ieng am thâwng i ta? Sen inlârin inthuom la khawm, rângkachak thuomhnaw- haiin inchei la khawm, i mithai khawm chu rawnga nâlin suklien la khawm; nang le nang în sukhmêlṭha thlâwn el nîng a tih; i hmangaihai chun an hnâwl cheh a, i hringna lâk an tum a nih.

en: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that gaspeth for breath, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul fainteth before the murderers.
hmr: Nuhmei pakhat nauhase nat tuor, a nau lutîr hung suok dinga a na tuor râwl ang chu ka hriet sih a, Zion naunu, thuok insama, a kuthai phara, “Tuhin ka chung a rik de! tuolthattuhai hmaa chun ka thla chu a thidang sih a,” titu râwl chu a nih.

en: The word which came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, that were carried away captive unto Babylon.
hmr: Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotuin ama chu Ramaa in- thawka ân fetir a, Juda rama mi le Jerusalema sal intânghai Babulon tienga sala ṭhuoihai laia khaidieta khuopa ama a ṭhuoi hnunga LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chu.

en: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said unto him, Jehovah thy God pronounced this evil upon this place;
hmr: Vêngtu pâwl hotu chun Jeremia chu a ṭhuoi a, a kuomah, “LALPA i Pathien chun hi hmuna hin hieng thil ṭha naw hi tlung dingin a ruot tah a;

en: and Jehovah hath brought it, and done according as he spake: because ye have sinned against Jehovah, and have not obeyed his voice, therefore this thing is come upon you.
hmr: chuongchun, LALPA chun a hung intlungtir a, a hril ang ngei chun a hung thaw tah a; LALPA chunga chun thil in suksuol ta leiin le, a râwl chu in awi naw leiin, hieng thil hi in chungah a hung tlung a ni hi.

en: And now, behold, I loose thee this day from the chains which are upon thy hand. If it seem good unto thee to come with me into Babylon, come, and I will look well unto thee; but if it seem ill unto thee to come with me into Babylon, forbear: behold, all the land is before thee; whither it seemeth good and right unto thee to go, thither go.
hmr: Tuhin, ngai ta, vawisûn ni hin i kuta khaidiet umhaia inthawk chun kân suo che a nih. Babulon tienga kei mi zui hi i ngaia a ṭha chun, hung la, amiruokchu, Babulon tienga kei mi hung zui chu i ta dinga rin a um chun, ṭhul el rawh; ngai ta, ram po po chu i hmaa chun a um a, khaw tienga khawm i ta dinga ṭha le, i ta dinga remchângna tieng tienga chun, chu tienga chun fe rawh,” a ta.

en: Now while he was not yet gone back, Go back then, said he, to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon hath made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people; or go wheresoever it seemeth right unto thee to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victuals and a present, and let him go.
hmr: Chun, chuonga a la fe hma chun, ama chun, “Fe el rawh; Babulon lal Juda ram khawpuihai chunga rorêl- tua a siem Saphan naupa, Ahikam naupa Gedalia kuoma chun kîr nâwk la, mipuihai lai chun ama kuoma chun va um el rawh; annawleh, fena dinga remchâng i tina tieng tieng chun fe el rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, vêngtu hotu chun fâk ding le thilpêk a pêk a, ân fetir tah a.

en: Then went Jeremiah unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah, and dwelt with him among the people that were left in the land.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chu Mizpaa Ahikam naupa Gedalia kuoma chun a fe tah a, mipui chu rama mâksana la umhai laia chun ama kuomah a va chêng tah a.

en: Now when all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed unto him men, and women, and children, and of the poorest of the land, of them that were not carried away captive to Babylon;
hmr: Chun, rama sipai hotuhai po po le an mihaiin Babulon lalin Gedalia Ahikam naupa chu chu rama rorêl- tuah a siem a, a kuoma chun pasal- hai, nuhmeihai, naupanghai, mi rimsitak takhai, Babulona sala ṭhuoia um nawhai chu ân kawltir ti an hriet chun,

en: then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, to wit, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.
hmr: Mizpaa Gedalia kuoma chun, Nethania naupa Ismael, Karea nau- pasal Johanan le Jonathan, Tanhu- meth naupa Seraia, Netophath mi Ephai naupasalhai, Maakath mi naupa Jezania le anni le an mihai chu an hung tâwl a.

en: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan sware unto them and to their men, saying, Fear not to serve the Chaldeans: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.
hmr: Chun, Saphan naupa, Ahikam naupa Gedalia chun inkhâmin, anni le an mihai kuoma chun a hril a, “Kaldaihai hi an rawng bâwlpêk chu ṭi naw ro; rama chun chêng unla, Babulon lal rawng chu bâwl unla, in ta dingin ṭhâng a tih.

en: As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans that shall come unto us: but ye, gather ye wine and summer fruits and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that ye have taken.
hmr: Keia chungthua chun, ngai ta u, eini kuoma hunghai, Kaldaihai hmaa ngîr dingin Mizpaa hin ka chêng ding a na; amiruokchu, nangni chun uoin le nipui theirahai chu la khâwm unla, hriek leh, in bâwmahai chun sie unla, khawpui in lâk tahaia chun chêng el ro,” tiin.

en: Likewise when all the Jews that were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and that were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan;
hmr: Chuong ang bawk chun Moab rama Juda chênghai po po le, Ammon thlahai laia chêng le, Edoma mihai le, ram po poa chênghai chun, Babulon lal chun hlâbîk Juda rama chun mâksan a la nei a, Saphan naupa, Ahikam naupa Gedalia chu an chunga chun a sie ti an hriet chun,

en: then all the Jews returned out of all places whither they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, unto Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.
hmr: Judahai po po chu hnawthmang an nina hmun senga inthawk chun an hung kîr a, Juda ramah, Mizpaa Gedalia kuoma chun an hung a, uoin le nipui thei rahai chu tamtak el chu an lâk khâwm tah a.

en: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm Karea naupa Johanan le sipaihai hotuhai ram- hnuoia umhai po po chu Mizpaa chun Gedalia kuoma chun an hung a,

en: and said unto him, Dost thou know that Baalis the king of the children of Ammon hath sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take thy life? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam believed them not.
hmr: a kuomah, “Ammon thlahai lal Baalis chun Nethania naupa Ismael chu i hringna la dingin a hung tir ti i hriet am?” an tih a. Nisienlakhawm, Gedalia, Ahikam naupa chun anni chu a taksâwn nawh a.

en: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spake to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, Let me go, I pray thee, and I will slay Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man shall know it: wherefore should he take thy life, that all the Jews that are gathered unto thee should be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?
hmr: Chun, Karea naupa Johanan chun Mizpaa Gedalia kuoma chun inrûkin thu a hril a, “Mi tir la, ka ngên che hi, Nethania naupa Ismael chu that el ka tih; tukhawma hre hliek naw ni hai; ieng dingin am i hringna chu lain, Juda i kuoma hung inkhâwm sunhai chu sukdara umin, Juda rama la um sunhai chu bohmang el an ta?” a ta.

en: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said unto Johanan the son of Kareah, Thou shalt not do this thing; for thou speakest falsely of Ishmael.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Ahikam naupa Gedalia chun Karea naupa Johanan kuoma chun, “Hi thil hi i thaw ding a ni nawh, Ismael chungthuah khêl dêr i hril a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: Now it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal and one of the chief officers of the king, and ten men with him, came unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they did eat bread together in Mizpah.
hmr: Chun, thla sarinaa chun lal chi Elisama naupa Nethania, chu naupa Ismael le, lal hotu lientak pakhat le, ama kuoma mi sâwmhai le chun, Mizpaa chun Ahikam naupa Gedalia kuoma chun an hung tah a; chutaka Mizpaa chun bei dâm an fâk hmunkhat tâwl a.

en: Then arose Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and the ten men that were with him, and smote Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword, and slew him, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
hmr: Chun, Nethania naupa Ismael le a kuoma mi sâwm umhai chu an tho a, Saphan naupa, Ahikam naupa Gedalia, Babulon lalin chu rama rorêltu dinga a sie chu kâwlhnâm leh an thawh a, ama chu an that tah a.

en: Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with him, to wit, with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans that were found there, the men of war.
hmr: Ismael chun Gedalia kuoma Juda umhai po po Mizpaa umhai le, Kaldai mi, chutaka um, indo mihai khawm chu a that vawng a.

en: And it came to pass the second day after he had slain Gedaliah, and no man knew it,
hmr: Chun, Gedalia chu a thata mi tukhawma an hriet naw ni hnina hnunga chun hieng hi a hung na;

en: that there came men from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even fourscore men, having their beards shaven and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with meal-offerings and frankincense in their hand, to bring them to the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Mi ṭhenkhat Sekema inthawk dâm, Siloa inthawk dâm, Samaria inthawk dâmin mi sâwmriet zet, an khâkhmul vawa, an puonhai kei- thlêra, anni le anni chu inât a, an kuta bu thilinhlânhai le rimin- hnikhai chawiin, LALPA ina hung inhlân dingin an hung tah a.

en: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met them, he said unto them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.
hmr: Chun, Nethania naupa Ismael chu Mizpaa inthawk chun, a fe malama ṭap pei pumin anni chu tuok dingin a fe suok tah a; chun, anni chu ân tuokpui chun an kuoma chun, “Ahikam naupa Gedalia kuomah hung ro,” a tih a.

en: And it was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah slew them, and cast them into the midst of the pit, he, and the men that were with him.
hmr: Chun, chuong ang tak chun a hung na, khawpui sûnga an hung phing chun Nethania naupa Ismael chun anni chu a that tah a, ama le a kuoma mi umhai chun anni chu khur sûnga chun an pei thlâk tah a.

en: But ten men were found among them that said unto Ishmael, Slay us not; for we have stores hidden in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey. So he forbare, and slew them not among their brethren.
hmr: Chun, anni laia chun mi sâwm Ismael kuoma, “Keini chu mi that naw rawh; rama chun bu dâm, buṭei dâm, hriek dâm, khuoizu dâm thup- hmangna khur chu kan nei sih a,” tituhai chu an um a. Chuongchun, anni chu a hla tah a, an unauhai laia chun a that ve ta nawh a.

en: Now the pit wherein Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had slain, by the side of Gedaliah (the same was that which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel), Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with them that were slain.
hmr: Chun, chu khur, Ismaelin Geda- lia sîra mi a thathai ruong po po a pei thlâkna chu (chu chu Israel lal Baasa a ṭi leia lal Asain a lo siem kha a nih) Nethania naupa Ismael chun chu chu mi thathai chun a suksip tah a.

en: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the residue of the people that were in Mizpah, even the king’s daughters, and all the people that remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam; Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the children of Ammon.
hmr: Chun, Ismael chun Mizpaa mi la chuonghai po po, lal naunuhmeihai le, Ahikam naupa Gedalia kuoma Nebuzaradanin ân kawltir Mizpaa la umhai po po chu salah a ṭhuoi hmang tah a; Nethania naupa Ismael chun anni chu salah a ṭhuoi a, Ammon thlahai chu fethlengpui dingin a fe suok tah a.

en: But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Karea naupa Johanan le, ama kuoma um sipai hotuhai po po chun Nethania naupa Ismaelin thil ṭha naw a thawhai po po chu an lo hriet chun,

en: then they took all the men, and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.
hmr: mi po po chu an ṭhuoi a, Nethania naupa Ismael chu do dingin an fe suok tah a; ama chu Gibeona tuipuihai kâwla chun an va hmuh a.

en: Now it came to pass that, when all the people that were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, then they were glad.
hmr: Chun, Ismael kuoma mipui um po pohai chun Karea naupa Johanan le sipai hotuhai po po le a kuoma umhai po po chu an hmu chun an lâwm ta êm êm el a.

en: So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned about and came back, and went unto Johanan the son of Kareah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mizpaa inthawka Ismael sal intâng dinga a ṭhuoihai po po chu an inlêt a, an hung kîr a, Karea naupa Johanan kuoma chun an fe tâwl tah a.

en: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the children of Ammon.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Nethania naupa Ismael chu mi pariet leh Johanana inthawk chun a suokthleng a, Am- mon thlahai kuoma chun a fe tah a.

en: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, to wit, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
hmr: Chun, Karea naupa Johanan le, a kuoma sipai hotu umhai po po chun, Nethania naupa Ismaela inthawka mipui la um sun an lâk dawkhai po po chu, Ahikam naupa Gedalia le, indo mihai, nuhmeihai, naupanghai le, mitillâkhai, Gibeona inthawka a hung ṭhuoi nâwkhai a that hnunga, a lâk suokhai chu Mizpaa inthawk chun an ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And they departed, and dwelt in Geruth Chimham, which is by Beth-lehem, to go to enter into Egypt,
hmr: Chuongchun, an feh a, Kaldai- hai leia Aiguptaa lût dinga fe dingin Bethlehem kâwla Geruth-kimhama chun an chêng tah a;

en: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.
hmr: Ahikam naupa Gedalia Babulon lalin chu ram chunga rorêltu dinga a sie kha Nethania naupa Ismael khan a that leiin anni chu an ṭi êm êm a.

en: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near,
hmr: Chun, sipai hotuhai po po, Karea naupa Johanan hai, Hosaia naupa Jezania hai, mipui po po a chîn taka inthawka a lien tak chenin an hung hnai a,

en: and said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we pray thee, our supplication be presented before thee, and pray for us unto Jehovah thy God, even for all this remnant (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us),
hmr: zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma chun hieng hin an hril a, “Kan ngên che hi, kan hninahai hi i hmaa chun pawm ni raw se; hieng tuta la mahlahai po po ta ding hin, LALPA i Pathien kuoma chun kan ta dingin ṭawngṭai rawh; i mitin a hmu chie ang hin, tamtak kha tlâwmte chau hi hlain kan um a nih;

en: that Jehovah thy God may show us the way wherein we should walk, and the thing that we should do.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien chun thil kan thaw ding le, lampui kan hraw ding chu a mîn hriettir theina dingin,” tiin.

en: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto Jehovah your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass that whatsoever thing Jehovah shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Jeremia chun an kuomah, “In thu chu ka hriet tah a; ngai ta u, LALPA in Pathien kuoma chun in thuhai ang peiin ṭawngṭai ka tih; chun, thil iengkhawma LALPAIN a hung dawnna cheu chu in kuomah hrilfieng ka tih, iengkhawm in kuomah ip naw ning,” a ta.

en: Then they said to Jeremiah, Jehovah be a true and faithful witness amongst us, if we do not according to all the word wherewith Jehovah thy God shall send thee to us.
hmr: Anni chun Jeremia kuoma chu, “LALPA i Pathienin kan kuoma a hung tirna ang thu po pohai anga kan thaw naw chun, LALPA chu eini laia hrietpuitu ringum le indik ni raw se.

en: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of Jehovah our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of Jehovah our God.
hmr: A ṭha amanih, a sie amanih khawm ni sienla, LALPA kan Pathien kan itirna che chu a râwl chu ngai kan tih; LALPA kan Pathien râwl chu kan awi pha chun, keini ta dinga a ṭhatna dingin,” an ta.

en: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah.
hmr: Chun, ni sâwm hnunga chun, LALPA thu chu Jeremia kuoma chun a hung tlung tah a.

en: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
hmr: Ama chun Karea naupa Johanan le, an kuoma um sipai hotuhai po po le, mi po po a chîn taka inthawka a lien tak chenin a ko a.

en: and said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him:
hmr: an kuomah a hril a, “A hmaa in hninahai chu intlun dinga in mi tirna, LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih:

en: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.
hmr: Hi rama hin in chêng zing chun, rem ka ti cheu a, ṭhiek naw ning cheu, phun ka ti cheu a, phawidawk naw ning cheu, in kuoma thil ṭha naw ka thaw kha ka lamlêt ta sih a.

en: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith Jehovah: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
hmr: In iṭitak Babulon lal chu ṭi naw unla, ama chu ṭi naw ro, LALPA chun a tih: a kuta inthawka sanhima san- dam ding cheuin kei in kuomah ka um zing sih a.

en: And I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy upon you, and cause you to return to your own land.
hmr: Chun, zângaina phalpêk ka ti cheu a, in chungah zângaina a neia, in ram ngeiah ân kîrtir nâwkna ding cheuin.

en: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land; so that ye obey not the voice of Jehovah your God,
hmr: Amiruokchu, ‘Hi rama hin um zing nâwng ei tiu,’ in tih a, in Pathien LALPA râwl chu in awi naw a,

en: saying, No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:
hmr: ‘Ni lo, Aigupta ramah fe lem ei ta, chutaka chun indona hlak hmu nâwng ei ta, tawtawrâwt ri hlak hre nâwng ei ta, bei tlâksam hlak hre bawk nâwng ei ta, chutaka chun chêng ei tiu,’ ti in ni chun;

en: now therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, O remnant of Judah: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, If ye indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;
hmr: Aw Juda la um sunhai, tuhin LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u; sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Aigupta rama lût dinga in hmaihai in innghat chieh a, chutaka va mikhuol dinga in fe chun;

en: then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye fear, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, whereof ye are afraid, shall follow hard after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.
hmr: hieng hi hung nîng a tih: chu Aigupta rama chun kâwlhnâm in ṭi hlak khan hung hnawt phâk a ti cheu a, ṭâm in iṭi khan chu Aigupta rama chun a hung hnawt rak rak ding cheu a nih; chuongchun, chutaka chun thîng in tih.

en: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there: they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.
hmr: Va mikhuol dinga Aiguptaa fe dinga an hmaihai innghat chie chuong mihai po po chu chuong ang chu nîng an tih; kâwlhnâmah thîng an ta; ṭâm le hripuia leh; an chunga thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtir dinga inthawk chun tukhawm suokthlengin amanih, tukhawm um zing naw ni hai.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: As mine anger and my wrath hath been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall my wrath be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt; and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Jerusalem hluotuhai chunga ka lunginsenna le ka ṭiumna bunthlâka a um ang khan; Aigupta rama in lût pha chun ka ṭiumna chu in chunga chun bunthlâk ni vêng a tih; chuongchun, hnâwm- hnawk le, makti ding le, ṭawngsephur le, thusekawk nîng in ta, hi hmun hi hmu nâwk ta ngai naw ti niu.

en: Jehovah hath spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah, Go ye not into Egypt: know certainly that I have testified unto you this day.
hmr: Aw Juda la um sunhai, nangni chungthuah LALPA chun thu a hril a nih: Aiguptaa chu fe dêr naw ro: vawisûn hin in kuomah ka hrilfie ta a nih ti hi hre ngei ngei ro.

en: For ye have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for ye sent me unto Jehovah your God, saying, Pray for us unto Jehovah our God; and according unto all that Jehovah our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
hmr: In thlarauhai chunga chun hmusitumtakin in lo thaw tah a; ‘LALPA kan Pathien kuoma chun mi ṭawngṭaipêk la, LALPA kan Pathien- in a hril ang ang che chu kan kuomah hrilfie la, thâwng kan tih,’ tiin LALPA in Pathien kuoma chun in mi tir ta sih a,

en: And I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah your God in anything for which he hath sent me unto you.
hmr: vawisûn hin in kuomah ka hrilfie tah a, nisienlakhawm, in kuoma a mi hung tirna ang thil ienga khawm chun LALPA in Pathien râwl chu in awi si nawh a.

en: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go to sojourn there.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, chutaka va mi- khuol in nuomna hmuna chun, kâwl- hnâm le, ṭâm le hripuiin thîng in tih ti hi hre ngei ngei ro,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass that, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of Jehovah their God, wherewith Jehovah their God had sent him to them, even all these words,
hmr: Chun, hieng thuhai po po, LALPA an Pathienin an kuom- a ama a tirna, LALPA an Pathien thuhai po po chu mipuihai po po kuoma Jeremia chun a hril zo chun,

en: then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou speakest falsely: Jehovah our God hath not sent thee to say, Ye shall not go into Egypt to sojourn there;
hmr: Hossia naupa Azaria hai, Karea naupa Johanan hai, mi chapo po pohai chun Jeremia kuomah thu an hril a “Thukhêl i hril dêr a nih: ‘Chutaka va mikhuol dingin, Aigupta rama chun in fe ding a ni nawh,’ ti dingin LALPA kan Pathien chun a hung tir naw cheh a;

en: but Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death, and carry us away captive to Babylon.
hmr: Neria naupa Baruk chun an mi that theina ding le, Babulona sala an mi ṭhuoi theina dingin Kaldaihai kuta mîn hlân dingin, nang hi kan chunga chun a hung tir che a ni hi,” tiin.

en: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of Jehovah, to dwell in the land of Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Karea naupa Johanan hai, sipai hotuhai po po le mipuihai po po chun Juda rama chêng zing ding thu LALPA râwl chu an awi nawh a.

en: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from all the nations whither they had been driven, to sojourn in the land of Judah;
hmr: Chuongchun, Karea naupa Joha- nan le, sipai hotuhai po po chun Juda rama la um sunhai, Juda rama hnawt hmang an nina hnamhaia inthawka hung kîr nâwkhai,
