en: the men, and the women, and the children, and the king’s daughters, and every person that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.
hmr: pasalhai, nuhmeihai, naupang- hai, lal naunuhmeihai le, mi tin Nebuzaradanin Saphan naupa Ahikam, chu naupa Gedalia le zâwl- nei Jeremia le, Neria naupa Baruk kuoma a mâksanhai chu an ṭhuoi a;

en: And they came into the land of Egypt; for they obeyed not the voice of Jehovah: and they came unto Tahpanhes.
hmr: Aigupta rama chun an fe tah a; LALPA râwl chu an awi si nawh a; chuongchun, Tahpanhes chenin an fe tah a.

en: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
hmr: Chun, Tahpanhesa chun Jeremia kuomah LALPA kuoma inthawka thu chu a hung tlung a;

en: Take great stones in thy hand, and hide them in mortar in the brickwork, which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;
hmr: “Lung lientak takhai i kutin la la, Juda mihai mithmua chun, Tahpan- hesa Pharao in lûtna bula um, ṭêklei siemna hmuna a chârna chira chun phûm rawh;

en: and say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.
hmr: chun, an kuoma chun, ‘Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, mi tir ka ta, ka siehlaw Nebukadnezzar Babulon lal chu hung ṭhuoi ka ta, kha lung ka phûmhai chunga khan a lalṭhungpha chu innghat a tih; chuong chunga chun a lal puon in chu zar a tih.

en: And he shall come, and shall smite the land of Egypt; such as are for death shall be given to death, and such as are for captivity to captivity, and such as are for the sword to the sword.
hmr: Ama chu hung a ta, Aigupta rama chu hung hrem a ta, thinaa pêk dinghai chu thinaah, sala intâng dinghai chu salah, kâwlhnâma ding- hai chu kâwlhnâm kuoma pêk nîng an tih.

en: And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captive: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta pathienhai ina chun mei sêm a ta; ama chun râwng a ta, salah ṭhuoi hmang a tih; berâmpu chu ama silfêna ân chei angin, ama chu Aigupta ram chun inchei a tih; chutaka inthawk chun thlamuong- takin fe suok tâng a tih.

en: He shall also break the pillars of Beth-shemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of Egypt shall he burn with fire.
hmr: Chun, Beth-semes sûtpuihai Aigupta rama um khawm chu suk- thliek bawk a ta, Aigupta ram pa- thienhai inhai khawm chu meia raw ni bawk an tih,’ a tih, ti rawh,” tiin.

en: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews that dwelt in the land of Egypt, that dwelt at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,
hmr: Aigupta rama Juda chêng po pohai, Migdola dâm, Tahpan- hesa dâm, Nopha dâm, Pathros rama chênghai dâm chungthua Jeremia kuoma thu hung tlung chu,

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no man dwelleth therein,
hmr: “Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Juda ram khawpuihai le Jerusalem chunga thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtirhai po po kha in hmu tah a, ngai ta u, vawisûn ang dâm hin râusan an ni a nih, mi tukhawm an chêng naw a nih;

en: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense, and to serve other gods, that they knew not, neither they, nor ye, nor your fathers.
hmr: lunginsennaa mi chawktho ding- in an thlatuhaiin amanih, anni ngei khawma an hriet lohai pathien danghai chu an rawng bâwl ding le, an kuoma riminhnik raw dinga an fe a, chuong khawhlonahai an thawna lei chun.

en: Howbeit I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Oh, do not this abominable thing that I hate.
hmr: Zingkâra tho a, anni hung tirin, ka siehlaw zâwlneihai po po, ‘Aw hi thil tirdakum ka theida hi chu thaw naw ro,’ tiin in kuomah ka hung tir a.

en: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an ngai nawh a, Pathien danghai kuoma riminhnik raw a an khawhlonahai chu nghat- san dingin an nahai khawm an sit nawh a:

en: Wherefore my wrath and mine anger was poured forth, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is this day.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka lunginsenna le ṭîumna chu Jerusalem kawtthlêrhaia le Juda ram khawpuihai chunga chun bunthlâkin a um a, mûtchawkin a um ta a ni kha; chuongchun, vawisûn ni chena an ni angin, suksiet le râusan an ni tah a.

en: Therefore now thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Wherefore commit ye this great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you man and woman, infant and suckling, out of the midst of Judah, to leave you none remaining;
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin LALPA sipaihai Pathien, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: nangnia inthawka pasal, nuhmei, naute le nene ne lai, Juda rama inthawka mâksan khawm um dêr lo dinga iengdinga in thlarauhai chung ngeia hieng thil ṭha naw hi thaw am in na?

en: in that ye provoke me unto anger with the works of your hands, burning incense unto other gods in the land of Egypt, whither ye are gone to sojourn; that ye may be cut off, and that ye may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
hmr: chuongahai chun in kut sinthaw- hai chun in mi suklungsen a, in va mikhuolna tiengahai chun Aigupta rama pathien danghai kuoma chun riminhnik dâm in rawh a; chuong chu hi hnuoia hnam po pohai laia thu- sekawk le, ṭawngsephur le, sât thlâk in ni theina ding chau a ni naw am a nih?

en: Have ye forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?
hmr: In thlatuhai khawhlona dâm, Juda ram lalhai khawhlona dâm, an nuhmeihai khawhlona dâm le nangni khawhlona dâm ngei khawm, in nuhmeihai khawhlonahai Jerusalem kawtthlêrhaia le, Juda rama an thawhai kha in hriet zing naw am a nih?

en: They are not humbled even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.
hmr: Vawisûn ni chen khawm hin an insukhnuoi nawh a, an ṭi bawk nawh a, ka dân khawm chu an hraw bawk nawh a, ka thuruothai khawm chu an hraw nawh; chuong in thlatuhai le nangni hma ngeia ka lo sie tahai kha.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah.
hmr: Chuleiin, sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Juda po po sât thla ding cheuin, a se tiengah in kuom tieng ka hmai kân nghat cheu a nih.

en: And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed; in the land of Egypt shall they fall; they shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine; they shall die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine; and they shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach.
hmr: Juda la um sunhai chu ṭhuoi ka ta, chutaka va mikhuol dinga Aigupta ram tieng an hmai innghathai chu; chun, anni chu bohmang vawng an ta, Aigupta rama chun tlûng an ta; ṭâmna le kâwlhnâmin anni chu suk- bohmang nîng an tih; thîng an ta, a chîn taka inthawka a lien tak chenin kâwlhnâm le ṭâmin thîng an tih; chuongchun, anni chu hnâwmhnawk le, makti ding le, ṭawngsephur le ṭawngsekawk nîng an tih.

en: For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence;
hmr: Hripui le ṭâmna le kâwlhnâma Jerusalem ka hrem ang bawk khan Aigupta rama chênghai chu ka hrem ding a ni sih a;

en: so that none of the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall escape or be left, to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return save such as shall escape.
hmr: chuongchun, Juda la um sun, va mikhuol dinga Aigupta rama va fehai chu tukhawm, Juda ram hung kîr nâwka chêng an inhâwkna rama hung kîr nâwk ding hin suokthleng naw ni hai a, um zing bawk naw ni hai; a suokthlenghai ti chau naw chu tukhawm an hung kîr nâwk âwm si nawh a,” tiin.

en: Then all the men who knew that their wives burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great assembly, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,
hmr: Chun, mi an nuhmeihaiin pathien danghai kuomah riminhnik an raw ti hretuhai po po le, nuhmei lo ngîr vehai po po le, inkhâwm nasa- takhai, Pathrosa Aigupta rama mi chêng po pohai chun Jeremia chu an dawn a,

en: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of Jehovah, we will not hearken unto thee.
hmr: “LALPA hminga kan kuoma i thuhril chungthua chun, i thu chu ngai naw ning ungah.

en: But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to burn incense unto the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of victuals, and were well, and saw no evil.
hmr: Amiruokchu, kan baua thu suok po pohai, vâna lalnu kuoma rimin- hnik raw ding dâm, a kuoma dâwnmi thilinhlân buok ding dâm, Jerusalem kawtthlêrhaia le Juda ramhaia, keini le kan thlatuhai le, kan lalhai le kan rorêltuhai leh kan lo thaw ta hlak ang khan thaw ngei kan tih; chuong lai chun fâk ding tinrêng kan neiin, a ṭha hlea, a sietna kan hmu nawh.

en: But since we left off burning incense to the queen of heaven, and pouring out drink-offerings unto her, we have wanted all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.
hmr: Amiruokchu, hi vân lalnu kuoma riminhnik raw kan mâka, dâwnmi thilinhlân buok kan mâk china chu thil iengkim kan tlasamin, ṭâmna le kâwlhnâmin a mi sukbo- hmang zo a ni ta hi.

en: And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven, and poured out drink-offerings unto her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink-offerings unto her, without our husbands?
hmr: Chun, vân lalnu kuoma rimin- hnik kan raw a, dâwnmi thilinhlân kan buok lai chun, kan pasalhai ṭhang loin dâwnmi thilinhlân chu kan buokin, ama biekna ding beithlumhai kan siem am a nih?” an tih a.

en: Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, even to all the people that had given him that answer, saying,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun, mipui po po, pasalhai, nuhmeihai, mi po po chu dawnnaa ama dawntuhai kuoma chun a hril a,

en: The incense that ye burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, did not Jehovah remember them, and came it not into his mind?
hmr: “Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai le, Juda rama nangni le, in thlatuhai le, in lalhai le, in rorêltuhai le, chu rama mihaiin riminhnik in raw hlak kha LALPA chun a hriet zing nawin, a lungril khawm a hung tlung naw am a nih?

en: so that Jehovah could not longer bear, because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have committed; therefore is your land become a desolation, and an astonishment, and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.
hmr: Thil tirdakum in thawhai lei le, in thilthawhai suol lei chun LALPA chun a tuor pei ta nawh a; vawisûn ni ang chen khawma a ni ang sawn, in ram chu râusan le, maktia um le, ṭawngsekawk, hluotu um lo a lo ni ta kha.

en: Because ye have burned incense, and because ye have sinned against Jehovah, and have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil is happened unto you, as it is this day.
hmr: Riminhnik chu in raw leiin, LALPA chungah in lo suksuol ta leiin, LALPA râwl chu in ngai nawh a, a dân khawm in hraw nawh a, a thuruothaia le, a thu inhriettirahai chun in um bawk nawh a; chuleiin, vawisûn nia a um ang hin, hieng thil ṭha nawhai hi in chungah a hung tlung a ni hi,” tiin.

en: Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the women, Hear the word of Jehovah, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt:
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun Jeremia chun mipuihai po po kuoma le nu- hmeihai kuoma chun, “Aigupta rama Juda um po pohai, LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u;

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and with your hands have fulfilled it, saying, We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto her: establish then your vows, and perform your vows.
hmr: sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Nangni ni leh, in nuhmeihai ni leh in bauin thu in hril a, in kuthaiin in sukpuitling pei a, ‘Vân lalnu kuoma riminhnik raw ding le, a kuoma dâwnmi thilinhlânhai chu buok dingin, thutiem ei tiem tahai ei thaw ngei ding a nih,’ tiin; chuong a ni chun, in thutiem chu sukpuitling unla, in thutiemhai chu thaw ro chu!

en: Therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by my great name, saith Jehovah, that my name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, As the Lord Jehovah liveth.
hmr: Chuleiin, Aigupta rama Juda chêng po pohai, LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u: Ngai ta u, ‘LALPA Pathien chu a hring zing angin,’ tiin, Aigupta ram po poa Juda mi tukhawm baua chun ka hming chu lam a ni ta nawna dingin, ka hming ropuitak chu sâlin ṭawng kân khâm a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thil ṭha tiengah ni loin, thil ṭha naw tienga dingin anni chu ka enkai dêk a nih: Aigupta rama Juda mi um po pohai chu, an ram dêr hmakhat chun, ṭâmna dâm le kâwl- hnâm dâma anni chu sukbohmang nîng an tih.

en: And they that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, mine, or theirs.
hmr: Chuong kâwlhnâma inthawka suokthlenghai, mi tlâwmte chau chu Aigupta rama inthawk chun Juda rama chun hung kîr nâwk an tih; chuongchun, va mikhuol dinga Aigupta rama Juda la um sun va fehai po po khan, keia thu am a ni, anni thu a ieng am a dingchang lema ti hre tâng an tih.

en: And this shall be the sign unto you, saith Jehovah, that I will punish you in this place, that ye may know that my words shall surely stand against you for evil:
hmr: Chun, hi hi in ta dinga inchikna nîng a tih, LALPA chun a tih: thil ṭha naw tienga dingin ka thu chu a dingchang ngei a nih ti in hriet theina dingin hi hmuna hin ka hrem ding cheu a nih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of them that seek his life; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy, and sought his life.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta Pharao Hophra Aigupta lal chu a hmêlmahai kuta le, ama hring- na zawngtuhai kuta chun ka pêk ding a nih; Juda lal Zedekia chu Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar a hmêlma le ama hringna zawngtu kuta chun ka pêk ang khan,” tiin.

en: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
hmr: Juda ram lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim inlal kum, kum linaa, Jeremia baua inthawka lekha- bua thuhai a ziek laia, Neria naupa Baruk kuoma zâwlnei Jeremia thuhril thu chu:

en: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch:
hmr: “Aw Baruk, LALPA, Israel Pa- thien chun i kuoma chun hieng hin a tih.

en: Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for Jehovah hath added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.
hmr: ‘LALPA chun ka natna chunga hin lungngaina chu a belsa si a, ka chung a va rik de! kân rûmna leiin ka chau a, sâwldamna hrim ka hmu nawh,’ i tih a.

en: Thus shalt thou say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama kuoma chun hieng hin hril i tih: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, ka rem ta chu sukchim ka ta, ka phun ta khawm chu phawidawk ka tih; hi hi ram pumpui sûnga hin:

en: And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not; for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith Jehovah; but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.
hmr: Chun, nang chun i ta dingin thil ropuihai chu i zawng a ni maw? Zawng naw rawh, ngai ta, mihriem po po chungah thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtir ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih; chun, i hringna ruok chu i fena tieng tiengah sanhim ka ti che,” tiin.

en: The word of Jehovah which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.
hmr: Hnamhai chungthua zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu:

en: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh-neco king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.
hmr: Aigupta chungthuah: Juda ram lal Josia naupa Jehoiakim inlal kum li kuma Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar- in a rûn, Aigupta lal Pharao-neko sipai Euphrates vadungpui panga Karkemisa umhai chungthu chu:

en: Prepare ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
hmr: Âwmphaw le phaw buotsai unla, indona chu hnai ro.

en: Harness the horses, and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
hmr: Sakawrhai chu râlthuom unla, nangni sakawr chung chuong mihai, chuong unla, in lukhumhai leh ngîr- suok ro; feihai chu nâwttle unla, râlthuom chun inthuom ro.

en: Wherefore have I seen it? they are dismayed and are turned backward; and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not back: terror is on every side, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Iengtizie am an ta le? An bei- dawng zo a, an hnungtawl tah a; an mi hrâthai chu hnein an um a, an tlân dar a, hnungtieng an ngha ta nawh; ṭium chu sîr tinah a um a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; in the north by the river Euphrates have they stumbled and fallen.
hmr: Mi hrât chu tlân hmang naw sienla, mi thilthawthei khawm chu suokthleng naw raw se; hmâra chun Euphrates vadungpui panga chun an insui a, an tluh a.

en: Who is this that riseth up like the Nile, whose waters toss themselves like the rivers?
hmr: Nile vadung, vadungpuihai ang ela tuihai invawr let anga ngîr dawk chu tu am a na?

en: Egypt riseth up like the Nile, and his waters toss themselves like the rivers: and he saith, I will rise up, I will cover the earth; I will destroy cities and the inhabitants thereof.
hmr: Aigupta ram chu Nile vadung ang chun a hung lien a, a tuihai chu vadungpui tuihai ang elin ân vawr let a; ama chun, “Hung lien ka ta, leihnuoi hi inkhum ka tih; khawpui- hai le chutaka a hluotuhai chu sukbohmang bawk ka tih,” a ta.

en: Go up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, that handle the shield; and the Ludim, that handle and bend the bow.
hmr: Nangni sakawrhai, hang fe unla, nangni sakawr tawlailîrhai, lungin- sen ro; mi thilthawtheihai khawm chu fe suok raw hai seh; Ethiopia le Put mihai, phaw hmang mihai le, Lud mi thalngul kuoi hmang mihai chu.

en: For that day is a day of the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries: and the sword shall devour and be satiate, and shall drink its fill of their blood; for the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
hmr: Chu ni chu LALPA, sipaihai LALPA ni, a hmêlmahai chunga phuba a lâk theina dinga, phuba lâkna ni a ni sih a; kâwlhnâm chun fazo a ta, tlai a tih; chun, an thisen chu a khawp tâwkin dawn bawk a tih; LALPA sipaihai LALPA chun hmâr- tieng ramah Euphrates vadungpui panga chun inthâwina chu a nei sih a.

en: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt: in vain dost thou use many medicines; there is no healing for thee.
hmr: Gileada chun hang fe la, thinghnai damdâwi hang la rawh, aw Aigupta naunu nunghâk inthieng, a thlâwn elin damdâwi tamtak i lo hmang tah a; i ta dingin damna hrim a um nawh a.

en: The nations have heard of thy shame, and the earth is full of thy cry; for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, they are fallen both of them together.
hmr: Hnamhai chun în zakna chu an lo hriet a, i khêkri chun hnuoi chu a sip zo tah; mi thilthawthei chu mi thilthawtheia ma chun ân suithlu a, an pahni hni chun an tlu rêl a nih.

en: The word that Jehovah spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
hmr: Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chu hung a ta, Aigupta ram chu ieng angin am a hung rûn ding a na, ti thua zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma LALPA thuhril thu chu:

en: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand forth, and prepare thee; for the sword hath devoured round about thee.
hmr: Aiguptaa chun hril unla, Migdola chun phuong unla, Nopha khawm chun phuong unla, Tahpan- hesa le chun: “Ngîr dawk la, inbuotsai rawh; i vêla chun kâwlhnâm chun a fâk zo pei ta si a,” ti ro.

en: Why are thy strong ones swept away? they stood not, because Jehovah did drive them.
hmr: I mi hrâthai chu iengdingin am lên hmangin um an ta? LALPA chun anni chu a hnawtdar leiin, anni chu an ngîr nawh.

en: He made many to stumble, yea, they fell one upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.
hmr: Mi tamtak chu insuithlu dingin a siem a, anih, an intlûk thuo pei a, “Tho unla, hi kâwlhnâm nêksâwrnaa inthawk hin eini mihai laia ngei le, ei piengna ram ngeia khan fe nâwk ei tiu,” an tih a.

en: They cried there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath let the appointed time pass by.
hmr: Chutaka chun an khêk a, “Aigupta lal Pharao hlak chu ri mei mei el chau a ni sih a; hun ruothai chu ân feliemtir pei a,” tiin.

en: As I live, saith the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
hmr: Laltak a hming khawm sipaihai LALPA chun, ka hring zing angin; tuisuoriet panga Karmel ang le, tlânghai laia Tabor tlâng angin, ama chu hung ngei ngei a tih.

en: O thou daughter that dwellest in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Memphis shall become a desolation, and shall be burnt up, without inhabitant.
hmr: Aw nang naunuhmei Aigupta rama chêng, sala intâng dinga fe dingin incheibâwl rawh, Noph chu râusan nîng a ta, hluotu boin a kâng ding a ni sih a.

en: Egypt is a very fair heifer; but destruction out of the north is come, it is come.
hmr: Aigupta hi bâwngla hmêl ṭha- tak a na, nisienlakhawm, hmârtienga sietna chu a hung a, a hung tlung mêk a nih.

en: Also her hired men in the midst of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they did not stand: for the day of their calamity is come upon them, the time of their visitation.
hmr: A sûnga mi inhlawfahai khawm chu, ran ina bâwngtêhai ang an nih; anni khawm chu an hnungkîr a, an tlân hmang hmunkhat a; an ngir hrim hrim nawh; an lunginzingna ni, anni hremna hun chu an chungah a hung tlung si a.

en: The sound thereof shall go like the serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.
hmr: A rî chu rûlpui rî ang a na; a hmêlmahai chun kalchawiruolin, hreipuihai leh thing phûrtuhai angin an hung rûn a.

en: They shall cut down her forest, saith Jehovah, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.
hmr: Zawng suok thei ni naw sien khawm, a rampui hnuoihai chu phûr thlûng an tih, LALPA chun a tih; khâuhai nêkin an tam lem a, tiem thei an ni si nawh a.

en: The daughter of Egypt shall be put to shame; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
hmr: Aigupta naunu chu sukzak nîng a ta; hmârtienga mihai kuta chun pêk suok nîng a tih.

en: Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saith: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and her kings; even Pharaoh, and them that trust in him:
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: “Ngai ta u, Noa um Amon le Pharao le Aigupta le, a pathienhai le, a lalhai le; Pharao ngei le ama ringtuhai chu ka hrem ding a nih;

en: and I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith Jehovah.
hmr: anni chu an hringna zawngtu- hai kuta le, Babulon lal Nebukadnez- zar kuta le, a siehlawhai kuta chun pe suok ka tih; chu hnunga chun, tienlaia ang bawk khan hluoin um tâng a tih; LALPA chun a tih.

en: But fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw Jakob ka siehlaw, ṭi naw rawh, aw Israel, bei- dawng bawk naw rawh, ngai ta, hlataka inthawkin nang le, i chithla- hai chu sala an intângna rama inthawk chun ka sandam ding cheu a ni sih a; Jakob chu hung kîr nâwk a ta, to ṭawk ṭawk a ta, nuomsain um a tih, tukhawma sukṭi ta naw ni hai.

en: Fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; for I am with thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee; but I will not make a full end of thee, but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise leave thee unpunished.
hmr: Aw ka siehlaw Jakob, ṭi naw rawh, LALPA chun a tih; i kuomah ka um sih a, nang ka hnawt hmangna che tienga hnamhai po po chu suk- tâwp vawng ka ta, nang ruok chu suktâwp letdêr naw ning cheh a; rorêlnain sukdik lem ka ti cheh a, ieng kawnga khawm hrem loin mâksan naw ning che,” tiin.

en: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.
hmr: Pharaoin Gaza a rûn hmaa, Philistin mihai chungthua zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall become an overflowing stream, and shall overflow the land and all that is therein, the city and them that dwell therein; and the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, hmârtienga inthawkin tuihai a hung lien a, vadung kuong lêt hung nîng a ta, ram le a sûnga umhai le khawpui le a sûnga umhai le chun hung lêtkhum a ta; mihai chu khêk an ta, ram hluotuhai po po ṭap inrûm an tih.

en: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers look not back to their children for feebleness of hands;
hmr: A mi hrâthai ketin tet rîka le, a sakawr tawlailîrhai tlân rîka le, taw- lailîr kehai innâwt rîka chun pahai chu an ṭi a, an nauhai enkai theilo lêkin an kuthai a zawi thla a;

en: because of the day that cometh to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper that remaineth: for Jehovah will destroy the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.
hmr: ṭhangpuitu la um taphawthai chu Tura le Zidona inthawka sât thlâk dingin, Philistin mihai po po suksietna dinga ni hung tlung chu a ni leiin, Kaphtor thlierkâra la um- sunhai, Philistin mihai chu LALPA chun a sukbohmang ding a ni sih a.

en: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is brought to nought, the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?
hmr: Gazaa chun châtvaina a hung tlung a, an phairuom la um sun, Askelon hlak chu ieng khawm loa siem a ni tah a; chun, nang le nang ieng chen am în ât ding a na?

en: O thou sword of Jehovah, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard; rest, and be still.
hmr: Aw nang LALPA kâwlhnâm, i châwl ṭawk ṭawk hma po chu ieng chen am nîng a ta? nang chu i bâwma chun inthun nâwk el rawh, châwl la, um ṭawk ṭawk rawh.

en: How canst thou be quiet, seeing Jehovah hath given thee a charge? Against Ashkelon, and against the sea-shore, there hath he appointed it.
hmr: LALPA chun thaw ding a pêk si che chun iengtin am châwl thei i ta? Askelon le tuisuoriet panga umhai thaw dingin a ruot che a nih.

en: Of Moab. Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe unto Nebo! for it is laid waste; Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is taken; Misgab is put to shame and broken down.
hmr: Moab chungthu chu, Sipaihai LALPA, Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih “Nebo chu a chung a rik! suksiet a ni ta sih a; Kiriathaim chu sukzakin a um a, lâkin a um tah a; Misgab chu sukzakin a um a, sukchimin a um ta bawk a.

en: The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: Come, and let us cut her off from being a nation. Thou also, O Madmen, shalt be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue thee.
hmr: Moab inpâkna chu a um ta nawh a; Hesbona chun a chungah thil ṭha naw chu an rawt a, ‘Thaw ro, hnam ninaa inthawkin ama chu sât thlâng ei tiu,’ tiin. Nang khawm Aw Madmen, sukto ṭawk la nîng i tih; kâwlhnâmin hung hnawt bawk a ti che.

en: The sound of a cry from Horonaim, desolation and great destruction!
hmr: Horonaima inthawka khêkri chu, suksietna le sukbohmangna nasatak a nih a!

en: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
hmr: Moab chu suksiet a ni tah a, a têhai chun khêkri hriet dingin an hung thawh a.

en: For by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping shall they go up; for at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distress of the cry of destruction.
hmr: Luhith hang fenaa chun ṭap pum zing zingin an hang fe hlak ding a ni sih a; Horonaim zuk fenaa chun sukbohmangna khêkri rinum tuor ri chu an hriet sih a.

en: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
hmr: Tlân hmang unla, in hringnahai chu sanhim unla, thlalêra sabeng- tung ang chu ni unla.

en: For, because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou also shalt be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
hmr: I sinthawhaia le i roa chun i ringna în nghat leiin, nang khawm man nîng i ta; Kemos khawm chu sala intâng dingin fêng a ta, a thiempuhai le a rorêltuhai leh.

en: And the destroyer shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as Jehovah hath spoken.
hmr: Khawpui tina chun suksetu hung tlung a ta, khawpui ieng khawm suokthleng naw ni, phairuomhai khawm chu suksiet nîng a ta, phai- zâwl khawm chu sukbohmang nîng a tih; LALPAIN a hril ta angin.

en: Give wings unto Moab, that she may fly and get her away: and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein.
hmr: Moab kuoma chun a vuong hmang theina dingin thlahai pe la: a khawpuihai chu râusan a ni ding a na, mi a chêng hrim hrim um loin.

en: Cursed be he that doeth the work of Jehovah negligently; and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.
hmr: LALPA sin hmusittaka thawtu chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se; thisen insuo dinga a kâwlhnâm la kîrtu chu ṭawngsephurin um bawk raw se.

en: Moab hath been at ease from his youth, and he hath settled on his lees, and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither hath he gone into captivity: therefore his taste remaineth in him, and his scent is not changed.
hmr: Moab chu a naupang laia in- thawk tah nuomsain a um a, a mawng inkhâwnah a um a, bêl khata inthawka bêl danga inruokin a um nawh a, sala khawm ân tâng bawk nawh a, chuleiin, a rim chu amaa chun a um zing a, a riminhnikna chu a danglam nawh.

en: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will send unto him them that pour off, and they shall pour him off; and they shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles in pieces.
hmr: “Chuleiin, ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung mêk, LALPA chun a tih; ama kuoma chun bunthlatuhai chu tir ka ta, anni chun ama chu bun- thlâng an tih, a bûrhai chu sukruok an ta, a bûrhai chu suknawi dar an tih.

en: And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence.
hmr: An ringtak Bethel chu Israel sûngkaw ta dinga inzapuium a ni ang khan, Moab chu Kemos chun inzapui a tih.

en: How say ye, We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war?
hmr: ‘Mi thilthawthei, indonaa mi hrât khawkhênghai ei nih,’ ieng tin am in ti thei a?

en: Moab is laid waste, and they are gone up into his cities, and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter, saith the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Moab chu suksietin a um a, a khawpuihai hlak chu meiin a khuh a, a tlangvâlhai hlak chu that thlâk zo an ni tah a, Laltak, a hming sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hasteth fast.
hmr: Moab lunginzîngna ding chu a hung tlung vâng vâng tah a, suk- rinuma a umna ding khawm chu a hung inhmaw tah.

en: All ye that are round about him, bemoan him, and all ye that know his name; say, How is the strong staff broken, the beautiful rod!
hmr: Nangni a vêla um po pohai, ama chu ṭa unla, a hming hretuhai po po chun, ‘Lalhmawl ngartak el, hmawl mawitak el chu iengtiziea tliek el am a na?’ ti ro.

en: O thou daughter that dwellest in Dibon, come down from thy glory, and sit in thirst; for the destroyer of Moab is come up against thee, he hath destroyed thy strongholds.
hmr: “Aw nang Dibona chêng naunu- hmei, i ropuinaa inthawkin hung thla la, dangchârin ṭhung rawh; Moab suksetu chu i chungah a hung tlung a, i kul nghethai chu a suksiet ta sih a.

en: O inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way, and watch: ask him that fleeth, and her that escapeth; say, What hath been done?
hmr: Aw Aroer hluotuhai, lampui sîrah ngîr unla, enthlit ro; a suok- thleng ta le, a tlân hmanghai kha indawn unla, ‘Ieng am thaw a ni ta leh?’ ti ro.

en: Moab is put to shame; for it is broken down: wail and cry; tell ye it by the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.
hmr: Moab chu sukzakin a um a; suksiet a ni ta sih a; ṭap inrûm unla, ṭap ro; Arnona chun va hril unla, Moab suksieta a um tâk thu chu.

en: And judgment is come upon the plain country, upon Holon, and upon Jahzah, and upon Mephaath,
hmr: “Phaizâwl ram chunga chun rorêlna a hung tlung a; Holon chunga dâm, Jahza chunga dâm, Mephaath chunga dâm;

en: and upon Dibon, and upon Nebo, and upon Beth-diblathaim,
hmr: Dibon chunga dâm, Nebo chunga dâm, Beth-diblathaim chung- a dâm;

en: and upon Kiriathaim, and upon Beth-gamul, and upon Beth-meon,
hmr: Kiriathaim chunga dâm, Beth- gamul chunga dâm, Beth-meon chunga dâm;

en: and upon Kerioth, and upon Bozrah, and upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.
hmr: Kerioth chunga dâm, Bozra chunga dâm; Moab rama khawpui hla le hnaiahai po po chunga dâm chun.

en: The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Moab mi chu sât thlâk a na, a bân khawm chu sukthliek a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Make ye him drunken; for he magnified himself against Jehovah: and Moab shall wallow in his vomit, and he also shall be in derision.
hmr: “Ama chu vairui ta u, LALPA chu dodâlin ama le ama ân chawi- mawi sih a; Moab chu ama luoka ngei chun inbuol a ta, ama chu mi hrilin- sîm hung ni bawk a tih.

en: For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves? for as often as thou speakest of him, thou waggest the head.
hmr: Nanga ta ding chun Israel chu hrilinsîm a ni naw am a nih? Inruhai lai hmu a ni am a nih? Ama thu chu i hril poleh, lu i lei el sih a.

en: O ye inhabitants of Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock; and be like the dove that maketh her nest over the mouth of the abyss.
hmr: “Aw Moab hluotuhai, khawpui- hai chu mâksan unla, râwlahai chun va chêng ro; pûk bau sîra a bu septu vâṭhu ang chu ni ro.

en: We have heard of the pride of Moab, that he is very proud; his loftiness, and his pride, and his arrogancy, and the haughtiness of his heart.
hmr: Moab chapona chu kan hriet a, a chapo êm êm el a; ân suksângna le, a chapona le, a uongna le, a lungrila uongthuongna le chun.

en: I know his wrath, saith Jehovah, that it is nought; his boastings have wrought nothing.
hmr: A lunginsenna chu ka hriet a, LALPA chun a tih; iengkhawm a ni nawh a; a chapona chun iengkhawm a thawdawk nawh.

en: Therefore will I wail for Moab; yea, I will cry out for all Moab: for the men of Kir-heres shall they mourn.
hmr: Chuleiin, Moab ta ding chun ka ṭap inrûm ding a nih; anih, Moab po po ta ding chun khêk ka tih; Kir-heres mihai chu ka ṭa ding a ni sih a.

en: With more than the weeping of Jazer will I weep for thee, O vine of Sibmah: thy branches passed over the sea, they reached even to the sea of Jazer: upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage the destroyer is fallen.
hmr: Aw Sibmaa grêphrui, Jazer ta dinga ṭap nêk hmana nasa khan i ta dingin ṭap ka ta; i kauhai chun tui- suoriet râl an kai a, Jazer tuisuoriet chu an va tlung hiel a; i nipui theihai chunga le i grêp rahai chunga chun suksetu a tlung tah a.

en: And gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field and from the land of Moab; and I have caused wine to cease from the winepresses: none shall tread with shouting; the shouting shall be no shouting.
hmr: Moab rama inthawk le lo rahlâwkna hmunhaia inthawk chun hlimna le lâwmna dâm chu lâk hmang a ni tah a; uoin sâwrna khurhaia inthawk chu uoin chu kân kangtir tah a; tukhawma khêk pumin sirsâwr naw ni hai a; khêk ri khawm chu lâwmna khêk ri ni naw ni.

en: From the cry of Heshbon even unto Elealeh, even unto Jahaz have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even unto Horonaim, to Eglath-shelishiyah: for the waters of Nimrim also shall become desolate.
hmr: “Hesbona inthawka Elea chen le, Jahaz chen rauin khêkria inthawk chun an râwl an insuo a, Zoara in- thawka Horonaim chen, Eglath-selesia chenin; Nimrim vadunghai khawm chu râusanin a um ding a ni sih a.

en: Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab, saith Jehovah, him that offereth in the high place, and him that burneth incense to his gods.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm, Moaba chun bâwlhmuna thilinhlân le, ama pathien kuoma riminhnik râwtu chu suktâwp ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Therefore my heart soundeth for Moab like pipes, and my heart soundeth like pipes for the men of Kir-heres: therefore the abundance that he hath gotten is perished.
hmr: Chuleiin, Moab ta dingin ka lung chu theihle angin ân rih a, Kir- heresa mihai ta dingin ka lung chu theihle angin ân ri a nih; chuleiin, tamtak a ihmu tahai khawm chu a bohmang tah a nih.

en: For every head is bald, and every beard clipped: upon all the hands are cuttings, and upon the loins sackcloth.
hmr: “Lu tin chu a kâwk a, khâkhmul tin kildein a um a; kut po pohai chun thil chepnawi an chawi a; kâwnghai chunga chun saiip puonhai a um bawk a.

en: On all the housetops of Moab and in the streets thereof there is lamentation every where; for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein none delighteth, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Moab in chungsâng tinahai le, kawtthlêrahai hmun tinah ṭap ri a um a; Moab chu bêl ditna umlo ang chun ka sukkhawi tah a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: How is it broken down! how do they wail! how hath Moab turned the back with shame! so shall Moab become a derision and a terror to all that are round about him.
hmr: Ieng anga sukkhawi am a na? Ieng angin am an ṭap inrûm a? Moab chun inzak leiin iengtin am a hnung- innghat el a; chuongchun, Moab chu a vêla umhai ta ding chun lungsuk- zîngna le hrilinsîm nîng a tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah: Behold, he shall fly as an eagle, and shall spread out his wings against Moab.
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Ngai ta u, mupui angin vuong a ta, Moab chunga chun a thlahai zâr a tih.

en: Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized, and the heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
hmr: Kerioth chu lâkin a um a, kul dethai chu maktiin an um a; chu ni chun Moab mi thilthawthei lungril chu nuhmei na tuor lai lungril ang nîng a tih.

en: And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Moab chu LALPA do- dâla ân chawimawi leiin, hnam ninaa inthawka sukbohmang nîng a tih.

en: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Ṭitna le, khurthim le, châng chu i chungah a um, Aw Moab ram hluotu, LALPA chun a tih.

en: He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for I will bring upon him, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Ṭitnaa inthawka tlân chu khur- thima chun tlâng a ta, khurthima inthawka suok chu chânga chun âwk a tih; anni hremna kum chu ama chungah, Moab chunga ngei chun, kân tlungtir ding a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: They that fled stand without strength under the shadow of Heshbon; for a fire is gone forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and hath devoured the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.
hmr: Chuong a tlân hmanghai chu hrâtna nei loin, Hesbon hlima chun an ngîr a, mei chu Hesbona inthawk chun a fe suok a, meichawk chu Sihona inthawkin a fe suok a, Moab ram sîr le, chawkbuoituhai lua lallu- khum chu a kâng hmang tah a.

en: Woe unto thee, O Moab! the people of Chemosh is undone; for thy sons are taken away captive, and thy daughters into captivity.
hmr: Aw Moab, i chung a va rik de! Kemosa mihai chu hmanglo an nih, i naupasalhai chu sala ṭhuoiin an um a, i naunuhmeihai khawm chu salah an intâng sih a.

en: Yet will I bring back the captivity of Moab in the latter days, saith Jehovah. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Moab sal in- tângna chu nakie tieng niahai chun la hung la kîr nâwk ka tih, LALPA chun a tih” tiin. Moab chunga rorêlna chu chuong chen chu a nih.

en: Of the children of Ammon. Thus saith Jehovah: Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth Malcam possess Gad, and his people dwell in the cities thereof?
hmr: Ammon thlahai chungchâng thu chu: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: “Israel hin naupasal a nei naw a ni maw? Rohluotu ding a nei naw maw? Chuong a ni si chun ieng dinga Milkom hin Gad hi a nei a, a mihai chu khawpuia hai chun chêng am an nih a?

en: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon; and it shall become a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel possess them that did possess him, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung mêk, LALPA chun a tih: Ammon thlahai Rabba chunga chun indona ṭhâwnglâwk ri chu hriet ngei dingin inumtir ka ta; chuongchun, râusan hmun pâwng el hung nîng a ta; a naunuhmeihai chu meiin kâng an tih; chuongchun, ama lo neitu chu Israel chun nei ve thung a ta, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is laid waste; cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth: lament, and run to and fro among the fences; for Malcam shall go into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
hmr: Aw Hesbon ṭap inrûm rawh, Ai chu suksiet a ni ta sih a; nangni Rabba naunuhai, khêk unla, saiip puon inbel unla, ṭap unla, a daihai laia chun hnungtieng hmatieng tlân inlawn ro; Milkom chu a thiempuhai leh a rorêltuhai leh sala intâng dingin a fe ding a ni sih a.

en: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?
hmr: Iengdinga phairuomahai chun în chawimawi am a na? I phairuomhai chu an luonghmang zo tah, Aw nang naunu hnungtawl, ‘Tu am ka kuomah hung a ta?’ tia mâni rohai ringtu.

en: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, from all that are round about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth, and there shall be none to gather together the fugitives.
hmr: Ngai ta, i chunga chun ṭitna ka hung intlungtir ding a nih, sipaihai PATHIEN, Lalpa chun a tih: i vêla umhai po poa inthawk chun inumtir ka ta; mi tin chu hnawt suok letdêr an ti cheu a, ân vâkhmang tahai chu kei khâwmtu ding tukhawm um naw ni hai.

en: But afterward I will bring back the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Ammon thlahai sal intângna chu hung la kîr nâwk ka tih, LALPA chun a tih” tiin.

en: Of Edom. Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?
hmr: Edom chungthu, Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: “Temana chun varna a um ta naw a ni maw? Mi vara inthawka thurâwn an bohmang ta a ni maw? An varna chu a bohmang a ni ta maw?

en: Flee ye, turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I shall visit him.
hmr: Tlân hmang unla, hnung kîr unla, chêng inthûk unla, Aw Dedan hluotuhai, ama chunga chun Esau lunginzîngna chu ka hung intlungtir ding a ni sih a, ama ka hrem hun ngei chu.

en: If grape-gatherers came to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, would they not destroy till they had enough?
hmr: Grêp ra lotuhai chu i kuomah hung hai sienla, grêp hmu ṭhel ṭhenkhat an mâksan naw ding maw? Zânah inru hung sienla, an dittâwk an nei hmakhat chu an suksiet naw ding maw?

en: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is destroyed, and his brethren, and his neighbors; and he is not.
hmr: Esau chu ruoka ka sie a na, ân bîkna hmunhai chu ka suklangpêk a, ama le ama chu inthup thei naw nih; a chi chu suksiet a na, a unauhai le a tuolbâwmhai le, ama chu a um ta nawh.

en: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.
hmr: I nau pa bohai kha mâksan la, keiin hringin hlâng ka tih; chun, i hmeithai khawm chun mi ring bawk raw se.

en: For thus saith Jehovah: Behold, they to whom it pertained not to drink of the cup shall assuredly drink; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink.
hmr: “LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Ngai ta u, an kuoma no dâwn phâk nawhai chun dâwn ngei ngei an ta; anleh nang chu hrem lo dinga um hrim hrim am i nih? Hrem lo ni naw tawp i tih; i dâwn ve ngei ngei ding a nih.

en: For I have sworn by myself, saith Jehovah, that Bozrah shall become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
hmr: Keima insâlin kân khâm ta sih a, LALPA chun a tih: Bozra chu makti ding el nîng a ta, thusekawk, suksieta um, ṭawngsephur nîng a tih; chun, chutaka khawpuihai po po chu kumkhuoa sie ni bawk an tih.

en: I have heard tidings from Jehovah, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, Gather yourselves together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
hmr: LALPA kuoma inthawkin chan- chin lâwmum ka hriet a; ‘Nangni le nangni hung inkhâwm unla, ama hung do unla, indonaah hung tho ro,’ tiin, aiawtu pakhat chu hnamhai laia chun tir a nih.

en: For, behold, I have made thee small among the nations, and despised among men.
hmr: Ngai ta, hnamhai laia a china le, mihai laia hmusitumah ka siem ta cheh a.

en: As for thy terribleness, the pride of thy heart hath deceived thee, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith Jehovah.
hmr: I ṭiumna chungthua chun, i lungril chapona chun a hlêm che a nih; Aw nang lungpui kak kârhaia chêngtu, muol insângnahai cheltu: i bu chu mupui bu anga insânga chun sep la khawm, chutaka inthawk chun ka hung sukhnuoi ding che a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And Edom shall become an astonishment: every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
hmr: “Chun, Edom khawm chu maktia um ding el ni bawk a ta, mi a fe khêltu tinhai chun mak tîng an ta; a sietna po poa chun inchek an tih.

en: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities thereof, saith Jehovah, no man shall dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.
hmr: Sodom le Gomorra le chu kâwl vêla khawpuihai suksiet ang khan, chutaka chun tukhawm chêng naw ni hai, tukhawm inzinah va fe bawk naw ni hai, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation: for I will suddenly make them run away from it; and whoso is chosen, him will I appoint over it: for who is like me? and who will appoint me a time? and who is the shepherd that will stand before me?
hmr: Ngai ta u, ama chu tlatna hmun pângngaia chun Jordan vadung fâwna inthawk chun sakeibaknei ang elin hung a ta; amiruokchu, ama kuoma inthawk chun intlânsiettir vak ka tih; chun, mi tukhawm thlang- a um chu, ama chunga chun ruot ka ta, tu am keia ang an um a? Tuin am hun mi ruotpêk a ta? Berâmpu ka hmaa ngîr ding chu tu am a na?

en: Therefore hear ye the counsel of Jehovah, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely they shall drag them away, even the little ones of the flock; surely he shall make their habitation desolate over them.
hmr: Chuleiin, Edom khaw chung- thua LALPAIN thurâwn a ilâktak le, a thiltum, Teman hluotuhai chunga lo tum ta chu lo ngai ta u; matheiloin, anni chu ran ruol têhai hnûk hmangin um ngei ngei an ta an chêngna chu anni irâusanin siempêk a tih.

en: The earth trembleth at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise whereof is heard in the Red Sea.
hmr: An tlûk ria chun hnuoi chu ân thin a; an khêk ri chu Tuipui Sena chun hriet a na.

en: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread out his wings against Bozrah: and the heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hung suok a ta, mu- pui angin vuong a tih, chun, a thlahai chu Bozra chunga chun phar a ta; chun, chu nia chun Edoma mi thil- thawtheihai lungril chu nuhmei na tuor lai lungril ang nîng a tih” tiin.

en: Of Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad; for they have heard evil tidings, they are melted away: there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
hmr: Damaska chungthu chu. Hamath chu ân zak, Arpad leh; chan- chin ṭha lo an lo hriet a, an intuihmang ta si a; tuisuoriet infâwn re thei lo angin an buoi a.

en: Damascus is waxed feeble, she turneth herself to flee, and trembling hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, as of a woman in travail.
hmr: Damaska chu a hung hrât nawh a, tlân hmang dingin ân her a; inthinnain ama chu a man a; thuok- dawngna le lungngaium chun ama a chel tlat tah a; nuhmei nauhase nat tuor ang elin.

en: How is the city of praise not forsaken, the city of my joy?
hmr: Iengtiziea inpâkna khawpui, ka hlimna khawpui hi nghatsana um am a na?

en: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chuleiin, a tlangvâlhai chu a kawtthlêrahai chun tlûng an ta, chu ni chun indo mihai po po khawm chu sukto ṭawk ṭawk nîng an tih, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
hmr: Damaska banga chun mei sêm ka ta, Benhadad lal inhai khawm chu kâng hmang vawng a tih.

en: Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote. Thus saith Jehovah: Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and destroy the children of the east.
hmr: Kedar le Hazor ram Babulon lal Nebukadnezzarin a rûnhai chungthu chu. LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: “Tho unla, Kedara chun hang fe ro, saktienga thlahai chu hang sukse ro.

en: Their tents and their flocks shall they take; they shall carry away for themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Terror on every side!
hmr: An puon inhai le an ran ruolhai chu lâng an ta; an ta dingin an puonhai, an bûr le bêlhai po po le an sanghâwngseihai po po ṭhuoi hmang an tih; chun, an kuoma chun, ‘Kil tina ṭitna ruok a nih,’ tiin mi khêk an tih.

en: Flee ye, wander far off, dwell in the depths, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith Jehovah; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.
hmr: Tlânse unla, hlatakah invâk unla, tlumhmang dai ro, Aw Hazor hluotuhai, LALPA chun a tih; Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chun in chunga thurâwn a siem tah a, in chunga thiltum a nei ta sih a.

en: Arise, get you up unto a nation that is at ease, that dwelleth without care, saith Jehovah; that have neither gates nor bars, that dwell alone.
hmr: Tho unla, hnam nuomsipa khawsa le pawisak hrim nei lo an khâta chênga, dai kawtkhâr amanih, kawtkhâr thîrhai amani khawm nei lo hai chu thaw ro, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter unto all winds them that have the corners of their hair cut off; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, an sanghâwngseihai chu râllâkthilhai nîng an ta, an ran ruolhai khawm chu râllâksum ni bawk an tih; chun, barêp vawhai chu kâwlkil po poah sukdar ka tih, chun, anni kil tina inthawk chun an lungin- zingna ding chu hung intlungtir ka ta, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And Hazor shall be a dwelling-place of jackals, a desolation for ever: no man shall dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.
hmr: Chun, Hazor chu sihalhai ta dinga chêngna hmuna le, kumkhaw râusan nîng a ta, chutaka chun tu- khawm chêng naw ni hai a, mihriem nau tukhawm chutaka chun inzin khawm vân zin bawk naw ni” tiin.

en: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
hmr: Juda lal Zedekia rorêl ṭantir lai Elam chungthua zâwlnei Jeremia kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu:

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
hmr: “Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, an thilthawtheina laili Elam thalngul chu sukthliek ka tih.

en: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.
hmr: Chun, Elam chunga chun vân hmun palihaia inthawka thli palihai chu hung inhrângtir ka ta, chu thli fena tienga chun anni chu sukdar vawng ka tih, Elama inthawka hnaw dawkhai tlung nawna hnam hrim hrim um naw ni hai.

en: And I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life; and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith Jehovah; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:
hmr: Chuongchun, Elam chu an hmêlmahai hmaa beidawng dingin siem ka ta, an hringna zawngtuhai hmaa le chun. Chun, an chunga chun thil ṭha naw, ka lunginsenna ṭiumtak chu hung intlungtir ka tih, LALPA chun a tih; chun, an hnunga chun kâwlhnâm inhnawttir ka ta, anni chu ka sukbohmang vawng hmakhat chun;

en: and I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence king and princes, saith Jehovah.
hmr: chun, Elama chun ka lalṭhung- pha chu inṭhut ka ta, chutaka lal le rorêltuhai chu sukbohmang ka tih; LALPA chun a tih.

en: But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring back the captivity of Elam, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ni nuhnungahai chun hieng hi hung nîng a ta; Elam sal intângna chu hung la kîr nâwk ka tih, LALPA chun a tih” tiin.

en: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that doeth justly, that seeketh truth; and I will pardon her.
hmr: Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai chun hmatieng hnungtieng tlân unla, tuhin va en ta u! chutaka hmun lienahai chun va zawng unla, va hre ta u, mi hrim in va hmuin, mi thil indiktaka thaw a, thudik zawng hrim an um am; chun, chuong a ni chun ngaidam ka tih.

en: And though they say, As Jehovah liveth; surely they swear falsely.
hmr: “LALPA chu a hring zing angin,” an ti dea chu, inkhêl letdêra inkhâm el an nih.

en: O Jehovah, do not thine eyes look upon truth? thou hast stricken them, but they were not grieved; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
hmr: Aw LALPA, i mit chun thudik chu a hmu a ni naw am a nih? Anni chu i vuok a, amiruokchu, an lungngai nawh a; anni chu i fâk zo a, anachu, sukdikna chu an dangkîr sih a, an hmêlhai chu lungpui nêka ngarin an siem a, hungkîr chu an nuom naw a nih.

en: Then I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish; for they know not the way of Jehovah, nor the law of their God:
hmr: Chun, kei chun, “Matheiloin, hienghai hi mi rimsi an na; invêt an nih: an Pathien rorêl amani, LALPA lampui amani khawm chu an hriet si nawh a.

en: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they know the way of Jehovah, and the law of their God. But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
hmr: Mi lienhai kuoma chun fêng ka ta, an kuoma chun thu hril ka tih; anni chun chu an Pathien rorêl le, LALPA lampui chu an hriet sih a,” ka tih a. Nisienlakhawm, hienghai hin lungril hmunkhatin rîngkawl chu an sukthliek a, khuopnahai chu an suktan tah a.

en: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, a wolf of the evenings shall destroy them, a leopard shall watch against their cities; every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces; because their transgressions are many, and their backslidings are increased.
hmr: Chuleiin, ramhnuoia sakeibak- nei chun anni chu sukhlum a ta, zântieng huna satenehai chun anni chu suksieng an tih, chun, keitê chun an khawpuihai chu nghâk a ta, mi tukhawm chutaka inthawka suok taphawthai chu keinawiin um an ta, an bawsietnahai chu a tam êm leiin le, an hnungtawlnahai chu a hung pung ta pei leiin.

en: How can I pardon thee? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods. When I had fed them to the full, they committed adultery, and assembled themselves in troops at the harlots’ houses;
hmr: Iengtin am ngaidam thei ka ti cheh a? I thlahai chun an mi nghat- san tah a, pathien ni lohaia chun an inkhâm tah a; khawptaka ka châwm lai khawmin, an uire tah a, nawchi- zawr inahai chun a pâwl pâwlin anni chu an inkhâwm tâwl a.

en: they were as fed horses roaming at large; every one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
hmr: Zîngkâra sakawr vaikhawphai ang an nih; mi tin chun a tuolbâwm nuhmei chu inhnarin an inhrâm a.

en: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
hmr: Hieng thilhai lei hin ka hung hrem naw ding am a nih? LALPA chun a tih; ka thlarau chun hieng ang hnam chunga hin phuba a lâk naw ding am a nih?

en: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her branches; for they are not Jehovah’s.
hmr: “Grêp tlar lai chun hang fe unla, sukse ro; tâwp ṭhuoina ruok chu thaw naw unla, a kauhai chu la thla unla, LALPA ta an ni si nawh a.

en: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Israel sûngkuo le Juda sûngkuo chun ka chungah khawhlotakin an lo thaw ta sih a,” LALPA chun a tih.

en: They have denied Jehovah, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:
hmr: LALPA chu an lo inphatsan a, “Ama a ni nawh; thil ṭha naw chu ei chungah hung tlung chuong naw ni; ṭâm amanih, kâwlhnâm amani khawm hmu chuong nâwm ei ni;

en: and the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
hmr: zâwlneihai khawm chu thli el an na, annia chun thu a um nawh; an kuoma chun chuong anga thaw chu nîng a tih,” an tih a.

en: Wherefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA, sipaihai Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Hieng thuhai hi in hril leiin, ngai ta, i baua chun ka thuhai chu meiah inchangtir ka ta, hi mipuihai hi a thingah, chuongchun, anni chu kânghmang a tih.

en: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith Jehovah: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
hmr: Ngai ta, hlataka inthawkin i chungah hnam hung ṭhuoi ka ta, Aw Israel sûngkuo, LALPA chun a tih; hnam hrâttak nîng a ta, hnam hluitak el ni bawk a ta; hnam an ṭawng khawm i hriet lo le, an hril khawm i hriet lo nîng a tih.

en: Their quiver is an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.
hmr: An thal bâwmhai chu thlân in- hawng ang a na, mi hrât khawkhêng ruok an nih.

en: And they shall eat up thy harvest, and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat; they shall eat up thy flocks and thy herds; they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig-trees; they shall beat down thy fortified cities, wherein thou trustest, with the sword.
hmr: Anni chun i lohma suok le i bu fâng an ta, i naupasalhai le i naunu- hmeihai fâk ding ngei chu; berâm ruolhai le i bâwng ruolhai chu fa zo vawng an tih; i theichang kûng hai le i grêphruihai chu fa zo an ta, i khawpui kulneihai kâwlhnâm le i în hnêmnahai chu sukchim an tih.

en: But even in those days, saith Jehovah, I will not make a full end with you.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong niahai khawm chun, i tâwp dêrna ding chu thaw naw ning, LALPA chun a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore hath Jehovah our God done all these things unto us? then shalt thou say unto them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served foreign gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
hmr: Chun, i mihaiin, “Iengdinga LALPA ei Pathien chun ei chungah hienghai hi a thaw am a na?” an ti pha chun, hieng ang hin anni chu dawn i tih, “Kei in mi lo nghatsan a, in rama chun pathien danglamhai rawng chu in lo bâwl ta ang khan, ram in ta ni ngai loa chun mi hmêl- makhai rawng chu in bâwl ding a nih,” tiin.

en: Declare ye this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
hmr: Jakob sûngkuoa chun hi hi hril unla, Juda rama chun phuongdar ro;

en: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; that have eyes, and see not; that have ears, and hear not:
hmr: Aw hrietthiemna boa mi invêt- hai, tuhin hi hi lo ngai ta u; mithai nei sia, hmu lohai, nahai nei sia hre lohai;

en: Fear ye not me? saith Jehovah: will ye not tremble at my presence, who have placed the sand for the bound of the sea, by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it? and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it.
hmr: Kei chu in mi ṭi naw maw? LALPA chun a tih; Keia hmaihmaa, kumkhaw thupêk anga a liem thei nawna dinga tuisuoriet khuopnaa phaiphin sietu hmaah in inthin naw ding maw? chutaka tuifâwnhai chu an hang innawk hlaka chu, a liem thei si nawh a; an inrûm hlaka chu an fe khêl thei bawk si nawh.

en: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
hmr: Amiruokchu, hi hnam hin lungril hel le, lungril inher an nei a, an hel a, an fe tah a.

en: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear Jehovah our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in its season; that preserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
hmr: An lungril khawma, “LALPA ei Pathien, a huntaka ruo hmasa le nuhnung petu, ei ta dinga busîk hun haptahai mi ruotpêktu chu ṭing ei tiu,” khawm an ti dêr nawh.

en: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good from you.
hmr: In suolnahai chun hieng thilhai hi a hnawt hmang a, in suolnahai chun nangnia inthawk chun ṭhatna- hai chu a chelkîrpêk cheu a ni hi.

en: For among my people are found wicked men: they watch, as fowlers lie in wait; they set a trap, they catch men.
hmr: Ka mihai laia chun mi rilohai hmu a na; anni chun vate mantuhaiin an inchân angin an inchân a; châng an kam a, mihai chu an man a.

en: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxed rich.
hmr: Bâwm chu vatehaia a sip angin, an inhai chu inhlêmnain a sip a; chuleiin, an hung lienin an hung hausa a.

en: They are waxed fat, they shine: yea, they overpass in deeds of wickedness; they plead not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, that they may prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
hmr: An hung thâu a, an tlawr a, anih, khawhlona thilthawhai chu an thiem zâk a, a chungthu angin, pa neilohai chungthua chun an ṭan nawh a, an hlawtlingna dingin; mi tlasamhai thuneina chu an ngaisak nawh a.

en: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
hmr: Hieng thilhai lei hin ka hung hrem naw ding am a nih? LALPA chun a tih; hnam hieng ang chunga hin ka thlarau chun phuba a lâk naw ding am a nih?

en: A wonderful and horrible thing is come to pass in the land:
hmr: Hi rama hin thil maktak le thil ṭiumtak chu a hung tlung ding a nih;

en: the prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
hmr: zâwlneihai chun indik lotakin an lo hrillâwk a, thiempuhai hlak chun anni thu ang angin ro an lo rêl tah a, ka mihai hlak chun, chuong chu nei an lo châk bawk sih a: a tâwpa chun ieng am thâw tâng i ta?

en: The word that Jehovah spake concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.
hmr: Zâwlnei Jeremia hmanga, Kal- daihai ram chungthu, Babulon chungthua LALPA thuhril chu:

en: Declare ye among the nations and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and conceal not: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is put to shame, Merodach is dismayed; her images are put to shame, her idols are dismayed.
hmr: “Hnamhai laia chun hril la, phuong rawh, chun, puonzâr chu khai la, phuong la, thup naw rawh, ‘Babulon chu lâkin a um a, Bêl chu sukzak a na, Merodak chu a bei- dawng a, a milimhai po po chu sukzakin an um a, a milimhai chu an beidawng zo tah,’ ti rawh.

en: For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they are fled, they are gone, both man and beast.
hmr: Hmârtienga inthawk chun hnam pakhat a ram chu râusana siema tukhawm chêng lo dinga siem dingin a hung mêk a; an tlânseh a, mihriem le ramsahai khawm chu, an fe hmang zo tah a.

en: In those days, and in that time, saith Jehovah, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together; they shall go on their way weeping, and shall seek Jehovah their God.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, chuong hunahai chun, LALPA chun a tih: Israel thlahai chu hung an ta, anni le Juda thlahai chu a ruolin hung an ta; an ṭap malamin hung an ta, LALPA an Pathien chu zawng an tih.

en: They shall inquire concerning Zion with their faces thitherward, saying, Come ye, and join yourselves to Jehovah in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.
hmr: Hma sawngin Zion chu râwn an ta, ‘Hung ve ro, theinghila um ta ngai lo ding chatuon thuthlung chun LALPA chu hung zawm ve ro khai,’ tîng an tih.

en: My people have been lost sheep: their shepherds have caused them to go astray; they have turned them away on the mountains; they have gone from mountain to hill; they have forgotten their resting-place.
hmr: “Ka mihai chu berâm inhmang- hai an lo ni tah a, an vêngtuhai chun anni chu tlângahai chun inherhmang- tirin, an ṭhuoi hmang a; tlânga in- thawkin muola dâm chun an fe a, an riekna hmun chu an theinghil tah a.

en: All that found them have devoured them; and their adversaries said, We are not guilty, because they have sinned against Jehovah, the habitation of righteousness, even Jehovah, the hope of their fathers.
hmr: A hmu taphawthai hlak chun anni chu an fâkzo a, an hmêlmahai chun, ‘Thudik umna LALPA, an thla- tuhai beiseitak, LALPA chunga chun thil an suksuol lei a nih, ei sukpawi nawh,’ an tih a.

en: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he-goats before the flocks.
hmr: Babulona inthawk chun tlânsuok unla, Kaldaihai rama inthawk chun fe suok unla, kêl ruol hmaa kêlchal ang ni ro.

en: For, lo, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country; and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken: their arrows shall be as of an expert mighty man; none shall return in vain.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmârtieng rama inthawka hnam ropuitak inkhâwm chu Babulon hung rûn dingin hung chawktho ka ta, in hungtir ka tih; a chunga chun hung intlar an ta; chutaka inthawk chun lâkin um a ta, an thalhai chu mi hrât indo thiemtak a thlâwna kîr nâwk ngai naw ang a nih.

en: And Chaldea shall be a prey: all that prey upon her shall be satisfied, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Kaldai chu râllâk- sum hung nîng a ta, ama suksetuhai taphawt chu lungawi êm êm an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Because ye are glad, because ye rejoice, O ye that plunder my heritage, because ye are wanton as a heifer that treadeth out the grain, and neigh as strong horses;
hmr: Aw nangni ka rochan hung rûntuhai, in hlima in lâwm lei le, sazukpui bu chilse a, sakawr hrâttak inhrâm anga in tha a fân leiin; in nu chu nasatakin inzak a tih;

en: your mother shall be utterly put to shame; she that bare you shall be confounded: behold, she shall be the hindermost of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
hmr: nangni neitu cheu chu buoi a ta, ngai ta u, hnam po poa hnuoihnung tak, thlalêr le, ram ṭâwl le fienriel hmun nîng a tih.

en: Because of the wrath of Jehovah she shall not be inhabited, but she shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.
hmr: LALPA lunginsenna lei chun hluoin um naw nih a, a pumpuia râusan nîng a ta, mi tin Babulon fekhêltuhai phawt chun mak tîng an ta, a sietna po poa chun inchek an tih.

en: Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about, all ye that bend the bow; shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned against Jehovah.
hmr: Babulon chu a vêlin nangni khawma intlar khum ro, thalngul kuoituhai, ama chu kâp unla, thal chu ren naw ro, LALPA chungah thil a lo suksuol ta sih a.

en: Shout against her round about: she hath submitted herself; her bulwarks are fallen, her walls are thrown down; for it is the vengeance of Jehovah: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done, do unto her.
hmr: A vêlin ama chu khêkkhum unla; ama chu a hung inpêklût tah a, a kulhai chu a chim a, a banghai chu sukchim an na. Lalpa phubalâkna a ni sih a; ama chunga chun phuba la unla, amain a lo thaw ta ang khan a chunga khawm thaw ve ro.

en: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.
hmr: Babulona inthawk chu chi thetu chu sât thla unla, busîk laia kâwite hmangtu le chun; nêksâwrna kâwl- hnâm ṭi leiin mi tin chu mâni mihai tiengah kîr seng an ta, mi tin chu mâni rama seng chun tlân an tih.

en: Israel is a hunted sheep; the lions have driven him away: first, the king of Assyria devoured him; and now at last Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
hmr: “Israel chu berâm indar a nih: sakeibakneihai chun ama chu an lo hnawt hmang tah a; a hmasatak chun Assuria lal chun anni chu a fâkzo a; a tâwpah Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar hin a ruhai chu a sukthliek tah a.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
hmr: Chuleiin, sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Assuria lal ka hrem ang bawk khan Babulon lal le a ram chu ka hrem ding a nih.

en: And I will bring Israel again to his pasture, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.
hmr: Israel chu a tlatna hmuna chun hung ṭhuoi nâwk ka ta, Karmel le Basana chun tlâng a ta, a thla chu Ephraim le Gilead tlângahai chun lungawi tâwk tâng a tih.

en: In those days, and in that time, saith Jehovah, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, chuong pha chun, LALPA chun a tih: Israel suolna chu zawng nîng a ta, ieng- khawm um naw ni; chun, Juda suolna khawm chu hmu ni ta naw nih a; a mahla anga ka hla tahai chu ka ngaidam ding a ni sih a.

en: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: slay and utterly destroy after them, saith Jehovah, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
hmr: “Merathaim ram chu, chu ngei chu, Pekod hluotuhai le chun hang rûn ro; anni chu that unla, sukbo- hmang vawng ro, LALPA chun a tih: thu ka pêk ang tak cheu chun thaw unla.

en: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
hmr: Suksietna ropuitak le, indona ri chu rama chun a um a.

en: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
hmr: Hnuoi chung po po tubau iengtiziea tlieka innawi el am a ni aw! Iengtiziea Babulon chu hnamhai laia chun râusana um el am a ni aw!

en: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware: thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against Jehovah.
hmr: I ta dingin châng ka kam a, i âwk a ni tah, aw Babulon, i lo inring nawh a, LALPA chu i kal leiin hmu suokin i um a, manin i um an tah.

en: Jehovah hath opened his armory, and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation; for the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, hath a work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.
hmr: LALPA chun a râlthuom sie- khâwmna chu a hawng a, a lungin- senna hriemhreihai chu a hung lâk suok a, LALPA sipaihai LALPA chun Kaldaihai rama chun thaw ding a nei sih a.

en: Come against her from the utmost border; open her store-houses; cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly; let nothing of her be left.
hmr: Kil tina inthawk chun ama chu hung rûn unla, a siekhâwmna inhai chu hawng unla, ama chu pil dêng pâwng angin dêng pâwng unla, sukse letdêr ro; a ieng iengkhawm hlain um naw raw se.

en: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
hmr: A bâwngchalhai po po chu that vawng unla, sa thattu kuomah infetir ro; an chung a va rik de! an ni, anni hung hremna hun chu a hung tlung ta sih a. Babulon rama inthawka tlân- sea suokthlenghai râwlhai chu e!

en: The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of Jehovah our God, the vengeance of his temple.
hmr: “LALPA ei Pathien phubalâkna a biekin phubalâkna ngei chu Ziona hril ding a nih.

en: Call together the archers against Babylon, all them that bend the bow; encamp against her round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she hath done, do unto her; for she hath been proud against Jehovah, against the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: “Thalkâptuhai, thalngul kuoi- hai po po chu Babulon chunga chun ko khâwm ro; a vêl el chun riekngha unla, chutaka inthawk chun tu- khawm insuokthlengtir naw ro; a sinthaw ang pei chun ama chu thung unla, a lo thaw ta ang tak khan ama chungah thaw ve ro; LALPA chungah, Israel Mi Inthieng chunga chun a lo chapo ta sih a.

en: Therefore shall her young men fall in her streets, and all her men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, a tlangvâlhai chu a kawtthlêrahai chun tlûng an ta; chu ni chun a mi indo mihai po po khawm chu sukto ṭawk ṭawk nîng an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, I am against thee, O thou proud one, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts; for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
hmr: Ngai ta, nang ka dodâl che a nih, Aw nang mi chapo, LALPA, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih; i ni, ka hung hremna ding che ni chu a hung tlung mêk sih a.

en: And the proud one shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up; and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all that are round about him.
hmr: Chun, mi chapo chu insui a ta, tlûng a tih, tukhawma ama chu keitho naw ni hai; a khawpuiahai chun mei sêm ka ta, ama vêla umhai po po chu kâng hmang vawng a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together; and all that took them captive hold them fast; they refuse to let them go.
hmr: “Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Israel thlahai le Juda thla- hai chu nêksâwrin an um rêl a; anni sala mantuhai taphawt hlak chun an chel det tlat a, an infetir nuom nawh a.

en: Their Redeemer is strong; Jehovah of hosts is his name: he will thoroughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the earth, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
hmr: Anni sanhimtu chu a hrât a, a hming khawm, sipaihai LALPA a nih, ama chun an chungthu chu ṭan tlat a ta; hnuoi chunga chun châwlna a pêk thei a, Babulon hluotuhai ruok chu a sukto ṭawkṭawk nawna dingin.

en: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith Jehovah, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu Kaldaihai chunga dâm, Babulon hluotuhai chunga dâm, a rorêltuhai le a mivar- hai chunga chun a um a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: A sword is upon the boasters, and they shall become fools; a sword is upon her mighty men, and they shall be dismayed.
hmr: Chapohai chunga chun kâwl- hnâm chu a um a, invêtpui an ta, kâwlhnâm chu a mi thilthawtheihai chungah a um a, beidawng an tih.

en: A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women: a sword is upon her treasures, and they shall be robbed.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu an sakawrhai chunga dâm, an sakawr tawlailîrhai chunga dâm, ama sûnga mi chilakhai po po chunga dâm chun a um a, chuongchun, anni chu nuhmei ang el nîng an ta, kâwlhnâm chu a ro inhai chunga chun a um a, inrûkin um a tih.

en: A drought is upon her waters, and they shall be dried up; for it is a land of graven images, and they are mad over idols.
