hmr: A tuihai chunga chun kangna a um a, kangchat an tih; milim ker- fâwm ram a na, milimah an invêt ri ngawt el a ni sih a.

en: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wolves shall dwell there, and the ostriches shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
hmr: “Chuleiin, thlalêr ramsa hrâng- hai chu sihalhai leh chutaka chun chêng an ta; vangalsânghai khawm chêng an ta; kumkhuoin hluo hrim hrim ni ta naw ni; suona inthawka suon dang chena khawm hluo ni naw ni.

en: As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities thereof, saith Jehovah, so shall no man dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.
hmr: Pathien chun Gomorra le Sodom le a vêl khuohai chu a pei thlâk lai ang khan, LALPA chun a tih: chutaka chun mi chêng naw ni hai a, mihriem nau tukhawm chutaka chun inzin khawm vân zin naw ni hai.

en: Behold, a people cometh from the north; and a great nation and many kings shall be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmâr tienga in- thawkin hnam pakhat an hung a, hnam ropuitak el, lal tamtakhai le chun leihnuoi kilkhâwrtaka inthawk chen chun chawktho nîng an ta.

en: They lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, every one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
hmr: Anni chun thalngul le fei an chawi a; an rilo hle a, lunginsietna an nei nawh; an râwlhai chu tuisuoriet angin ân rûm a, sakawr chungahai chun an chuong a; Aw Babulon nau- nu, nangma chunga chun, indonaa mi angin, mi tin chu an intlar a nih.

en: The king of Babylon hath heard the tidings of them, and his hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
hmr: Babulona lal chun an ri chu a lo hriet a, a kuthai chu a hung chau a, ama chu lunginzîngna chun a man tah a, nuhmei nauhase nat tuor angin a na tah a.

en: Behold, the enemy shall come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation: for I will suddenly make them run away from it; and whoso is chosen, him will I appoint over it: for who is like me? and who will appoint me a time? and who is the shepherd that can stand before me?
hmr: “Ngai ta u, umhmun det chu doin, Jordan chaponaa inthawk chun sakeibaknei angin hung suok a ta; amiruokchu, amaa inthawk chun intlânsiettir vak ka tih; chun mi ama chunga thunei ding chun ruot ka ta; kei ang hi tu am an um hrim a? Tuin am hun mi ruotpêk a ta? Berâm vêngtu ka hmaa ngîr ding chu tu am a na?

en: Therefore hear ye the counsel of Jehovah, that he hath taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely they shall drag them away, even the little ones of the flock; surely he shall make their habitation desolate over them.
hmr: Chuleiin, Babulon chungthua LALPAIN thurâwn a nei chu lo ngai ta u, Kaldaihai ram chunga thiltum a nei tâk le chun. Matheiloin anni chu ran ruol têhai hnûkhmangin um ngei ngei an ta, an chêngna chu anni irâusanin siempêk a tih.

en: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth trembleth, and the cry is heard among the nations.
hmr: Babulon lâkna ria chun hnuoi chu ân thin a, hnamhai laia chun a khêk ri chu hrietin a um a,” tiin.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in Leb-kamai, a destroying wind.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: “Ngai ta u, Babulon chunga le, Kaldaia chêngtuhai chunga chun suksietna thli hung inhrângtir ka ta.

en: And I will send unto Babylon strangers, that shall winnow her; and they shall empty her land: for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.
hmr: Chun, Babulona chun ama zâptu ding tir ka ta, ama ram chu zâpfai an tih; buoina niahai chun a vêlin ama kaltuhai ruok an ni ding a ni sih a.

en: Against him that bendeth let the archer bend his bow, and against him that lifteth himself up in his coat of mail: and spare ye not her young men; destroy ye utterly all her host.
hmr: Thalkâptu chun a thalngul chu kuoi naw raw se, ama chu a îndona thuom chun inthuom bawk naw raw se, a tlangvâlhai chu hla naw unla, a sipaihai po po chu sukse fai rêt ro.

en: And they shall fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans, and thrust through in her streets.
hmr: Kaldai rama chun thata umin tlûng an ta, an kawtthlêrhaia chun sunthlengin um an tih.

en: For Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah, of his God, of Jehovah of hosts; though their land is full of guilt against the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: Israelhai amanih, Judahai ama- nih, an Pathien, sipaihai LALPA chu a nghatsan si nawh a; an ram chu Israel Mi Inthieng dodâlin khawhlo- nain sip hle sien khawm.

en: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and save every man his life; be not cut off in her iniquity: for it is the time of Jehovah’s vengeance; he will render unto her a recompense.
hmr: Babulona inthawk chun tlân suok unla, mi tinin a hringna sandam raw se; a khawhlonaa sât thlâkin um naw unla, LALPA phuba lâkna hun a ni sih a; ama chun thungna chu pêng a tih;

en: Babylon hath been a golden cup in Jehovah’s hand, that made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunk of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.
hmr: Babulon chu LALPA kuta chun rângkachak no hnuoi po po sukruitu chu a lo ni tah; hnamhai chun a uoin chu an dâwn tah a; chuleiin, hnamhai chu an invêt a nih.

en: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: wail for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.
hmr: Babulon chu a tlu thut a, suksietin a um a; ama ta dingin ṭap inrûm unla; a natna ta dingin thinghnai damdawi la unla, chuong- chun, a hung dam khiet rawi mawh.

en: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country; for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.
hmr: Babulon chu sukdam ka tum a, nisienlakhawm, sukdamin a um si nawh a; ama chu mâksan unla, mi tin chu mâni ram sengah fêng ei tiu; a chungthu rêlna chun vân a tlung ta sih a; vânhai chena dawm sâng chu a ni ta sih a.

en: Jehovah hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of Jehovah our God.
hmr: LALPA chun ei felnahai chu a hung lâk suok a; hung unla, Ziona chun va hril dar ei tiu, ei Pathien LALPA sinthawhai hi.

en: Make sharp the arrows; hold firm the shields: Jehovah hath stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes; because his purpose is against Babylon, to destroy it: for it is the vengeance of Jehovah, the vengeance of his temple.
hmr: Thalhai chu tâtngei unla, phawhai chu chel det ro; LALPA chun Media lalhai lungril chu a hung chawktho ta sih a; a remruot chu Babulon do le suksiet chu a na, LALPA phuba lâkna, a biekin phuba lâkna chu a ni sih a.

en: Set up a standard against the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set the watchmen, prepare the ambushes; for Jehovah hath both purposed and done that which he spake concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
hmr: Babulon kul banghai epa chun puonzâr chu khai unla, râlvêng chu sukhrât unla, vêngtuhai sie unla, râlvêng chu buotsai bawk ro; Babulon hluotuhai chunga chun LALPA chun a thurawt le a hril chu a thaw a ni ta hi.

en: O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, the measure of thy covetousness.
hmr: Aw nang tui tamtakhai chunga chêng, hausaknaa bit, i tâwpna a hung tlung mêk a, i hringna hrui ân tan tah.

en: Jehovah of hosts hath sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men, as with the canker-worm; and they shall lift up a shout against thee.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun, ‘Mathei- loin, leiṭha ang elin, mihriemin hung suksip ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, chun, i chunga chun hung khêk khum an ti che,’ tiin ama le ama insâlin a lo inkhâm tah a.

en: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and by his understanding hath he stretched out the heavens.
hmr: “A thilthawtheinân hnuoi chu a siem a, a varnain khawvêl chu a tungding a, a hrietthiemna chun vân- hai khi a keiphar bawk a;

en: When he uttereth his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasuries.
hmr: a râwl a hung insuo pha chun, vânhaia tuihai ân ri hum hum a; leihnuoi tâwphaia inthawk chun tui- hu dâm chu ân zâmkaitir bawk a, ruo ta dingin kâwlinlephai chu a siem a, a robâwmhaia inthawk chun thlihai chu a hung lâk suok a.

en: Every man is become brutish and is without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his image; for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
hmr: Mi tin el chu an lo intlaw tah a; hrietna boin an lo um tah a, rângkachak suttu tinhai khawm chu an milim kera siemhai lei chun sukzakin an um tah a, an milim sunghai chu khêlhlip el a ni sih a, annia chun inthuokna khawm a um si nawh a.

en: They are vanity, a work of delusion: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
hmr: Teplo el an nih, thil suol sin- thaw, anni chu hrem an ni pha chun bohmang an tih.

en: The portion of Jacob is not like these; for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance: Jehovah of hosts is his name.
hmr: Jakob chan chu hieng ang hi chu a ni nawh; ama chu thil po poa hmasa a na, Israel khawm chu a rochana a chipui a nih; Sipaihai LALPA chu a hming a nih.

en: Thou art my battle-axe and weapons of war: and with thee will I break in pieces the nations; and with thee will I destroy kingdoms;
hmr: “Nang chu ka indona hrei le, ka hriemhrei i nih; nangma chu hmang- in hnamhai chu suknawi vawng ka tih; nangma chu hmangin lalramhai chu suksieng ka ta;

en: and with thee will I break in pieces the horse and his rider;
hmr: nangma chu hmangin sakawr le a chunga chuong khawm chu suknawi vawng ka tih;

en: and with thee will I break in pieces the chariot and him that rideth therein; and with thee will I break in pieces man and woman; and with thee will I break in pieces the old man and the youth; and with thee will I break in pieces the young man and the virgin;
hmr: chun, nangma chu hmangin sakawr tawlailîr le a chunga chuong khawm suknawi vawng ka ta, nang- ma hmangin nuhmei khawm pasal khawm suknawi bawk ka tih; nang- ma hmangin upa le naupang khawm suknawi vawng ka ta; nangma hmangin tlangvâl le nunghâk khawm suknawi vawng ka tih;

en: and with thee will I break in pieces the shepherd and his flock; and with thee will I break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break in pieces governors and deputies.
hmr: nangma hmangin berâmpuhai le a ran ruol suknawi vawng ka ta, nangma hmangin lo neitu le a bâwngchal tuokhai khawm suknawi vawng ka tih; chun, nangma hmangin ram awptuhai lal aiawtuhai chu suknawi vawng ka tih.

en: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Babulon kuoma le, Kaldai hluotuhai po po chunga chun i mithmua Ziona thil ṭha naw an lo thaw tahai po po kha thung ka tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith Jehovah, which destroyest all the earth; and I will stretch out my hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.
hmr: “Ngai ta, Aw suksetu tlâng, hnuoi po po suksetu, nang ka dodâl che a nih, LALPA chun a tih: i chunga chun ka kut hung inlet ka ta, râwl- khotlânga inthawk chun inhlum thlâng ka ti cheh a, tlâng kângah siem ka ti che.

en: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, a kia lung dingin ama- nih, lungphûm dingin amanih nang- maa inthawk chun la naw ni hai a; amiruokchu, kumkhuoa râusan ni lem i tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashkenaz: appoint a marshal against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough canker-worm.
hmr: Rama chun indo puonzâr chu khai unla, hnamhai laia chun taw- tawrâwt mût unla, hnamhai chu ama do dingin buotsai ro; ama chunga chun Ararat dâm, Minni dâm, Askenaz lalramhai chu ko khâwm unla, a chunga chun sipai hotu lien inruot unla, sakawrhai chu khâu hawn angin inhungtir ro.

en: Prepare against her the nations, the kings of the Medes, the governors thereof, and all the deputies thereof, and all the land of their dominion.
hmr: Ama chunga chun, hnamhai, Media lalhai, an ram awptuhai, an lal aiawtuhai po po, a huop sûng ram po pohai chu buotsai ro.

en: And the land trembleth and is in pain; for the purposes of Jehovah against Babylon do stand, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitant.
hmr: Ram chu ân thin a, a nah a; Babulon chunga LALPA thiltum, Babulon ram chu hluotu um loa râusana um dinga a tum chu a la um zing sih a.

en: The mighty men of Babylon have forborne to fight, they remain in their strongholds; their might hath failed; they are become as women: her dwelling-places are set on fire; her bars are broken.
hmr: Babulon mi thilthawtheihai chun indo chu an ṭhul a, an kulahai chun an um zing a; an thilthawtheina khawm a thlâwn a, nuhmeihai ang el an ni tah a; a chêngna hmunhai chu meia rawin a um a, ân huonna thîr- hai khawm chu sukthliekin a um tah a.

en: One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to show the king of Babylon that his city is taken on every quarter:
hmr: Thangko pakhat chu a dang intuokpui dingin tlân a ta, mi tir pakhat chu a dang intuokpui dingin tlân bawk a ta, Babulon lal chu kil tina inthawkin khawpui chu lâk a ni tah ti hril dingin;

en: and the passages are seized, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.
hmr: fenahai chu khârin a um a, phairuonghai chu meiin an rawh a, indo mihai khawm chu suklâuin an um tah a,” tiin.

en: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing-floor at the time when it is trodden; yet a little while, and the time of harvest shall come for her.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a ti sih a: “Babulon naunu chu hrizâwl bu chîl mêkna lai ang chu a nih; nakie sâwt nawtêah, ama ta dingin bu chil hun la hung tlung a tih,” tiin.

en: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath, like a monster, swallowed me up, he hath filled his maw with my delicacies; he hath cast me out.
hmr: “Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chun a mi fâk zo a, a mi suknawi a, ama chun bêl ruokah a mi siem tah a, rûlpui ang elin a mi lem a, kân hnikna chun a phîng chu a suksip a, a mi peisâk tah a.

en: The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and, My blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
hmr: Ka chunga le ka tisa chunga thawluina hi Babulon chungah um raw se,” Zion hluotuhai chun, tîng an ta; “Ka thisen hi Kaldai hluotuhai chungah um raw se,” Jerusalem chun ti bawk a tih.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her fountain dry.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a ti sih a: “Ngai ta u, in thua chun ṭan ka ti cheu a, in ta dingin phuba lapêk ka ti cheu; chun, a tuisuoriet chu sukkang ka ta, a tuikhur khawm chu sukhul ka tih.

en: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwelling-place for jackals, an astonishment, and a hissing, without inhabitant.
hmr: Babulon chu hmun dêng pâwng el, sihalhai ta dinga chêngna hmun ding le, maktia um ding le, hluotu um loa inchek khum el ding nîng a tih.

en: They shall roar together like young lions; they shall growl as lions’ whelps.
hmr: Sakeibaknei vânglaihai angin a ruolin inrûm an ta, sakeibaknei têhai angin innghir an tih.

en: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Suklum an ni pha chun, an ta dingin ruoi ṭhêng ka ta, anni chu sukrui ka ta, chuongchun, an hlim a, tho nâwk ta lo dinga kumkhuoa innaa chun an in theina dingin, LALPA chun a tih.

en: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he-goats.
hmr: Sa thattu kuoma berâmtehai ang le, kêlchalhai le berâmchalhai angin anni chu hung lâng ka tih.

en: How is Sheshach taken! and the praise of the whole earth seized! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
hmr: Sesak chu iengtiziea lâka um el, hnuoi pumpuiin an inpâkna chu maktia um el chu! Hnamhai laia chun iengtiziea Babulon chu râusana um el!

en: The sea is come up upon Babylon; she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
hmr: Babulon chunga chun tuisuo- riet chu a hung luong a, tuifâwn tamtakhai chun a hung inkhum tah a.

en: Her cities are become a desolation, a dry land, and a desert, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.
hmr: A khawpuihai chu râusan, ram ṭâwl, thlalêr ram, ram mi chêng nawna hmun, mihriem nau tukhawm sir ngai lo ram a lo ni tah a.

en: And I will execute judgment upon Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up; and the nations shall not flow any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
hmr: Babulona Bêl chu hrem ka tih; a ilem tahai khawm chu a baua in- thawkin hung la suokpêk ka tih; chuongchun, hnamhai chu ama kuoma chun luong hmunkhat ta ngai naw ni hai a, anih, Babulon kulbang chu chim a tih.

en: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and save yourselves every man from the fierce anger of Jehovah.
hmr: “Ka mihai, a sûnga inthawk chun fesuok unla, mi tin chu LALPA lunginsenna ṭiumtaka inthawk chun insandam seng ro.

en: And let not your heart faint, neither fear ye for the tidings that shall be heard in the land; for tidings shall come one year, and after that in another year shall come tidings, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
hmr: In lungrilhai chu thidang naw sienla, chu rama thuthang hriet ding lei khawm chun ṭi bawk naw ro; kum khat chu thuthang chu hung a ta, chu hnunga chun kum dangah thuthang bawk chu hung a tih, thawluina le, rorêltu le rorêltu inkalna dâm.

en: Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will execute judgment upon the graven images of Babylon; and her whole land shall be confounded; and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung mêk, Babulona milim kera siemhai chunga chun rorêl ka ta, a ram pumpui chu inzak a tih; a ithathai po po khawm chu a sûnga chun tlûng an tih.

en: Then the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for joy over Babylon; for the destroyers shall come unto her from the north, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, vân le hnuoi le an sûnga um po pohai chu Babulon chunga lâwm lei chun hla sak an ta; hmâr- tienga inthawkin a kuoma chun suk- setu a hung ding a ni sih a; LALPA chun a tih.

en: As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the land.
hmr: Babulon chun Israelin a thathai a lo intlûktir ta ang khan, ram po po thathai chu chuong ang bawk chun Babulona chun tlûng an tih.

en: Ye that have escaped the sword, go ye, stand not still; remember Jehovah from afar, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.
hmr: “Nangni kâwlhnâma inthawka suokthlenghai, fe unla, ngîr ṭawk ṭawk naw ro, hlataka inthawk chun LALPA chu hre zing unla, Jerusalem chu in lungrilah in hungtir hlak ro.

en: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach; confusion hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of Jehovah’s house.
hmr: Kâwkna chu ei hriet tâk leiin ei inzak a, buoinahai chun ei hmaihai khawm an inkhum tah a, LALPA ina hmun inthienga chun mikhuolhai chu an hung lût ta sih a.

en: Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will execute judgment upon her graven images; and through all her land the wounded shall groan.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta u, nihai chu a hung tlung mêk, a milim kera siem- hai chunga chun rorêlna nei ka ta, a ram sûng po poa chun hliemhai chu inrûm an tih, LALPAIN a tih.

en: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall destroyers come unto her, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Babulon chu vân chenin vûm sienkhawm, a hrâtna insâng khawm chu la sukhrât zuol pei sienkhawm, keia kuoma inthawkin suksetuhai an hung ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: The sound of a cry from Babylon, and of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
hmr: Babulona inthawka ṭap ri le, Kaldaihai rama suksietna nasatak chu e!

en: For Jehovah layeth Babylon waste, and destroyeth out of her the great voice; and their waves roar like many waters; the noise of their voice is uttered:
hmr: LALPA chun Babulon chu a suk- siet a, amaa inthawka râwl ropuitak chu a sukbohmang tah a; chun, an chângvêl chu tui tamtakhai angin an inrih a, an râwl rihai chu insuoin a um a;

en: for the destroyer is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, their bows are broken in pieces; for Jehovah is a God of recompenses, he will surely requite.
hmr: ama chunga chun suksetu chu a hung ta sih a, Babulon chung ngeia chun; a mi thilthawtheihai chu manin an um a, an thalngulhai khawm chu a tliek innawi vawng a; LALPA chu phuba latu Pathien a ni sih a, ama chun thung ngei ngei a tih.

en: And I will make drunk her princes and her wise men, her governors and her deputies, and her mighty men; and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chun, a lalhai le a mi varhai le, a rorêltuhai le, a lal aiawtuhai le a mi thilthawtheihai chu sukrui ka ta; kumkhuoa innaa chun in an ta, tho ta naw ni hai, Laltak, a hming khawm sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly overthrown, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the peoples shall labor for vanity, and the nations for the fire; and they shall be weary.
hmr: Babulon kulbang lientakhai khawm chu sukchim nîng an ta, a dai kawtkhârhai chu meia raw nîng an ta, a mipuihai chu a thlâwn elin inrim an ta, hnamhai khawm chu mei leiin inrim an ta, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih” tiin.

en: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was chief chamberlain.
hmr: A rorêl a kum li kuma, Juda lal Zedekia le Babulona an hang fe laia, Maaseia naupa Neria, chu naupa Seraia kuoma zâwlnei Jeremia thupêk thuhai chu. Tun Seraia chu khawtlâng hotu lien tak a na.

en: And Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written concerning Babylon.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Babulon chunga thil ṭha naw hung tlung ding- hai po po, Babulon chungchângthua thu zieka umhai po po chu, lekhabua chun a ziek a.

en: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, then see that thou read all these words,
hmr: Chun, Jeremia chun Seraia kuoma chun, “Babulona i va fe pha chun, hieng thuhai po po hi en la, tiem la,

en: and say, O Jehovah, thou hast spoken concerning this place, to cut it off, that none shall dwell therein, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
hmr: ‘Aw LALPA, nang chun hi hmun chungchâng thua hin, sât thlâk ding a nizie dâm, tukhawm an chêng naw dingzie dâm, mihriem amanih, ramsa amani khawm an chêng naw dingzie le, kumkhuoa râusan a ni dingzie chu i lo hril tah a,’ ti la.

en: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of the Euphrates:
hmr: Chun, hi lekhabu hi i tiem zo pha pha chun, lung leh khit dêng i ta, Euphrates vadunga chun va pei lût i tih;

en: and thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise again because of the evil that I will bring upon her; and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
hmr: chun, ‘Hieng ang bawk hin Babulon chu tlumhmang a ta, a chunga thil ṭha naw ka hung in- tlungtir dinghai lei chun tho nâwk ta ngai naw nih a, rimsi hle tâng an tih,’ ti rawh,” a ta. Jeremia thuhai chu chu chen chu a nih.

en: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
hmr: Zedekia chu rorêl a ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pakhat mi a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmpakhat sûng ro a rêl a; a nu hming chu, Libnaa Jeremia naunu Hamutal a nih.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
hmr: Chun, ama chun LALPA mit- hmua thil ṭha naw chu a thawh a, Jehoiakimin a thaw ang chie el kha.

en: For through the anger of Jehovah did it come to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
hmr: LALPA lunginsenna leia anni chu Juda le Jerusalema a hmaihmaa inthawka anni a pei suok hmakhat chun Zedekia chu Babulon lal chungah a hel zing a.

en: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it round about.
hmr: Chun, a rorêl kum kuona, thla sâwmnaa, chu thla ni sâwm ni chun Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar le, a si- paihai po po chu Jerusalem do ding chun an hung a, an umngha tah a; a vêl ela chun kulhai an bâwl khum tah a.

en: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
hmr: Chuongchun, khawpui chu lal Zedekia inlal kum sâwm pakhatna chen inhuolin a um a.

en: In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
hmr: A thla linaa, chu thla ni kuo ni chun khawpui sûnga ṭâmna chu a nasa ta êm êm a; chu rama mipuihai ta ding chun bei hrim a um ta nawh a.

en: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden (now the Chaldeans were against the city round about); and they went toward the Arabah.
hmr: Chun, khawpuia chun lamrel siem a ni tah a, lal huon sîra, bang pahnihai inkâra dai kawtkhâr lam- puia chun zânah indo mihai po po chu an tlân suok tah a (chuongchun, Kal- daihai chun khawpui chu a vêlin an umngha a na) Araba tieng lampuia chun an fe tah a.

en: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Kaldai sipaihai chun lal chu an hnawt tah a, Jeriko phairuoma chun Zedekia chu an va hnawt phâk tah a; chuongchun, a sipaihai po po chun ama chu an indar san tah a.

en: Then they took the king, and carried him up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment upon him.
hmr: Chun, lal chu an man a, Hamath rama Riblaa chun Babulon lal kuoma chun an ṭhuoi tah a; chun, ama chun a chungthu a lo rêlthlûk tah a.

en: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
hmr: Chun, Babulon lal chun a mit- hmu ngeia chun Zedekia naupasalhai chu a that tah a; chun, Riblaa chun Juda ram lalhai po po chu a that vawng bawk a.

en: And he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.
hmr: Chun, Zedekia mithai chu a kheldawkpêk a, Babulon lal chun ama chu thîrkawl ân buntir a, Babu- lon tieng a ṭhuoi a, a thi ni chenin lung inah a sie tah a.

en: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, thla nganaa, chu thla ni sâwm ni chun, chu chu Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar inlal kum sâwm- pakuona a nih; vêngtu hotu Nebuza- radan lal hmaa ngîr hlak chu Jerusalema chun a hung a,

en: And he burned the house of Jehovah, and the king’s house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, burned he with fire.
hmr: LALPA in le lal in chu a rawh a; Jerusalema in po pohai, in ropui takhai khawm chu meiin a raw tah a.

en: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.
hmr: Chun, Kaldai sipaihai vêngtu pâwlhai la umhai po po chun Jerusalem kulbang chu a vêlin an sukchim tah a.

en: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the poorest of the people, and the residue of the people that were left in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.
hmr: Chuongchun, vêngtu pâwl hotu Nebuzaradan chun, mi rimsihai pâwl le, khawpuia a mahlaa mâksana la um pâwlhai le, hung inrelruhai, Babulon lal kuoma hung tlân lûthai le, mipui la um sunhai hrim hrim chu sal dingin a ṭhuoi tâwl a.

en: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Nebuzaradan chun chu rama mi inrim zuol taluohai chu lo neitu dinghaia le, grêp huon enkawltu dinghaiah a mâksan a.

en: And the pillars of brass that were in the house of Jehovah, and the bases and the brazen sea that were in the house of Jehovah, did the Chaldeans break in pieces, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ina dârsen sût- puihai, dârsen maihûn le ân ṭhut- nahai LALPA ina umhai chu Kaldaihai chun an suknawi vawng a, a dârsenhai po po chu Babulon tieng chun an phur tah a.

en: The pots also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
hmr: Chun, bêlhai, vutluohai, mei chepnahai, maihûnhai, thîrhaihaw- hai, bûr le bêl dârsena siemhai po po rawngbâwlnaa an hmang hlakhai chu an lâk hmang vawng a.

en: And the cups, and the firepans, and the basins, and the pots, and the candlesticks, and the spoons, and the bowls—that which was of gold, in gold, and that which was of silver, in silver,—the captain of the guard took away.
hmr: Chun, nohai, vutluohai, mai- hûnhai, bêlhai, chawtawlhai, rângka- chaka siemhai chu rângkachakin tangkaruoa siemhai chu tangka- ruoin, vengtu pâwl sipai hotu chun a lâk vawng a.

en: The two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve brazen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made for the house of Jehovah—the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
hmr: Sûtpui pahnihai, chawtawl pakhat, ân ṭhutna hnuoia dârsen bâwngchal sâwm le pahni LALPA in ta dinga lal Solomonin a siemhai chu: hieng bûr le bêl dârsenhai po po hi a bûk chin hrietlo an nih.

en: And as for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a line of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers: it was hollow.
hmr: Sûtpui chungthua chun, sûtpui pakhat seizie chu tawng sâwmpariet a nih; chun, tawng sâwmpahni vêl- tuok a nih; chu chu sazie chu kut bel li bawk a na, kawrawng a nih.

en: And a capital of brass was upon it; and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the capital round about, all of brass: and the second pillar also had like unto these, and pomegranates.
hmr: Chun, a chunga chun dâra siem a lubâwk a um a, a lubâwk pakhat insângzie chu tawng nga a na, a vêl chun lênkal le, theibufai chu a lubâwk chunga dârsena siem vawng a um a, chun, sûtpui pahnina khawm chun chuong ang bawk chu, theibu- faihai le chun a ni ve bawk a.

en: And there were ninety and six pomegranates on the sides; all the pomegranates were a hundred upon the network round about.
hmr: A sîra chun theibufai chu sâwm- kuo le paruk an na; a lênkal chunga a vêla theibufai po po chu za a nih.

en: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold:
hmr: Chun, vêngtu pâwl hotu chun thiempu laltak Seraia le, a dawttu Zephania le, kawtkhâr vêngtu pathum a ṭhuoi a;

en: and out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war; and seven men of them that saw the king’s face, that were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the host, who mustered the people of the land; and threescore men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.
hmr: khawpui sûnga inthawk chun indo mihai enkawltu hotu a ṭhuoi bawk a; chun lal hmaa ngîr hlak, chu khawpuia hmua um mi pasari leh; indo mihai hotu ziektu, a ram mihai hming ziektu, le khawpui sûnga mi hmua um chu ram mi sâwmruk leh a ṭhuoi a.

en: And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
hmr: Chun, Nebuzaradan, vêngtu pâwl hotu chun anni chu a ṭhuoi a, Babulon lal kuomah Riblaa chun a hung ṭhuoi tâwl a.

en: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
hmr: Babulon lal chun anni chu a hrem a, Hamath rama Riblaa chun anni chu a that tâwl tah a. Chuong- chun, a rama inthawk chun Juda chu sala intâng dinga ṭhuoi a ni tah a.

en: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand Jews and three and twenty;
hmr: Hienghai hi Nebukadnezzarin sala intâng dinga a ṭhuoihai chu an nih: kum sari kum chun Juda mi sâng thum le sâwmhni pathum;

en: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty and two persons;
hmr: Nebukadnezzar inlal kum sâwmpariet kum chun Jerusalema inthawkin mi za riet le sâwmthum pahni a ṭhuoi a;

en: in the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons: all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.
hmr: Nebukadnezzar inlal kum sâwmhni pathum kum chun Nebuza- radan, vêngtu pâwl hotu chun Juda mi sala intâng ding chu za sari, sâwmli panga a ṭhuoi a; chuongchun, mihriem po po chu sâng li le za ruk an nih.Jehoiakin insuoa a um thu le Babulona chawisânga a um thu (2 Lal 25.27-30)

en: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the five and twentieth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison;
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Jehoiakin sala ân tâng kum sâwmthum pasa- rina, thla sâwm pahnina, chu thla ni sâwmhni panga ni chun Evil- merodak Babulon lal ân lal kum, kum khatnaa chun Juda lal Jehoiakin lu chu a dawm kâng a, lung ina inthawk chun a hung ṭhuoi suok tah a;

en: and he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon,
hmr: a kuoma chun ngilneitakin thu a hril a, a lalṭhungpha chu Babulona lal um mi danghai nêka insânga chun a siepêk a.

en: and changed his prison garments. And Jehoiachin did eat bread before him continually all the days of his life:
hmr: Chun, a lung in intângna silfênhai chu a thlengpêk a, a kuoma chun ni tinin a dam sûng po chu bu a fâk ve hlak a.

en: and for his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him by the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
hmr: Chun, a hlaw ding khawm Babulon lal chun a pêk zing a, a dam sûng nihai po poa chun, a thi hma- khat chun ni tin a chanpuol a pêk a.

en: Flee for safety, ye children of Benjamin, out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise up a signal on Beth-haccherem; for evil looketh forth from the north, and a great destruction.
hmr: Nangni Benjamin thlahai, Jeru- salem sûnga inthawk chun himna dingin tlânhmang ro; Tekoaa chun tawtawrâwt mût unla, Beth-hake- rema chun inchikna chu khai unla; thil ṭha naw chu, bohmangna le chun, hmâr tienga inthawk chun a hung dâk sih a.

en: The comely and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, will I cut off.
hmr: Ngainobei le inno Zion naunu chu sât thlâng ka tih.

en: Shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed every one in his place.
hmr: Berâmpuhai chu an ranruolhai leh a kuomah hung an ta; a vêla chun an puon inhai a vêlin kei khum an tih, mi tin chu mâni hmun senga chun fâk zawng an tih.

en: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day declineth, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
hmr: Ama chunga indona ding chu buotsai ro, tho unla, sûn hun laia chun hang thâwng ei tiu. Ei chung a va rik ngei de! ni chu ân hêm tah a, zântieng hlim chu ân khâw ta sih a.

en: Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
hmr: Tho unla, zâna chun hang fêng ei tiu, a in ropuihai chu hang suksieng ei tiu khai.

en: For thus hath Jehovah of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a lo ti ta sih a: Thinghai chu phûr thlu unla, Jerusalem chunga chun pil dêngpâwnghai chu siem ro, hi hi khawpui hremna ding chu a na, a sûnga chun innêksâwrna ringawt el a nih.

en: As a well casteth forth its waters, so she casteth forth her wickedness: violence and destruction is heard in her; before me continually is sickness and wounds.
hmr: Tuisunsuo chun a tuihai a phu- suok angin, a khawhlonahai chu a phusuok a; a sûnga chun inpâwng- nêkna le suksietna hriet a na, ka hmaa chun natna le hliemnahai chu a um zing zing a nih.

en: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from thee; lest I make thee a desolation, a land not inhabited.
hmr: Aw Jerusalem, inchûktirin in um tah, chuong naw chun, ka thla hin hransan rawi a ti che, chuong naw chun, râusan le ram hluo loah siem ka ti che.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn again thy hand as a grape-gatherer into the baskets.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Grêphrui angin Israel la um sunhai chu zenfai vawng an tih, grêp sîktuhai angin i kut chu paikâwnga chun ban nâwk rawh.

en: To whom shall I speak and testify, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of Jehovah is become unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.
hmr: An hriet theina dingin tu kuom am thuhrilin hrilfieng ka ta? Ngai ta, an nahai chu verlo an na, an hriet thei hrim hrim nawh! ngai ta, LALPA thu chu an kuoma chun inhalna ang chau a na, amaa chun lâwmna hrim an nei nawh.

en: Therefore I am full of the wrath of Jehovah; I am weary with holding in: pour it out upon the children in the street, and upon the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA lunginsenna chun ka sip a; insûm zing chu ka nghawk a nih; kawtthlêra chun nau- panghai laia chun bunthla la, tlang- vâl inkhâwmhai laia le chun; pasal chu a nuhmei le chun lâk nîng an ta, mi upatak le tartak khawm.

en: And their houses shall be turned unto others, their fields and their wives together; for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, an inhai, an lohai, an nuhmeihai chu mi danghai kuoma pêk nîng an ta; ram hluotuhai chunga chun ka kut kân let ding a ni sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
hmr: Anni laia a chîn taka inthawka anni laia a lien tak chenin, inîtthîk tuonain an sip a; zâwlneihaia in- thawka thiempuhai chen khawmin, mi tin el chun indik lotakin an thawh a.

en: They have healed also the hurt of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
hmr: Thlamuongna chu a um naw sa khawma, “Thlamuongna, thlamuong- na,” tiin, ka mihai insuknatnahai khawm chu an sukdam met chau a.

en: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall; at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Thil tirdakumhai an thaw chun an inzapui am? An inzapui hlawl nawh, an hmai khawm a mâwk nawh; chuleichun, a tluhai lai ma chun anni khawm tlu vêng an tih; ka va hrem pha chun anni chu pei thlûk nîng an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Stand ye in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way; and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls: but they said, We will not walk therein.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Lampuiahai chun ngîr unla, en ta u, lampui ṭha hluihai chu indawn unla, “lampui ṭha chu khâw lai am a na; chu chu hraw unla, in thlarau ta dingin châwlna hmûng in tih,” tiin;

en: And I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet; but they said, We will not hearken.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, “Chu chu hraw naw ning ungah,” an tih a. Chun, in chunga chun vêngtu ka sieh a, “Taw- tawrâwt ri chu lo ngai ta u,” tiin, nisienlakhawm, anni chun, “Ngai naw ning ungah,” an tih a.

en: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.
hmr: Chuleiin, hnamhai, lo ngai unla, lo hre ta u, aw inkhâwmhai, anni laia thil um chu.

en: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words; and as for my law, they have rejected it.
hmr: Aw leihnuoi, lo hre ta, ngai ta, ka thuhai chu an ngai naw leiin hi hnam chunga hin thil ṭha naw, an ngaituonahai ra ngei chu kân tlungtir ding a nih; ka dân hlak chu an lo hnâwl a.

en: To what purpose cometh there to me frankincense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt-offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices pleasing unto me.
hmr: Ram hlataka inthawka mafuhai le, Seba-a inthawka berawhai chu ieng kawngroa ka kuoma hung am an ni leh? In pumrawhmang thilinhlân- hai chu pawm a ni nawh a, in in- thâwinahai khawm chu ka ta dingin lâwmum a ni nawh.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will lay stumbling-blocks before this people; and the fathers and the sons together shall stumble against them; the neighbor and his friend shall perish.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, hi hnam hmaa hin tlûkna lunghai chu sieng ka ta, chuong chunga chun pahai le naupa- salhai chu insuithlu hmunkhat an ta; tuolbâwm le a ruol khawm chu bohmang bawk an tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, a people cometh from the north country; and a great nation shall be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ngai ta, Hmâr tieng rama inthawkin hnam pakhat a hung a, leihnuoi kil khâwrtaka inthawk chun hnam ropuitak chu suktho nîng a tih.

en: They lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea, and they ride upon horses, every one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Zion.
hmr: Thalngul le fei an chawi a; an râwng hle a, lunginsietna hrim an nei dêr nawh; an râwl chu tuisuoriet angin ân hawk a, anni chu sakawr chunghaia chun an chuong a; mi tin el chu indonaa angin, i chunga chun, aw Zion naunu, an hung intlar a nih.

en: We have heard the report thereof; our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
hmr: Chu thuthang chu kan lo hriet a; kan kuthai chu a hung châu a, lungzîngna chun keini a mi man a, nuhmei nauhase nat tuor ang el chun keini chu a mi chip a nih.

en: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy, and terror, are on every side.
hmr: Lohaia chun fe suok naw unla, lampuia khawm chun fe naw ro; hmêlma kâwlhnâm le ṭitumna chu sîr tin ela chun a um sih a.

en: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come upon us.
hmr: Aw ka chipui naunu, saiip puonin inbel la, pilvuta chun inbuol rawh; naupasal khât sûn angin sûn la, sûnna natak el chun, ei chunga chun suksetu chu a hung vak ding a ni sih a.

en: I have made thee a trier and a fortress among my people; that thou mayest know and try their way.
hmr: Ka mihai laia chun vêngna in insânga le kulpuiah ka siem cheh a, an lampui chu i hriet a, i fie theina dingin.

en: They are all grievous revolters, going about with slanders; they are brass and iron: they all of them deal corruptly.
hmr: An rêngin nuora helhai chu an na, hmurthiemhai le chun an invâk a, dârsen le thîrhai an na, an rêng el chun setak el chun an thaw a nih.

en: The bellows blow fiercely; the lead is consumed of the fire: in vain do they go on refining; for the wicked are not plucked away.
hmr: Pûmthei chu ṭiumtakin ân thlih a, suon chu mei ikâng hmang chun a um a, a thlâwn elin sukfainaa chun an feh a, mi rilohai chu lâk hmang an ni si nawh a.

en: Refuse silver shall men call them, because Jehovah hath rejected them.
hmr: Mihai chun anni chu tangkaruo hnâwla umhai tîng an ta, LALPA chun anni chu a lo hnâwl tâk lei khan.

en: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
hmr: LALPA kuoma inthawka Jeremia kuoma thu hung chu:

en: Stand in the gate of Jehovah’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of Jehovah, all ye of Judah, that enter in at these gates to worship Jehovah.
hmr: “LALPA in dai kawtkhâra chun ngîr la, chutaka chun hi thu hi phuongdar la, hieng hin hril rawh: LALPA be dinga hi dai kawtkhârhaia lût, nangni Juda mihai po po, LALPA thu hi lo hre ta u.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
hmr: Israel Pathien, sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: In lampuihai le in thilthawhai chu sukṭha unla, hi hmuna hin inchêngtir ka ti cheu,

en: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, are these.
hmr: ‘LALPA biekin chu, LALPA biek- in chu, LALPA biekin chu hi hi a nih,’ ti thukhêl dâm hi ring naw ro.

en: For if ye thoroughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye thoroughly execute justice between a man and his neighbor;
hmr: In lampuihai le in thilthawhai chu in siem ṭha a; mi le a tuolbâwm kara rorêlna tlangtaka in sukthlûk- pêk a,

en: if ye oppress not the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your own hurt:
hmr: mikhuolhai chu in nêksâwr nawh a, pa nei lohai le hmeithaihai leh; hi hmuna hin mi thiem thisen chu in insuo naw bawk a, nangni le nangni insukpawina dingin pathien danghai chu in zui bawk naw chun,

en: then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old even for evermore.
hmr: in thlatuhai kuoma ram ka i pêk tah, inhmaa inthawka kumkhaw- tluong elin, hi hmuna hin inchêngtir ka ti cheu.

en: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thukhêlhliphai, ṭhat- hnemna neilohai chu in ring a.

en: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods that ye have not known,
hmr: Inruin, tuolthatin, uirein, khêla inkhâmin, Baal hmaa chun rimin- hnik rawin pathien in hriet nawhai chu zuiin,

en: and come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered; that ye may do all these abominations?
hmr: ‘Sansuokin ei um tah’ tiin, hieng thil pawrchehai po po hi thaw dingin hi in ka hming chawisana hin hungin ka hmaa chun in hung ngîr ding am a nih?

en: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Hi in ka hming chawi hi in mit- hmua chun inruhai pûk a lo ni ta a ni maw? Ngai ta u, keiin, keima ngeiin ka hmu tah, LALPA chun a tih.

en: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin ka hmun Siloa chun fe unla, a tira inthawka ka hming kân umtir zingnaa chun; ka mi Israelhai khawhlona leia thil ka ithawhai chu va hmu ta u.

en: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith Jehovah, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not:
hmr: Chun, tuhin LALPA chun, ‘Hieng thilthawhai po po hi in thaw ta leiin, inhmataka thoa thu hrilin, in kuoma ngei chun thu ka lo hril tah a; nisienlakhawm, in ngai si nawh a; ka ko cheu a, in mi dawn nawh a;

en: therefore will I do unto the house which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.
hmr: chuleiin, in thlatuhai le nangni kuoma ka pêk, hmun le in ringna innghatna, ka hming chawia ko, in chunga chun, Siloa chunga ka lo thaw ta ang bawk khan ka thaw ding a nih.

en: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.
hmr: Ephraim chihai po po, in unauhai po po kha ka lo hnawt suok ta ang khan ka mithmua inthawk hnawt suok ka ti cheu.

en: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me; for I will not hear thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, hi hnam ta ding hin ṭawngṭai naw la, an ta dingin ṭawng- ṭaina amanih, râwl amani khawm insuo naw rawh; chun, ka kuoma khawm hnina khawm hung siem bawk naw rawh; ka lo ngai âwm si naw cheh a.

en: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
hmr: Jerusalem kawtthlêrahai le Juda khawpuihaia an thawhai chu i hmu nâwm a nih?

en: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
hmr: Naupanghai chun thing an inkhâwm a, pahai chun mei an sêm a, nuhmeihai chun bei an hmet a; vân lalnu ta dinga beithlum siem dingin le, lunginsennaa an mi chawktho theina dinga pathien danghai kuoma dâwnmi thilinhlânhai dâm chu bur dingin.

en: Do they provoke me to anger? saith Jehovah; do they not provoke themselves, to the confusion of their own faces?
hmr: Kei chu an mi suklungsen am a nih? LALPA chun a tih; an inzakna dingin, anni le anni chu an insuk- lungsen a ni nâwm a nih?

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, mine anger and my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, ka lungin- senna le ka ṭiumna chu hi hmuna hin bunthlâk nîng a ta, mihriem chunga le, ramsahai chunga le, rama thing- hai chunga le, hnuoia rahai chunga chun; chun, kâng a ta, ṭhel ni ngai naw ni.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt-offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat ye flesh.
hmr: Israel Pathien, sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: In inthâwina- haia chun in pumrawhmang thilin- hlânhai chu belsa unla, sa chu fa ro.

en: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt-offerings or sacrifices:
hmr: Inthâwinahai le pumrawhmang thilinhlân chungthua hin Aigupta rama inthawka anni ka hung ṭhuoi suok nia chun, in thlatuhai kuoma chun thu hrilin, thupêk ka lo nei nawh;

en: but this thing I commanded them, saying, Hearken unto my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people; and walk ye in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, hi thua hin thu ka pêk a, “Ka râwl hi ngai unla, in Pathien nîng ka ta, nangni khawm ka mihai nîng in tih; chun, thu ka pêk cheu po po kha hraw unla, in ta dingin ṭhâng a tih,” tiin.

en: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in their own counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an ngai nawh a, an na khawm an sit bawk nawh a, amiruokchu, anni remruotnaa le, an lungril rilo kâwmâwna chu hrawin, hmatiengah ni loin an kîr nâwk ta lem a.

en: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day, I have sent unto you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:
hmr: In thlatuhai Aigupta rama inthawka an hung suok nia inthawka vawisûn ni chen hin ni tin inhmatak- in thoin, ka zâwlneihai ka siehlawhai po po chu an kuomah ka hung tir a;

en: yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff: they did worse than their fathers.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, keia thu chu an ngai chuong nawh a, an na khawm an sit bawk nawh a, an rîng chu an suktlûn a, an thlatuhai nêkin an thaw ṭha naw lem tah a.

en: And thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
hmr: Chun, hieng thuhai po po hi an kuoma chun i hril ding a nih; ami- ruokchu, i thu chu ngai naw ni hai; anni chu ko bawk i ta, nisienla- khawm, dawn naw ni hai che.

en: And thou shalt say unto them, This is the nation that hath not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah their God, nor received instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun, “LALPA an Pathien râwl khawm ngai loa, inchûktirna khawm pawm bawk lohai chu hi hnam hi an nih; thudik chu a riral a, an baua inthawk chun sât thlâkin a um a,” tîng i tih.

en: Cut off thy hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for Jehovah hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
hmr: Aw Jerusalem, i sam chu tan rawh, peihâwn la, bâwlhmun tlânga- hai chun sûnna siem rawh; LALPA chun a lunginsenna thlahai chu a nghatsanin a hnâwl ta sih a.

en: For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight, saith Jehovah: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
hmr: Juda thlahai chun ka mithmua thil ṭha naw chu an lo thaw ta sih a, LALPA chun a tih: sukpawrche ding- in, in ka hming chawia koa chun an tirdakumnahai chu an sie tah a.

en: And they have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded not, neither came it into my mind.
hmr: Hinnom naupa ruoma chun Topheth bâwlhmunhai chu an naupa- salhai le an naunuhmeihai meia an rawna dingin an bâwl tah a; chuong chu thu ka pêk ngai nawh a, ka lungrila khawm lût khawm a hung lût ngai nawh.

en: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter: for they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place to bury.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta, a nihai a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih; Topheth amanih, Hinnom naupa ruom ama- nih ti ni ta ngai naw nih a, Inthatna ruom ti ni lem tâng a tih, hi Topheth hmuna hin inphûmna hmun ding a um naw chen khawma an inphûm ding a ni sih a.

en: And the dead bodies of this people shall be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall frighten them away.
hmr: Chuongchun, hieng mipuihai ruonghai hi, chunglêng vatehai ta dinga bu nîng a ta, ramsahai ta ding khawma; tukhawma an hnawt hmang âwm si nawh a.

en: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a waste.
hmr: Chun, Juda khawpuihaia in- thawk le Jerusalem kawtthlêrhaia inthawk chun hlimna râwl dâm, lâwmna râwl dâm, moneitu râwl dâm, mo râwl dâm inrêtir ka tih; ram chu suksiet a ni ding a ni sih a.

en: At that time, saith Jehovah, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;
hmr: Chu huna chun, LALPA chun a tih: Juda lalhai ruhai, a rorêltu- hai ruhai, thiempuhai ruhai, zâwlnei- hai ruhai, Jerusalem hluotuhai ruhai chu an thlânhaia inthawkin hung la suok an ta,

en: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, which they have loved, and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
hmr: nisa dâm, thla dâm, vâna umhai po po, an hmangaia a rawng an lo bâwlhai, an zawnga an biekhai hmaa chun keidar an tih; lâk khâwm ni naw ni haia, phûm khawm ni bawk naw ni hai, hnuoia êkdûra ṭhang ding ni lem an tih.

en: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chun, hi sûngkuo rilo la umsun- hai, ka hnawt hmangna hmuna la umhai chun, hring nêkin thi thlang lem an tih, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah: Shall men fall, and not rise up again? Shall one turn away, and not return?
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu an kuomah hi hi hril i tih: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Mihai chu tlûng an ta, an tho nâwk ta naw ding maw? Mi chu fe hmang a ta, a hung kîr nâwk ta naw ding maw?

en: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.
hmr: Iengtiziea hieng Jerusalema mihai hi hnungtawl sawng zingnaa an hnungtawl am a na? Hlêmna chu an chel det tlat a, kîr nâwk an nuom nawh a.

en: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repenteth him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turneth to his course, as a horse that rusheth headlong in the battle.
hmr: Ka ngai a, ka lo hriet a, anachu, thudik an hril nâwk a, mi tukhawm, “Ieng am ka lo thaw ta leh,” tiin a khawhlonaa inthawk chun ân sîr nawh a, mi tin chun mâni lampui seng an hrawh a, indonaa sakawr tlân bingbilet ang chun.

en: Yea, the stork in the heavens knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle-dove and the swallow and the crane observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the law of Jehovah.
hmr: Anih, chunga vakâwl chun ama hun ruot chu a hriet a; vaṭhuhai, pelêuhai, vangalsânghai an hunah an hung tlung a, ka mihai ruok chun LALPA thupêk an hriet nawh.

en: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of Jehovah is with us? But, behold, the false pen of the scribes hath wrought falsely.
hmr: Iengtiziein am, “Kan var a, LALPA dân chu kan kuomah a um annâwm” in ti a na? Nisienlakhawm, ngai ta u, lekhaziektuhai ziekhmawl indik naw chun indik lotakin a lo thaw tah a.

en: The wise men are put to shame, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of Jehovah; and what manner of wisdom is in them?
hmr: Mi varhai chu an inzak a, sukbei- dawngin an um a, ṭhuoi hmangin an um a; en ta u, LALPA thu chu an dit naw chu: annia chun ieng ang varna hrim am a um a na?

en: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall possess them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
hmr: Chuleiin, an nuhmeihai chu mi danghai kuomah pêng ka ta, an lohai chu a neitu dinghai kuomah pêng ka tih; mi tin el chu a chîn taka in- thawka a lien tak chenin, inîtthîk- nain an sip sih a; zâwlneia inthawk thiempu chenin indik lotakin an thaw bawk a.

en: And they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
hmr: Chun, thlamuongna ding a um naw sain, “Thlamuongna, thla- muongna,” tiin, ka chipui naunu in- suknatna chu an sukdam met chau a.

en: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among them that fall; in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Thil tirdakum an thaw lai chun inzapui an ti? An inzapui hlawl nawh; an hmai khawm a mâwk nawh a, chuleiin, a tluhai laia chun tlu vêng an ta, anni chu hrem an ni huna chun, LALPA chun a tih.

en: I will utterly consume them, saith Jehovah: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig-tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
hmr: Anni chu kâng hmang letdêr ka tih, LALPA chun a tih; grêphruiahai chun grêp um naw nih a, theichang kûngahai khawm chun theichang um naw nih a, a hna khawm chu vuoi a tih; chun, an kuoma thil ka pêkhai khawm chu annia inthawk chun fe hmang a tih.

en: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the fortified cities, and let us be silent there; for Jehovah our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against Jehovah.
hmr: Iengdinga ei ṭhung zing am? Hung inkhâwm unla, khawpui kul neiahai chun lût ei ta, chutaka chun bohmang el ei tiu; LALPA chunga chun thil ei lo suksuol ta leiin, LALPA ei Pathien chun bohmangnaa um dingin a mi sie tah a, tûr pawl tui chu dâwn dingin a mi pêk tah a.

en: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!
hmr: Thlamuongna ding ei enkai hlak a, nisienlakhawm, thil ṭha hrim a hung tlung nawh a; sukdamna ding huna dâm chun, ngai ta, beidawngna lem!

en: The snorting of his horses is heard from Dan: at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones the whole land trembleth; for they are come, and have devoured the land and all that is in it; the city and those that dwell therein.
hmr: Dana inthawk chun a sakawr- hai hnâr hnâwt ri chu ân hriet a; a mi hrât hung inhrosatna ria chun ram pumpui chu ân hnîng a. Anni chu an hung a, ram po po le a sûnga umhai chu an fâk zo sih a; khawpui le a sûnga chênghai le khawm chun.

en: For, behold, I will send serpents, adders, among you, which will not be charmed; and they shall bite you, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Ngai ta u, nangni lai chun rûlhai, rûltûrneihai sukngam thei ngailo dinghai chu ka hung tir ding a nih; chuongchun, chuk an ti cheu, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow! my heart is faint within me.
hmr: Aw lungngainaa inthawk hin keima le keima bêk inthlamuong thei lang chu; ka sûnga chun ka lung hlak chu a thidang sih a.

en: Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off: is not Jehovah in Zion? is not her King in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with foreign vanities?
hmr: Ka chipuihai naunu ram hla- taka inthawka a khêkri chu lo ngai ta u, “LALPA chu Zionah a um a ni naw am a nih? a Laltak chu a sûnga chun a um nâwm a nih? An milim ker fâwmhai le teplo thil maktakhai chun iengdinga lunginsen dinga an mi chawktho am a na?” tiin.

en: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.
hmr: Busîk hun chu a liem tah a, nipui hun chu a tâwp tah, sandamin ei um nawh.

en: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt: I mourn; dismay hath taken hold on me.
hmr: Ka chipuihai naunu suknatnaa chun suknat vein ka um a, ka thla ân vai a, beidawngnain a mi chel tlat a.

en: Is there no balm in Gilead? is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
hmr: Gileada hin thinghnai damdawi a um naw maw? Chutaka chun dam- dawi thiem mi an um naw maw? Chuong a ni chun ieng dinga ka chi- puihai naunu chu sukdam a ni nâwm a na?

en: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
hmr: Aw ka chipuihai naunu sukhluma um chu a sûn a zâna ka ṭa theina dingin ka lu hi tuihai ni sienla, ka mithai hi mitthli tuikhurhai hung ni sien chu!

en: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging-place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they are all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
hmr: Ka chipuihai hi ka mâksana, an kuoma inthawka ka fe theina dingin, thlalêra hin khuol inzinhai riekna hmun nei lang chu aw! anni chu uirehai le, mi khawhlohai um khâwm an ni vawng el sih a.

en: And they bend their tongue, as it were their bow, for falsehood; and they are grown strong in the land, but not for truth: for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Thudik nawa dingin an thalngul ang elin an lei chu an thlep a; chu rama chun thahrâttakin an hung inṭhang a, thudika ruok chun ni loin; thil suola inthawkin thil suola vêk chun an pakai a, kei khawm an mi hriet hlawl nawh, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Take ye heed every one of his neighbor, and trust ye not in any brother; for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbor will go about with slanders.
hmr: Mi tinin mâni tuolbâwmhai pawisa seng unla, unau ieng ang khawm chu ring naw ro; unau tinhai chu mâni hmasieltak el, tuolbâwm tinhai khawm chu thukhêl le invâk mi an ni âwm sih a.

en: And they will deceive every one his neighbor, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies; they weary themselves to commit iniquity.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi tin chun mâni tuolbâwm chu hlêm a ta, thu dik hril naw ni; an lei chu khêlthu hril dingin an inchûktir tah a; thil suol thaw dingin anni le anni chu an insuk- lungzîng a.

en: Thy habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith Jehovah.
hmr: I chêngna hmun chu inhlêmna lailia chun a na; inhlêmna lei chun kei mi hriet khawm chu an nuom naw a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how else should I do, because of the daughter of my people?
hmr: Chuleiin, sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, anni chu suktui ka ta, ka fie ding a nih; ka chipuihai naunu lei chun ieng dang am thaw tâng ka ta?

en: Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth, but in his heart he layeth wait for him.
hmr: An lei chu thi theina thal a na; thukhêl a hril a, mi pakhatin a tuol- bâwm kuomah a bau chun thla- muongumtakin thu a hril a, nisien- lakhawm, a lungril chun ama chu ân chân rûk zing a.

en: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
hmr: Hieng thilhai lei hin ka hrem hrim naw ding am a nih? LALPA chun a tih; hnam hieng ang hai chunga hin ka thlarau chun phuba a lâk naw ding am a nih?

en: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none passeth through; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the birds of the heavens and the beasts are fled, they are gone.
hmr: An kâng zo tah a, tukhawm an fe tlang ta ngai naw leiin, tlânghai ta ding chun sûnin ṭapinrûm ka ta, thlalêra tlatna hmunhai ta ding chun sûn ka tih; mihai chun ran ruol râwl khawm chu hre thei ta naw ni hai a; chunglêng vatehai le ramsahai khawm chu an tlânse tah a, an tlân- hmang tah.

en: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, a dwelling-place of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem chu hmun- hnawk intiengkhâwmna le, satene- hai ta dinga chêngna hmunah siem ka tih; Juda khawpuihai khawm chu hluotu um loa râusanah siem bawk ka tih. Hi hi hrethiem thei dinga mi var tu am a um a?

en: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken, that he may declare it? wherefore is the land perished and burned up like a wilderness, so that none passeth through?
hmr: Hi hi a hrilfie theina dinga LALPA bauin a kuoma thu a lo hrilna chu tu am a na? Ieng leia ram chu thlalêr anga a kâng a, a bohmang a, tukhawm an fe thleng ta nâwm a na?

en: And Jehovah saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein,
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: An hmaa dân ka sie chu an nghatsan a, ka râwl khawm an awi nawh a, chu- taka chun an fe bawk naw leiin a nih;

en: but have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baalim, which their fathers taught them;
hmr: nisienlakhawm, an lungril ngarna ang pei chu an hraw lem a, Baal hnung chu an zui a, an thlatu- haiin anni an lo inchûktir ta ang khan;

en: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
hmr: chuleiin, sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, hi hnam hi, anni ngei hi sairam khâin vai ka ta, tûr pawl tui dâwn dingin pêng ka tih.

en: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them.
hmr: An thlatuhai le anni khawma an hriet ngailo hnamhai laia chun sukdar ka ta; anni chu ka sukbo- hmang vawng hmakhat chun an hnungah kâwlhnâm tir ka tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for the skilful women, that they may come:
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Nangnîn ngaituo unla, an hung theina dingin nuhmei ṭapthiemhai ko ro; chun, an hung theina dingin nuhmei vervêkhai chu inkotir bawk unla,

en: and let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.
hmr: hung inhmaw hai sienla, ei ta dingin ṭapinrûm raw hai se, ei mithai chu mitthlia a far theina ding le, ei mitvunhai chun tui a phusuok theina dingin.

en: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we ruined! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because they have cast down our dwellings.
hmr: Ziona inthawk chun ṭapinrûm ri chu hriet a ni sih a; Ei siet nasat tâkzie chu! ram chu ei nghatsan a, ei chêngnahai chu an sukchim tâk leiin nasataka sukbuoiin ei um a.

en: Yet hear the word of Jehovah, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth; and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbor lamentation.
hmr: Aw nangni nuhmeihai, LALPA thu chu la lo ngai unla, in nahai chun a baua thusuok chu hre sienla, mi tinin mâni naunuhmeihai seng chu ṭapinrûm inchûktir sienla, mi tinin a tuolbâwm chu sûn dân inchûktir raw se.

en: For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces; to cut off the children from without, and the young men from the streets.
hmr: Thina chu ei tukverhaia chun a hung a, ei in ropuiahai chun a hung lût sih a; kawtthlêra inthawka tlang- vâlhai le, puotienga inthawka nau- panghai chu sâtthla dingin.

en: Speak, Thus saith Jehovah, The dead bodies of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman; and none shall gather them.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Thu chu hril rawh, hmun âwlahai chun mihriem ruonghai chu êkdûr ang chun tlâng an ta, busîk hnunga hmu ṭhel ang chau chun, tukhawma la khâwm naw ni.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches;
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: mi var chun a varna suong naw raw se; mi thilthawthei khawm chun a thilthawtheina suong bawk naw raw se; mi hausa khawm chu a hausakna suong bawk naw raw se;

en: but let him that glorieth glory in this, that he hath understanding, and knoweth me, that I am Jehovah who exerciseth lovingkindness, justice, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith Jehovah.
hmr: a suong taphawt chun hi hi suong lem raw se, kei hi LALPA lung- insietna neia, rorêla, hnuoi chunga hin felna thil thaw hlak chu ka nih ti hre a hrietthiemna chu suong lem raw se; hieng thilhaia hin ka lâwm sih a, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will punish all them that are circumcised in their uncircumcision:
hmr: Ngai ta, nihai chu a hung tlung, LALPA chun a tih; sertan ni sia sertanlohai po po chu hrem ka ta,

en: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that have the corners of their hair cut off, that dwell in the wilderness; for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart.
hmr: Aigupta dâm, Juda dâm, Edom dâm, Ammon thlahai le, Moab thla- hai, barêp hmul vawa thlalêra chêng- hai po po le chun, chuong hnamhai po po chu sertan lo an na, Israel sûng- kuohai po po chu lungrila sertan lo an nih.
